story:
THE BOOK

Ream Eyso and Moni Mekhala retells the sacred drama of the same name, a tale in which rivaling students of a powerful hermit bring life to lightning, thunder, and rain.  Weaving together interviews, essays, photographs, and illustrations, the book uses the story to explore the evolution of the Khmer classical dance tradition, the passage of leadership within artistic lineages, and the circumstances of today's women.  Contributors include award-winning choreographer Sophiline Cheam Shapiro, dance scholar Toni Shapiro-Phim, and visual artist Brian Mendez.

KHMER CLASSICAL DANCE

Developed over a thousand years ago as a prayer in movement for the deliverance of rain, fertility, and well-being, Khmer classical dance is a potent symbol of Cambodia's history and identity.  The art form suffered a great loss from 1975 - 1979 when communist radicals known as the Khmer Rouge took power and sought to create an egalitarian peasant society.  They brought about the deaths of nearly a third of Cambodia's entire population—included in that number were an estimated 90% of Khmer classical dance artists.  Following this tragic loss, dancers worked in the shadow of genocide and trauma to revive their art and the spirit of their people.  Today, nearly 40 years later, Cambodia's classical dancers still work in an environment of uncertainty as they breathe new life into their venerable heritage.

20 GOOD PEOPLE

I am looking for 20 good people to help me share the story of Ream Eyso and Moni Mekhala with the world.  Your support will allow me to print 50 exclusive print copies of the book, which will be given to a hand-picked group of people and institutions that I have identified to be caretakers of Khmer dance.  Your contributions will also allow me to publish Ream Eyso and Moni Mekhala as an e-book, ensuring that the rich knowledge it contains remains accessible to all.  Proceeds from the e-book will be donated to Khmer Arts, a transnational organization at the forefront of Khmer classical dance practice.

THE TEAM

SOPHILINE CHEAM SHAPIRO is an internationally known choreographer, dancer and educator whose groundbreaking creative works, which have been performed on major stages across four continents, have infused the venerable Cambodian classical dance form with new energy and ideas.  She is the recipient of many honors, including National Heritage, USA Knight, Creative Capital, Guggenheim, Durfee and Irvine Dance Fellowships, plus the Nikkei Asia Prize for Culture.  Her essays have been published widely, and she’s a much sought after speaker.  She holds a degree in classical dance from Phnom Penh’s National School of Fine Arts and a BA in dance ethnology from UCLA.

TONI SHAPIRO-PHIM is a cultural anthropologist and dance ethnologist with a specialization in the arts of Cambodia. She first conducted fieldwork in Cambodia in the early 1990s, and worked in Cambodian, Lao and Vietnamese refugee camps in Thailand and Indonesia before that. She received her Ph.D. from Cornell University, writing about the relationship between war and dance in Cambodia, and has held research and teaching positions focused on arts and social justice at the University of California, Berkeley (South and Southeast Asian Studies Department), Mills College (Women’s Leadership Institute), Yale University (Cambodian Genocide Program) and, most recently, at Bryn Mawr College (Anthropology and Dance Departments). She has participated in workshops and training on creativity and conflict transformation at the European Graduate School in Saas-Fee, Switzerland and at Brandeis University’s Center for Ethics, Justice and Public Life.

Her writing has appeared in books on genocide (Annihilating Difference: the Anthropology of Genocide, 2002) and conflict transformation (Dancing at the Crossroads, in press), in journals and magazines about Asia and the arts, including Fiber Arts, Dance Research Journal and Asian Arts and Culture, and in international encyclopedias such as The Encyclopedia of Asian Theatre, 2007 and the Oxford Encyclopedia of Theatre and Performance, 2001. She is a co-editor of Dance, Human Rights and Social Justice: Dignity in Motion, 2008, and co-author of Dance in Cambodia, 1999.

She has received American Association of University Women, Asian Cultural Council, Hawaii Committee for the Humanities, Fulbright and MacArthur Foundation Peace Studies grants and fellowships, among other awards.

PRUMSODUN OK is guided by love. He works to positively transform our world through his practice as an artist, teacher, storyteller and idea generator. His interdisciplinary performances contemplate Rene Daumal’s expression of “the avant-garde in antiquity,” mining the tradition of Cambodian classical dance to explore the intersection of contemporary social issues with new possibilities for performance. Prum has presented his original works at venues such as REDCAT (NOW Festival 2012, Studio 2009 & 2010), Highways, KUNST-STOFF arts/fest, CounterPULSE and Pieter among others. His writings have been published by the Alliance for California Traditional Arts (ACTA), Salon.com, LA Stage Times, In Dance Magazine and featured by the California Dance Network. Among many honors, Prum is a TED Fellow, a Master Artist in ACTA's Apprenticeship Program, an Association of Performing Arts Presenters Artist Fellow, and was a mentee to Oguri through the Choreographers in Mentorship Exchange Grant. Currently, he is Associate Artistic Director of Khmer Arts and serves on the board of the Alliance for California Traditional Arts. Prum's projects in progress include an innovative book titled Ream Eyso and Moni Mekhala, a "musical" to be performed in Cambodian dance ritual, and the Sala Center for Art and Culture. To be based in central Long Beach—the poorest but most culturally dynamic area of the city—Sala will provide a platform for traditional performing artists to inspire young people, nurture healthy communities, and redefine the landscape of art and culture.

Last, and most certainly not least, Prum is forever thankful to the many teachers and mentors who have graced his life: dancers Sophiline Cheam Shapiro and Oguri; vanguard composer Charles Boone; filmmakers Ernie Gehr, Brook Hinton, Jeanne Liotta, and George Kuchar; opera director Peter Sellars; and scholars David Gere and Anurima Banerji.

Drawing, for BRIAN MENDEZ, is a dialogue and collaboration with the natural world. The process of putting graphite to paper’s surface and fibers is a communion with these materials’ origins: the trees, forests, soil, and earth. By this action, communication with the materiality of all life on earth is allowed.

In his practice, Brian looks to the paper’s surface to speak to him, to respond to his hand’s movements and to guide it. He considers the result a symbiotic design, a glimpse of the world's collective ancestry, and a meditation on our relationship to nature and time. Brian considers the symbols that emerge from the collaboration to be an appeal to the visceral in all of us, an attempt at cataloguing the unnoticed and ignored which abounds, and the markings that we see when we close our eyes but do not sleep. The work is about reconciling with our environments and it is a hope of discovering what has been forgotten and lost.

story:
Bring the undead to life!


My name is Joseph Coley. I am a 34 year-old EMT-Enhanced living in the hills of Southwest Virginia, and I am the author of the Six Feet From Hell series.
I wrote the Six Feet From Hell series initially as a way to escape into my own world and to explore my creativity. Once I started the series, I had no idea that it would become as successful as it has. the series has sold over 13,000 copies in digital format, but I want to take it to the next level!

The books average a 4.5 star review with over 120 reviews for the series!

Publishing as an indie author is expensive. When you have a publisher, they take care of you PR, cover art, editing and other costs. As an indie author, I have to pay for those things myself. 
  • Cover art (digital) - $100 per book = $500
  • Cover art conversion to paperback - $35 per book = $175
  • Copy Editing and formatting for paperback, per 55,000 words (roughly one book) - $330 x 5 books= $1,650
  • Total cost = $2,325 (roughly)
That's quite a bit of dough for someone who makes $25k a year. I work full-time as an EMT in Tazewell, Virginia, and - as people in the business know - it doesn't pay very well. That being said, the money from digital sales of the series helps with day-to-day expenses (A guy has to pay bills, right?) 
I would love to be able to give something physical back to those who support my writing career, so those who donate (assuming the campaign nets all the money needed) will be treated with an array of perks (see sidebar)



Other Ways You Can Help!

If you can't send money, then help spread the word!

Share links to the Six Feet From Hell series ebooks!

Six Feet From Hell: Response - www.amazon.com/dp/B007VIWVCO

Six Feet From Hell: Escape - www.amazon.com/Six-Feet-From-Hell-Escape-ebook/dp/B009LW79C0

Six Feet From Hell: Salvation - www.amazon.com/dp/B00BEYRBAS

Six Feet From Hell: Crisis - www.amazon.com/Six-Feet-From-Hell-ebook/dp/B00EWSBR3K

Six Feet From Hell: Unity - www.amazon.com/dp/B00JHSV6QS

story:
Dying to go on Vacation

Dying to Go On Vacation is the humorous, and sometimes heartbreaking, story of faith, hope, and struggle as a father receives a diagnosis of terminal cancer in the middle of his most productive years. He goes on to explore how to live positively even when bad things happen to good people. 

The story begins and ends on two very different vacations. One where Marty Cauley has an attack that puts him into the hospital. What he thinks is a simple case of indigestion is diagnosed as terminal cancer. Suddenly his whole world changes. The book ends twenty-eight days later with Cauley and his family away on another vacation to spend time getting used to living while dying.

This book is a case study in making sure you are putting first things first and making the most of every day of your life. Here is a quote from the introduction:

“Do not wait until you are dying to go on vacation. I think if I had one piece of advice to give you that would be it.…We understand life is fleeting but we act as though it is endless. Then something happens to remind us that it is not.” (p.9)

Thank you for the opportunity to share my book, Dying to Go On Vacation: A journey of discovering life while facing death, with you. By supporting this project you will help add a voice of encouragement to those who are facing difficult times and to their family members. I hope you will want to share it with those you know facing a terminal illness or other life challenges. 

What We Need & What You Get

We hope to raise at least $2,500 for:

  • Getting online version up and running
  • Finishing the processing for the print copies 
  • Printing the first run and receiving the first 250 books. 
There are several levels that you can contribute! 

  • For a $5 donation you will receive my heartfelt thanks and a Dying to go on Vacation thank you card. 
  • For $25 you will receive my heartfelt thanks, a Dying to go on Vacation thank you card, and a hand numbered, signed, and personalized copy from the first 250 copies. 
  • For $50 you will receive my heartfelt thanks, a Dying to go on Vacation thank you card, and two hand numbered, signed, and personalized copies from the first 150 copies. 
  • For $100 you will receive my heartfelt thanks, a Dying to go on Vacation thank you card, two hand numbered, signed, and personalized copies from the first 50 copies, and an acknowledgement on my website on the Dying to go on Vacation information page you can see here along with your endorsement. 
If we fail to reach the goal we will limit the launch of the book however your perk will be honored no matter what! I am committed to my friends who have made this possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are lots of other ways you can help:

  • Visit my blog at www.MartyCauley.org and sign up for the email newsletter.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and help me spread the word!
  • Follow me on Facebook.com/MartyJCauley or Twitter @MartyCauley and help me spread hope!
  • Tell a friend about the book.

story:
¿Qué?

El mundo de las sombras aborda una espeluznante realidad, y es que solo en Estados Unidos desaparecen cada año casi un millón y medio de personas; en la comisaría de Limehouse, al este de Londres, hay pendientes mil trescientos casos de desapariciones; y en nuestro país, en los últimos años, han desaparecido más de treinta mil personas... todas ellas con la consideración oficial de código uno.

“El mundo está lleno de personas desaparecidas, y su número no deja de crecer. El espacio que ocupan se sitúa entre lo que conocemos sobre las formas de estar vivo y lo que sabemos de las formas de estar muerto. Por ahí vagan, sin compañía e incognoscibles, como sombras”.

 Es lo que sucede en la ciudad de Q… Las personas desaparecen sin dejar rastro. Aunque algunos desaparecidos llaman por teléfono a sus familiares.

 Mediante un diario, el protagonista trata de entender lo que está pasando en la ciudad. Su hermana, María, también es un desaparecido, una sombra, que es como los llaman en algunos barrios. Desde luego la palabra está bien elegida, pues los desaparecidos son eso, sombras; sombras sobre nuestra vida, sobre el mundo y sobre nuestra forma de entenderlo; sombras sobre el pasado y sobre el futuro. “Es peor que saber que está muerta. De verdad que lo es. De esta manera nunca dejas de buscarla, de esperarla... ¿Qué está siendo de ella?”.

 Él mismo siente ahora el peor tipo de miedo que existe: la amenaza de que algo lo elimine, acabe con su presencia, lo haga desaparecer. Tan sólo con pensar qué puede ser ese algo ya se estremece.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Francisco Escaño Sánchez.

Nacido en Barcelona en 1971, creció viendo películas de terror, series como Historias para no dormir o La dimensión desconocida y leyendo a autores como al gran Richard Matheson o a Stephen King. Más tarde, estudió Filosofía en la Universidad de Barcelona con la intención de descubrir si la realidad es racional o no, como pretendía Hegel, y para digerir todos los terrores acumulados durante su infancia y adolescencia. Descubrió que no: que los armarios esconden monstruos, que los grifos gotean en la madrugada sin que haya problemas de fontanería y que las personas desaparecen a veces de este mundo sin dejar rastro.

 Autor de siete novelas, una de las cuales, La calle del quebrado, se publicó en 2006, y de tres libros de cuentos, con uno de los cuales quedó finalista en el Primer Premio de Literatura Amateur de Planeta-Agostini en 1999, y con varios relatos publicados en antologías de terror como la de Círculo Rojo o Amentia, actualmente compagina su trabajo en RENFE como Maquinista-Jefe de Tren, con la de crear historias de intriga y terror con las que pretende entretener y emocionar como tantas y tantas historias le entretuvieron y emocionaron a él.

 Y para seguir constatando que el mundo y la mente no son tan comprensibles como creemos; sobre todo cuando estamos solos y suena el teléfono de madrugada y no contesta nadie, o cuando de repente un amigo sangra por los ojos en un restaurante… y no se asusta nadie salvo tú.

Francisco Escaño se ha propuesto helarnos la sangre...

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 850€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El mundo de las sombras que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Francisco Escaño vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

el peor tipo de miedo que existe: la amenaza de que algo lo elimine, acabe con su presencia, lo haga desaparecer.
Tan sólo con pensar qué puede ser ese algo
ya se estremece.
¿Quiénes?Tandaia es
 una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a 
autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes 
ideas como es el crowdfunding. De este modo eres tú, 
ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra 
que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro 
catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.Hoy te presentamos a Francisco Escaño Sánchez.
Nacido
en Barcelona en 1971, creció viendo películas de terror, series como Historias para no dormir o La dimensión desconocida y leyendo a
autores como al gran Richard Matheson o a Stephen King. Más tarde, estudió
Filosofía en la Universidad de Barcelona con la intención de descubrir si la
realidad es racional o no, como pretendía Hegel, y para digerir todos los
terrores acumulados durante su infancia y adolescencia. Descubrió que no: que
los armarios esconden monstruos, que los grifos gotean en la madrugada sin que
haya problemas de fontanería y que las personas desaparecen a veces de este
mundo sin dejar rastro.
 Autor de siete novelas, una de las
cuales, La calle del quebrado, se
publicó en 2006, y de tres libros de cuentos, con uno de los cuales quedó
finalista en el Primer Premio de Literatura Amateur de Planeta-Agostini en
1999, y con varios relatos publicados en antologías de terror como la de
Círculo Rojo o Amentia, actualmente compagina su trabajo en RENFE como
Maquinista-Jefe de Tren, con la de crear historias de intriga y terror con las
que pretende entretener y emocionar como tantas y tantas historias le
entretuvieron y emocionaron a él.
 Y para seguir constatando que el
mundo y la mente no son tan comprensibles como creemos; sobre todo cuando
estamos solos y suena el teléfono de madrugada y no contesta nadie, o cuando de
repente un amigo sangra por los ojos en un restaurante… y no se asusta nadie
salvo tú.


Francisco Escaño se ha propuesto helarnos la sangre...¿Cómo?Para
 arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 850€; esta es la 
cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con 
un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El mundo de las sombras que saldría pocas semanas 
después a la venta.Además... Sabemos
 que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible 
que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en 
estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, 
incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta 
campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Francisco Escaño vea publicada su obra. Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
1913’s FUNDRAISING/PRE-SALE/BOOK GIVEAWAY!

Please support our exciting NEW & FORTHCOMING book projects at 1913 Press!

We’re thrilled to announce the PRE-SALE of 3 BEAUTIFUL NEW books:

-BRENDA IIJIMA’s Untimely Death is Driven Out Beyond the Horizon

-SARAH RIGGS’s Pomme & Granite

-AMARANTH BORSUK & KATE DURBIN’s Abra

...all gorgeous & ready to ship this SPRING!

We’re conducting this PRE-SALE via our current INDIEGOGO FUNDRAISER. And with the purchase of any of the above NEW books, you’ll get a FREE book from our catalog! (Please see Perks for details.)

Since its inception in 2003, 1913 has always been an IN-HOUSE operation, a labor of love by its two editors, Sandra & Ben Doller, in collaboration with the 1913 authors and artists. Our funding has come from working our full-time jobs, in addition to the occasional generous financial support of our devoted friends and fans.

Like most small presses, we have incurred mucho debt from publishing expenses (printing, mailing, promotion, conferences, book fairs) not to mention the hundreds of hours of labor involved in book design, web design, and running the press. Rather than take vacations, eat at restaurants, or buy things, we make books!

Now, due to some major life changes (Ben got cancer last year...and now we’re having a baby!) we absolutely need to shift many 1913 things OUT-OF-HOUSE—which will entail hiring outside designers, finding a friendly web updater, training talented managing editors and crew of assistants...all of which require YOUR SUPPORT.

We’re trying to raise money for our new and forthcoming projects...but our larger goal is, as always, to get the work OUT there and read by YOU! We believe strongly in all our book projects...and we’re just tickled to announce our next batch of amazing exciting superbad books on the way:

-BRAD FLIS’s Strong Suits

-LILY HOANG’s Old Cat Lady

-RONALDO WILSON’s Lucy 72

-JON COTNER & ANDY FITCH’s Conversations Over Stolen Food

-CYNTHIA ARRIEU-KING & HILLARY GRAVENDYK’S Unlikely Conditions

...and...

the winner of the 1913 Prize selected by Claudia Rankine: LEIF HAVEN’s Arcane Rituals From the Future

AND

1913 Prize Editrice’s Choice: MIA YOU’s, I, Too, Dislike It

With your support of 1913 Press, we can not only see these projects to fruition, but also keep the rest of our catalog IN PRINT—something we really value as publishers, writers, editors, and readers. & As ever, we remain committed to publishing the freshest finest work out there, in beautifully designed editions.

If you haven’t yet, please check out our catalog of 1913 books by MENDI+KEITH OBADIKE, MONICA MODY, CA CONRAD, SCOTT MCFARLAND, JANE LEWTY, KARENA YOUTZ, SRIKANTH REDDY & DAN BEACHY-QUICK, DIANE WALD, ARIELLE GREENBERG & RACHEL ZUCKER, BISWAMIT DWIBEDY, SHIN YU PAI, JOHN KEENE & CHRISTOPHER STACKHOUSE!

ALL SIX issues of 1913 a journal of forms are available as FREE downloadable PDFs on our website! And ALL FIVE of our annual anthologies of INTER-TRANSLATION, titled READ, are available for $12 on our website or via SPD.

In addition to this Indiegogo PRE-SALE, some of the BEST ways to support our small (micro) press efforts are to:

-BUY our books

-RECOMMEND them to your friends and students

-TEACH them in your classes

-INVITE our writers to read

-and help SPREAD THE WORD of this campaign...

Our fundraising perks include money-saving PRE-ORDER + FREE BOOK options, as well as various SMALL DONATION + BOOK options. And of course, you're welcome to choose to just DONATE TO SUPPORT 1913! Our lofty goal is to raise $10,000—which is difficult, we know!—but we feel it’s important to be honest about the ACTUAL COSTS of running a press.

We’re proud to report that YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS TO 1913 PRESS ARE NOW 100% TAX-DEDUCTIBLE to the extent permitted by law, thanks to the fiscal sponsorship from a friendly San Diego-based organization with 501c3 status.

Please contact us directly if you’d prefer to send a paper check.

*

UNTIMELY DEATH IS DRIVEN OUT BEYOND THE HORIZON:

“Antigone enters. Pesticides, eco-cide, a guiding conversation with Leslie
Scalapino and the beloved dead. The drone poem and the brain-body of the
dancer. Brenda Iijima gets at the horror of our capitalist daily: the nation
as prison-industrial complex, flickering beneath an alluring scrim of
chemically-bright lawns and Mountain Dew. Her poetry pierces the veil, and
this dense, velvety and deeply charged writing is a timely call and warning:
also a furnace of the imagination. It 'plunges the brain into darkness where
it doesn't fester'.” -Lauren Levin

POMME & GRANITE:

“These under- and above-ground journeys inhabit and enliven that rich mystery, shuttling between the self and beloved, the world and all its myths. It is a place & we live here, / under the grass, over the earth. Chthonic lyrics pulled up with the roots intact, hard, sweet, and sustaining.” –Eleni Sikelianos

ABRA:

“A cell calls to itself, splits: a caul is knit. In the intimacy of the not-self-same is birthed a third thing: a second sight. Just so in the clairvoyant, collaborative between-spaces (media) of Abra's triple play. A 'rococo glow', a 'sparkle spasm', a transcriptase strip-tease at once cellular and galactic. Can protein have a fantasy life? Does cancer wish to conquer?  Is thought just the comfort food our brain cells grant us while pursuing their own ends? The precise articulation of Abra reflects the considerable skill of its human compositors, yet hints at acute, occluded dramas unfolding just beyond human scales.” -Joyelle McSweeney

story:
Meet Susan

Hello, I'm Susan Rothfuss. I am a life coach who has taken a break for a little over a year to write a book. Part memoir, part life-class, I use my life stories to illustrate how we each create our own reality and how accessible real Wisdom is.
I married at 19, was divorced at 34, single parented my daughter for five years, put myself through college and graduate school, worked for a Fortune 100 company, happily married the love of my life 28 years ago, co-owned a corporation for 20 years and I now enjoy my life's calling as a life coach.

Breathe Into Wisdom It’s There … It’s Yours … Use It!

We each have a story. This is mine. Its value comes from my belief that we each have the ability to simply breathe into the universal wisdom that spirit brings into our human experience. With the help of book coach Christine Kloser’s Get Your Book Done! program I have completed my 50,000 word manuscript. Now I want to publish and promote it. Readers who learn how to breathe into their own Wisdom, create their own reality, reframe their experiences to learn their own life lessons will enrich humankind. 

Now I need your help.

What's the Goal?

I recently reduced my goal to achieve a mid-level publishing package. My goal is to raise enough money to pay for:

Professional editing 

Professional  layout

Creation of digital and print files

Initial delivery of print books

Small promotional campaign

Social media campaign

Book launch 

Total cost $5,000

I have chosen a flexible format for this campaign which means if I reach my campaign goal my the cost will be 4% of the money received through Indiegogo. If I fail to meet the goal the cost will be 9%. A good incentive to reach the goal! Having reduced my goal for the last six days of the campaign makes my goal more attainable with your help.


How Can You Help?

Everyone can help. Of course financial backing is important but there are additional ways to help. 

There are three ways you can help:

  1. Make a financial contribution to help get this book published and promoted.
  2. Invite everyone in your social media network to check out the campaign and offer your personal endorsement of me.
  3. Send out positive energy in support of this campaign and the success of my work.

Check out the perks for making donations - there are some cool opportunities! 

Let's Transform Lives!

  • If the idea of learning how to breathe into your own wisdom is intriguing
  • If you agree that we could all benefit from understanding the true lessons we are here to learn in our lives
  • If you believe learning how to create positive change in our lives as we all create our own reality is valuable

This is an opportunity for you to support those goals.

I can’t wait to thank you for helping me make this dream come true.

story:
In six weeks I leave for the CDT. I went to the dentist on Monday and discovered that I need two $1100 crowns.

I'd been procrastinating going to the dentist for over a year. One of my molars has recently been giving me pain and sort of storing food inside itself. Another one is cracked. I can't put this dental work off any longer, and I definitely can't set out on a 2,800 mile hike with this problem. 

  • Fixing my teeth would require spending my CDT funds
  • Which would mean no hiking the wild CDT and writing daily blog posts about it for you
  • This sux

However!

You, dear reader, can send me to hike the CDT.

I currently have 2,300 blog followers- if each person following my blog contributed $1, I'd instantly be able to get the crowns I need, and hike the CDT, and blog about it for you.

I'm going to call that crowdfunding magic.

The 2,800 mile Continental Divide Trail is wilder, more arduous, and longer than the PCT. There is less water, less trail, more inclement weather, and much more overland navigation. Only a few dozen people thru-hike the CDT each year, compared to hundreds on the PCT. Hiking the CDT feels, I imagine, a little like what it must've felt like to hike the PCT in the seventies. The saying for the CDT is "Embrace the Brutality".

Aside from the Lowest to Highest Route, I have never hiked a "trail" this wild. I have maps, shoes, and all my gear. I'm so excited I can hardly stand it. And how badly do you want to read about this adventure?!  

Why do this?

Because you want to read what I'm going to write. Because you believe in me. Because the lack of access to affordable dental care in this country sux.

As thanks, I promise to write one blog post for every single day I'm on the trail. No matter how tired, sunburnt, hungry, or vaguely hypothermic I am. One blog post for each day, all for you.

ARE YOU SO EXCITED?!

story:
Story of my Book 

On the Tips of Her Fingers is inspired by Slovak fairy and folk tale traditions, tracking a young girl’s journey as she travels far from home. It is a fictional work that focuses on the idea of magic, monsters, and the courage to overcome the darker corners of life. My book will publish in Winter 2020.

My name is Bibiana and I am the author of On the Tips of Her Fingers. I wrote this book as an homage to the fantastical dark fiction I read as a young girl, cloaked in magic and grand faraway worlds. It is simultaneously a nod to my roots. I was born in Slovakia and grew up listening to, reading, and watching beautiful fairytales that were heavily inspired by nature and the world I was born into. Instead of high-rise buildings, you’ll read about quaint cabins and grand castles cradled by dense woods, powdery snow, and pine trees.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover and regain a little bit of magic in the everyday. My book can offer escapism, yet encourage the reader to face difficult situations head-on. It will offer the magic of powers and abilities. And it will force the reader to acknowledge that there is a power in perseverance and courage.

I want you to see this book as an escape from the world around you... to find joy in faraway worlds and magic within.

On the Tips of Her Fingers centers around a protagonist named Adela, who leads an otherwise normal life in a countryside. The world is called Sunseree, and it is loosely influenced by the town where I was born. Adela lives in a cozy cottage with her mother, who spins fantastical tales for her at night. A series of strange and dark events leads to her being gifted with special abilities that allow her to escape the world around her and help her cope with difficult feelings and emotions.

As Adela travels from place to place, she begins to uncover and unravel the mysteries of her family and town, stumbling through each phase of discovery until the story comes to a close. Through her adventures, we meet friends and acquaintances, magical creatures and talking animals, villains and evil characters. Through it all, Adela begins to understand the impact of self-identity, of self-esteem, and of courage and determination.

You will love this book if you enjoy dark fantasy fiction. If you enjoy reading about magic and fantastical worlds, people, and creatures, you will love this book. On the Tips of Her Fingers speaks to children and adults, fans of fiction and fairytales, and fans of magic realism who want to grapple with the concepts of escapism and self-identity and love in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that On the Tips of Her Fingers inspires reflection and sparks a moment of magic in life.

 

The Book 

The book features a number of characters, both friends and foes. It centers around a main protagonist, her home, and the mysterious circumstances of the environment around them.

Adela: Adela is our main protagonist. She is a young girl and can be quite neurotic and aloof, preferring the comforts of a book and the presence of her family. She has difficulty coping with her emotions, and due to a serendipitous series of events, learns to escape and explore the vast and magical world around her.

Sunseree: Adela hails from a bucolic village called Sunseree, where quaint cottages stand out before a backdrop of snow-topped mountains, clear, frozen-over lakes, and a dark forest housing curious creatures.

The Last Sun: As Adela traverses different towns and cities, she does so under the cover of darkness. The world has been plunged into perpetual nighttime, and the sun has suddenly disappeared. Through her journeys, Adela begins to uncover the mysteries of what happened...

In the first part of the novel, we are introduced to Adela, her family, and the curious adventures that Adela embarks on.

In the second part, our protagonist explores new places: Nuimtree, the Forgotten City, New Kitfalls, Old Kitfalls, and more...

In the final part, the secrets of Adela’s family and the world around her are unveiled.

To help set the scene, below are a few excerpts from the novel:

  • “When Lucia had been pregnant with Adela, she loved to open all the windows in the room and bring her paints upstairs. When the roosters crowed 'good morning' to when the stars began to twinkle, Lucia created imaginative scenes with the flick of her brush and colors of blue, gold, emerald, and pink. Adela’s spine tingled in awe when she first heard the story, taking in the story in front of her. It was a humble depiction of the village just below the grassy knoll.“
  • “Her gold sun tingled, and the young girl sensed something wrong. ‘Yes... of course,“ she lied. She pried the jar from the young woman’s grasp and began to back out of the stone house. ’I should really get going now,’ she stammered, as she reached for the doorknob.”
  • “The warmth pulsed through her upper body, spreading to her legs and her toes from that singular point. Her mother always had this unusual ability to warm anything she touched; it was particularly useful on these cold nights, when the wintry weather would creep into the cracks of wood and escape into the bedrooms. Prompted by the smile spreading on her face, the palms lifted off her chest and she heard a whispered 'I love you' before the door closed and the room was enveloped in darkness once more.“
  • “'Didn’t you know? Telling someone your name gives them power over you.'”

 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book for both paperback and hardcover copies
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch and Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Story of my Book 
On the Tips of Her Fingers is inspired by Slovak fairy and folk tale traditions, tracking a young girl’s journey as she travels far from home. It is a fictional work that focuses on the idea of magic, monsters, and the courage to overcome the darker corners of life. My book will publish in Winter 2020.My name is Bibiana and I am the author of On the Tips of Her Fingers. I wrote this book as an homage to the fantastical dark fiction I read as a young girl, cloaked in magic and grand faraway worlds. It is simultaneously a nod to my roots. I was born in Slovakia and grew up listening to, reading, and watching beautiful fairytales that were heavily inspired by nature and the world I was born into. Instead of high-rise buildings, you’ll read about quaint cabins and grand castles cradled by dense woods, powdery snow, and pine trees.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover and regain a little bit of magic in the everyday. My book can offer escapism, yet encourage the reader to face difficult situations head-on. It will offer the magic of powers and abilities. And it will force the reader to acknowledge that there is a power in perseverance and courage.I want you to see this book as an escape from the world around you... to find joy in faraway worlds and magic within.On the Tips of Her Fingers centers around a protagonist named Adela, who leads an otherwise normal life in a countryside. The world is called Sunseree, and it is loosely influenced by the town where I was born. Adela lives in a cozy cottage with her mother, who spins fantastical tales for her at night. A series of strange and dark events leads to her being gifted with special abilities that allow her to escape the world around her and help her cope with difficult feelings and emotions.As Adela travels from place to place, she begins to uncover and unravel the mysteries of her family and town, stumbling through each phase of discovery until the story comes to a close. Through her adventures, we meet friends and acquaintances, magical creatures and talking animals, villains and evil characters. Through it all, Adela begins to understand the impact of self-identity, of self-esteem, and of courage and determination.You will love this book if you enjoy dark fantasy fiction. If you enjoy reading about magic and fantastical worlds, people, and creatures, you will love this book. On the Tips of Her Fingers speaks to children and adults, fans of fiction and fairytales, and fans of magic realism who want to grapple with the concepts of escapism and self-identity and love in a new way.Ultimately, I hope that On the Tips of Her Fingers inspires reflection and sparks a moment of magic in life.

 
The Book 
The book features a number of characters, both friends and foes. It centers around a main protagonist, her home, and the mysterious circumstances of the environment around them.Adela: Adela is our main protagonist. She is a young girl and can be quite neurotic and aloof, preferring the comforts of a book and the presence of her family. She has difficulty coping with her emotions, and due to a serendipitous series of events, learns to escape and explore the vast and magical world around her.Sunseree: Adela hails from a bucolic village called Sunseree, where quaint cottages stand out before a backdrop of snow-topped mountains, clear, frozen-over lakes, and a dark forest housing curious creatures.The Last Sun: As Adela traverses different towns and cities, she does so under the cover of darkness. The world has been plunged into perpetual nighttime, and the sun has suddenly disappeared. Through her journeys, Adela begins to uncover the mysteries of what happened...In the first part of the novel, we are introduced to Adela, her family, and the curious adventures that Adela embarks on.In the second part, our protagonist explores new places: Nuimtree, the Forgotten City, New Kitfalls, Old Kitfalls, and more...In the final part, the secrets of Adela’s family and the world around her are unveiled.To help set the scene, below are a few excerpts from the novel:

“When Lucia had been pregnant with Adela, she loved to open all the windows in the room and bring her paints upstairs. When the roosters crowed 'good morning' to when the stars began to twinkle, Lucia created imaginative scenes with the flick of her brush and colors of blue, gold, emerald, and pink. Adela’s spine tingled in awe when she first heard the story, taking in the story in front of her. It was a humble depiction of the village just below the grassy knoll.“
“Her gold sun tingled, and the young girl sensed something wrong. ‘Yes... of course,“ she lied. She pried the jar from the young woman’s grasp and began to back out of the stone house. ’I should really get going now,’ she stammered, as she reached for the doorknob.”
“The warmth pulsed through her upper body, spreading to her legs and her toes from that singular point. Her mother always had this unusual ability to warm anything she touched; it was particularly useful on these cold nights, when the wintry weather would creep into the cracks of wood and escape into the bedrooms. Prompted by the smile spreading on her face, the palms lifted off her chest and she heard a whispered 'I love you' before the door closed and the room was enveloped in darkness once more.“
“'Didn’t you know? Telling someone your name gives them power over you.'”

Short Summary

My name is Candice and I am a New York City public school teacher and fiction writer. 

 I was recently given the honor of being accepted to VONA (Voices of Our Nation Arts), a writing workshop founded by Junot Diaz.

  • The workshop is a week long intensive in Maimi, FL where I will study with other writers of color under highly esteemed writers of color.

What I Need & What You Get

Originally $1350 - covers the cost of the workshop itself ($800) as well as room and board ($600). 

  • Donate $25 and get a thank you card. Donate $50 and get a thank you card and a copy one of my poems. Donate $100 and get a personalized poem.
  • Now, only need to raise $1,250.
  • Any amount helps!!

The Impact

  • As a writer of color, I hope to contribute a critical, yet celebratory voice and perspective to the din rising about our nation. Working with other writer's of color on a common goal will help fortify both my craft and my resolve to continue.  

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!

story:
So why a sequel?

Hey there - this is Jennifer Anne Champion, Daryl Qilin Yam, and Joshua Ip.

We are the editors of SingPoWriMo 2015: The Anthology, picked from a larger team of moderators that oversaw this month-long, write-a-poem-a-day challenge. Inspired by the fruits of last year's labours, we collectively decided that SingPoWriMo is more than just a thing you do on Facebook for the heck of it - it's an annual gathering of like-minded people, a rigorous exercise both demanding and rewarding, as well as a bold, balls-out foray into the literary scene.

Our dear Facebook group has grown to over 1,300 members in our sophomore year, and needless to say, a ton of poems had been generated over April by poets both seasoned and fresh out of the boat. Liwulis? Check. Lipograms? Check. Empat perkataans? Ch-ch-check. Singapore literature is the beast that just refuses to die, and this year's edition of the anthology seeks to collect the best of these poems in a sizeable volume, published and released by Math Paper Press this coming November.

Poetry Is Coming.

How does the money work?

We've streamlined our process of going through and vetting which poems are read and which poems aren't - nevertheless, we do think the final manuscript will come in at around 150 pages. So the approximate cost of producing an anthology will be (all costs in SGD):

1. ~$2500 in printing costs

2. ~$1000 in design/layout costs

3. Marketing/Distribution costs

Math Paper Press will be covering items 2 and 3, but in the community-driven spirit of SingPoWriMo, we're going back to Indiegogo to raise funds for this anthology and ease the financial burden off MPP's backs. Because last year's fund-raising effort was such a success, we're sticking to our goal of $1800 USD (~$2495.30 SGD) to defray as much of the printing costs as possible. And if we do manage to raise more funds than expected, free copies of the anthology will be given out to schools and and other places that can afford more exposure to local literature, so it's all good!

Why should I care?

Because Singapore Lit matters. Because you love all things to do with the making of books, the making of stories, the making of exquisite things with words alone. Because, for some strange reason, you feel inspired to write poetry of your own, but don't know how to go about doing it and making your own voice heard.

Because you just have a lot of spare cash lying around, and you want to throw it to a project whose editors and publishers are starving, like, literally. Because your friend is in the anthology and you know, yeah, you know. Because there are young kids in schools who are made to think that literature is not important, not essential to our daily lives, and simply not fun at all to do or read or study. Because this book is testament that literature is all games and hard work and rainbows and the small miracles that happen when a good poem comes together. And because this book is about a thousand people, telling one another to have another go at this wonderful, frustrating, and yet altogether mind-defying smorgasm of a poetry challenge.

Because SingPoWriMo is not simply about you, or me - it's all about all of us, and that same yet strangely variegated language we all speak in: poetry.

Alright alright, now tell me: what do I get for being awesome?

Ahem - you're gonna like what we're offering this year (all donations in USD and adjusted for inflation):

$3 - Our Forever And Always Undying Love: We will love you. We really will.

$12 - Fastest Fingers Firstest: A pre-order copy of the anthology at a very special price (~$16.65 SGD). Only for the first 30 orders. Collection only at the launch event and BooksActually (9 Yong Siak St, Singapore 168645).

$14 - Faster Fingers Not-As-Firstest-But-Still-Good: A pre-order copy of the anthology at a rather special price (~$19.41 SGD). Collection only at the launch event and BooksActually (9 Yong Siak St, Singapore 168645).

$20 - Signed, Sealed, Delivered: A pre-order copy of the anthology with signatures from all editors, delivered to your doorstep via post.

$36 - Eh, Credit Me Please: Everything in the $20 tier, plus your name in the acknowledgments. People will know you as That Guy, and they will love you for it.

$49 - The Leit Companion: Everything in the $36 tier, except your copy of the anthology will have pages / sections / poems furiously scribbled on and annotated by a mysterious literary (double) agent with a Hawke-ish personality, a Bourne-ian approach to bad puns, and Bond-esque inclination towards imperfect form... not to mention mysterious handwriting and a bucketful of snark.

$69 - Patron of the Arts: Everything in the $36 tier, plus an original poem by the editors specifically written for the donors, in a beautiful, one-of-a-kind postcard-sized print. We'll do our best.

$88 - The Leit Motif Prize: Everything in the $36 tier, except this time Leit Motif hands you 2 copies of the anthology and a poem of her very own in a postcard print, tucked somewhere amongst the leaves for your own perusal...

... Okay. Erm. Who is Leit Motif?

story:
Short Summary

After teaching courses on World Mythology for nearly a decade, and collaborating with dozens of artists, a dream has been realized: Myth Education is coming!

What makes Myth Education stand apart from other books on mythology? 

First and foremost is the gorgeous original artwork to go along with each of the nearly 100 characters featured in the book. An array of talented artists have created beautiful pieces to ensure that Myth Education is far and away the most visually stunning mythology text on the market.

And then, of course, there's the text of the book. A lot of books on mythology suffer from one of two problems, either (1) being too dry and esoteric or (2) being sanitized to appeal to a younger audience.  Myth Education is accessible to anyone (whether they've studied mythology for years or have only seen a Thor movie) but remains honest about the original stories and characters -- warts and all.  Sex and violence are necessary components to many myths and I don't believe in sanitizing them away. Myth Education is for adults, not for kindergartners. But, anyone who can handle a PG13 movie should be able to handle this book just fine.

What We Need & What You Get

We have secured a publisher. It's a small press publisher, but Myth Education will be available on at least three continents and in several digital formats. We have over 30 artists hard at work. What we don't have, is very much money to pay the artists or to promote the book so we can get it into as many hands as possible. With your help, we can make sure the artists receive more than the stipend we're able to give them now.  With your help, we can do publicity for the book, get it into the hands of reviewers and get it onto the shelves of bookstores on three continents. With your help, we can ensure that Myth Education is a success and pave the way for more volumes and even work towards full color editions.  The more we raise, the better this product and future projects will be.   

Perks for donors include getting your name listed in the special thanks, free copies of the final product, special dedications to you (or someone else of your choosing), printed copies of some of the original artwork created for the book.  And, most importantly (and most improbably) for one donation of $10,000 I will personally worship you as my personal god for one year, making sacrifices of animal crackers on an altar.  I mean, who wouldn't want that?

The Impact

I love mythology. I love writing about it, I love studying it, I love teaching it. It is beautiful and upsetting and hilarious.  And I think there is tremendous value in knowing the stories and characters that have helped shape both our culture and our minds. We better understand the past and the present through looking at the mythologies of the world. This is the shared cultural history of humanity. And making it not just accessible but vibrant for a modern audience is how we can best celebrate that. With your help, Myth Education can be that celebration. 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who are interested in this book or mythology or creative endeavors in general but are not able to make a donation there is still plenty of ways you can help.  

Share the links. Share them again and again.  Indiegogo makes it very easy. Just click on one of many links and share it on Facebook, Twitter or whatever social media you have.  Donations are great, but the only way to get people to make donations is to make sure they know about the campaign. So share it. Pass it on. Put this campaign on your wedding registry (congratulations!) or in your obituary (condolences!) or anything else you can think of. The more people know about it the more we'll be able to raise and the better the final product will be and the more hands we'll be able to get it into.

story:
What is this project?

We are taking photos and interviewing performers, attendees, and the people connected to Low Pone. All of this work will result in a published book and a gallery show at the Tube Factory on February 1, 2019. 

Why are we doing this? 

The way this whole project began was sitting down with friends swapping stories about the people we encountered at Low Pone, how beautiful their lives are, and how unique this show really is. 

Low Pone is doing something that is unheard of in this city. It's creating a space for those who have felt displaced. We are capturing a historical queer moment in Indianapolis. On a sociological level, we are examining the need for public celebration of queer existence by showing the vibrancy that comes from a reclamation of our collective identity. 

An integral part of this narrative revolves around Low Pone as a family and the characters within, those in the crowd and the ones performing. Many of the artists use their time on stage to deconstruct concepts of gender and sexuality in our city. The relationship between artist and audience creates an unrivaled energy.  

This is a series of individual's stories and how their paths intersect over one night, every month. 

It's about how that one night becomes a sanctuary, and how a chosen family learns to find triumph even in moments of tragedy. 

So what do we want from you? 

To be honest, it takes money to make all of this happen. We are looking at publishing costs, printing/framing costs for the photos at the gallery show, and paying a designer to lay out the book. 

We believe that what we are doing is truly radical for Indy. This show, this book, is a true representation of the lives that we live — and the reason why we leave Low Pone feeling like it was equally a party and dinner with family.  

We believe that this project is not only historical, it's showing the world what the often overshadowed queer life in Indianapolis can look like.

We hope you join us. 

 

*Low Pone is a night to celebrate our queer community in Indianapolis. Upon multiple closures of LGBTQ+ establishments and years of segregation between men, women, and those outside of gender binary, Low Pone has become a queer dance party where we are free to be joyful in ourselves and each other.

story:
NOVEL

Gitarista is the story of Alejandro Sebastian, a young guitar virtuoso thrust into the classical arts scene of 1970s Manila, Philippines.

Raised by a single mother in the province, Alejandro returns to the capital as a teenage freshman at the Conservatory of Music where his mentor, maestro Pablo Rocca II, trains him to become a guitar grandmaster. He meets Dani, a free-spirited violinist, who becomes a close friend and inspiration.

Alejandro’s musical journey takes place during the height of urban progress: buildings towered over paved roads, vehicles caused traffic jams, business districts were expanding and the music and arts scene was a burgeoning form of entertainment and a stark representation of the country’s national identity.

From Manila's iconic attractions such as the scenic Roxas Boulevard, the walled city of Intramuros, the tunnels of Quiapo, the hills of San Juan, the lake of Laguna, the coliseum of Cubao to the majestic theater of the CCP—Gitarista is a young man's search for the symphony of his life.

 

MUSIC SOUNDTRACK (via mp3 download)

While it is unusual for books to have its own music soundtrack, the themes in Gitarista make it a fitting supplement. Though, rest assured, one may still enjoy the novel thoroughly even without it.

The story includes 6 renowned classical guitar pieces including the one you heard in the trailer (it will be recorded as a guitar version). An original theme song shall also be recorded as a bonus track.

Here is the tracklist:

• Leyenda by Isaac Albeniz — Alejandro’s competition piece (guitar solo) 
• La Catedral by Agustin Barrios— music piece of Alejandro’s rival (guitar solo)
• Por Una Cabeza by Carlos Gardel and Alfredo La Pera — Alejandro and Dani’s duet (guitar and violin)
• Kundiman — love song of Alejandro’s mentor (song)
• Habanera Filipina by Ernesto Vallejo — Dani’s violin piece (violin solo)
• Ugoy ng Duyan (Sway of The Cradle) by Levi Celerio and Lucio San Pedro — a folk lullaby (guitar with vocals)
• Time Standing Still by Reev Robledo — Gitarista theme song (guitar with vocals)

 

OTHER PERKS

Custom-Made T-Shirt (picture mock-up design only)
• Alejandro with guitar
• Dani with violin

 

WHY DO THIS

I believe that one of the best ways to share one's historical roots across cultures is through an engaging narrative.

Because of hundreds of years of colonization by China, Spain, America, Japan, and the 20-year rule of a dictator, Philippine local literature has often dwelled on the struggles and oppression the country has endured. This book veers in the opposite direction. It wasn’t all that bad.

Though the Philippines is classified as a third-world nation, unknown to most, it has one of the most vibrant cities in the world and has produced some of the best classical musicians and artists since the late 1900s.

The book is a fictional romanticization of how western music (classical and pop music) fused itself with native ears and influenced not just a culture of art and music, but an emotionally, colorful lifestyle as well.

 

WHY YOUR HELP IS NEEDED

This is a self-published book. It will be released first as an ebook then be made available in print after. With your support, each person involved in this project will be properly compensated.

PRODUCTION COSTS

Print and eBook
• Editor fees
• Cover illustration
• Ebook conversions
• Marketing
• Print costs

Music Soundtrack
• Musicians
• Studio Rental
• Music Video

 

I am a television music scorer, songwriter and college teacher by profession—hence, my passion for music and imparting knowledge to others. I also dabble in a little web, graphic design and video editing.

My journalistic background includes writing for magazines, press releases, and profiling business institutions. I have written a book of short stories which was warmly received. Gitarista is my first full-length novel.

 

CURRENT PROGRESS/STATUS

• Text is 70% done
• Front Cover Illustration done
• Looking for professional editor
• Scouting for possible musicians and studio

 

EVEN IF THE GOAL ISN'T MET...

The novel, in its digital and print formats, shall commence as planned.

The most expensive endeavor for this project is the music soundtrack. Should the target not be raised in full, I will opt to record at least half of the music themes at my own expense.

story:
Our Story

 

One of my passions is helping other people with their writing. I honestly get as much joy from seeing friends achieve as I do from my own achievements.

 

I want to use what I’ve learned over the years of writing and editing to work with new writers, teaching them skills and about the industry and giving them a platform to showcase their talent. I came up with the idea of a series of anthologies based on publishing online and decided to use the next novel advance I got to fund it.

 

However, with publishing slowing down and taking their time while they negotiate the changes to the industry, that new novel advance is taking longer than I thought and I’m sick of waiting. I want to get stuck into helping writers now. 

 

The Impact

 

 

That’s why I’m turning to you. I’m hoping there are folks out there who love the idea of new writers being given a hand and are willing to help me. Here’s how In fabula-divinos (The tale-tellers) will work.

 

Submission will open to any writer who has not yet had a professional sale on the first of the month and will close on the seventh. The submissions will be of speculative fiction stories (science fiction, fantasy or horror) of no more than two thousand words.

 

On the eighth day I will choose one story and let that lucky person know. For the next three weeks, I’ll work closely with that author, helping them polish that particular story and answering any other questions about the industry they have.

 

On the first of the next month, their story will appear on the In fabula-divinos website (http://thetaletellers.wordpress.com/) and will remain there for that entire month. In the meantime, I will again open to submissions for the following month.

 

At the end of the twelve months, the twelve stories (plus a story from myself and some of my established writer friends) will be gathered and published.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

 I need $2500 to get through the next twelve months of payments to the authors, to get cover art and layout done and to publish the first anthology, both electronically and in print.  I hope the sales of that anthology will fund the next twelve months of the project.

 

I can get started as soon as I have the first $100. 

 

I’d really love this project to work and to have the opportunity to work with new writers and teach them what I’ve learnt so far. I hope that you’ll also want to be part of it all.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're a graphic designer or someone with experience in laying out fiction and you can volunteer your services, we'll need less money in order to make the final anthology a reality!

story:
Above: Covers of Vampyr Verse (2009), The Hungry Dead (2010), and Halloween Haiku 2011)

What's It About?

Every year, Popcorn Press celebrates Halloween by publishing a new collection of horror poetry and short fiction. This year the topic is Cthulhu Haiku and Other Mythos Madness. We're planning a 100-page book (maybe more, depending upon submissions and preorders), with one or two poems per page - our usual format.

In past years, we've paid contributors in copies of the book their work appeared in. For poet's, that's not unusual. Poetry isn't considered a profitable venture. However . . .

  • We believe that's largely because about a century ago academics stole poetry from the mass of humanity. Ever since, some poets have been trying to steal it back. Popcorn Press's Halloween collections are part of that effort. 
  • Halloween is a perfect time for people who don't think of themselves as poets or poetry readers to "dress up" as poets and poetry readers and go "trick or treating" with verse. The horror topic makes it fun. Short poetry like haiku, and formal poetry like sonnets, help to make the collections inviting.

This year Popcorn Press is taking another step forward by paying contributors cash for their work. We've launched this Indiegogo project as a means of taking preorders, drumming up support, and spreading the word.

Why Buy Now?

Yes, Popcorn Press will publish this book one way or another, just as we published the previous Halloween collections. However, by contributing now instead of after publication, (1) you'll receive a better deal, (2) you'll help us plan so we can pay the authors more, and (3) you'll help to build a buzz about the project--which may well result in a bigger book with more poems and fiction!

So please do contribute, and please pass this link to anyone who likes Halloween, Cthulhu, or poetry.

Where Can Poetry and Fiction be Submitted?

If you're interested in submitting your own work to the book, please visit CthulhuHaiku.com for details. And please spread that word, as well. We're looking for lots of good materal. 

Yours truly,

Lester Smith
President, Popcorn Press
President, Wisconsin Fellowship of Poets
Horror Aficionado

story:
THE BASICS

Hello, my name is James Killough.  I'm a writer and filmmaker based out of L.A. who has written a middle-grade illustrated children's book called PEPPER PUMPERDINE AND THE FASHION FAIRY.
I've decided to self-publish because I have a ton of experience editing and publishing books and magazines, so why not take control of it?  I've also always dreamed of starting my own imprint, so now's the time.  I'm going to call it The Pepper Press.

Only you can help make this happen.

One thing my experience has taught me is I need a fantastic editor, targeted marketing, and in this case an illustrator so good that people will want to collect his art. 
 
I have already identified a couple of crackerjack children's book editors with solid track records of producing hit children's books.  It took me three months to find illustrator Adam Oehlers, but I know he is the right person with whom I should team up, so it was worth the wait and the search.

Please check out the pitch video for more about the book and Adam's art.

WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING?

The costs break down simply:

  • A top-of-the-line editor will be around $5,000 (one of the quotes I got was a bit more);
  • $7,500 for Adam Oehlers' illustrations - the more I can commission from him, the more selection everyone has for the perks;
  • At least $3,000 for marketing: Google AdWords; paying Kirkus reviews to cover it; various other hidden costs;
  • $1,000 for prints, and shipping and hard copies of the book for top-end contributors;
  • Misc. costs, like joining the Society of Children's Book Writers and Illustrators, and the fee Indiegogo takes.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

Do you have a kid in your life to whom you'd like to give a timeless gift to that will probably increase in value over the years?  Or are you collector of illustrations that are also fine art?  Whatever the purpose, most people have room in their lives for quality art, and I am fairly confident that what Adam Oehlers and I will create together will be something to treasure for generations.

Please take a moment to review the perks on the side.  Everyone gets at least one print of the illustrations signed by me, as well as at least one download of the book.  But what you really want are prints signed by both me and Adam, which start at $100.

WHY IS PEPPER PUMPERDINE IMPORTANT?

Some of you might be asking how a book about personal style can possibly be significant. But how we perceive ourselves is actually essential to leading a balanced life. You can never start too early to learn about the fundamentals of identity.

As I mention at the end of the video pitch, PEPPER PUMPERDINE AND THE FASHION FAIRY is more than just another kids' book.  It imparts valuable lessons for children and adults alike: never be ashamed of who you are; be yourself, don’t follow the herd; secrets can be burdensome; love your family and be kind to them no matter how weird and embarrassing they are; don’t regret what you don’t have, rather be grateful for the smallest things in life; humility gets you everywhere; and someone is going to spot that fake handbag eventually, so might as well buy the real thing.

This is my first children's book, but if it turns out half as well as other publications and books I've been involved with, it should have a healthy success.  As the first in a proposed series of Pepper Pumperdine adventures, I'm going to go the extra mile to make sure this pilot venture is as good as it can possibly be.

Again, that can only happen with your contribution.

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?

If you can't contribute, but you still think this is a worthy idea, chances are you know someone in your circle of friends or your family who might be interested.  Again, the perks make great gifts that will only increase in value with time.
 
To make things easier, just use the share buttons on this site to spread the word.
 
Thanks so much for considering this project.
 
Big hug,
 
James

story:
Why this adVANture?

It is a personal challenge to myself to experience life in-the-moment and enjoy the pleasure of live simply. 2007 was my last big trip that taught me important lessons about life and fundamentally changed me, so it's time for a new pilgrimage. I'm doing it to gain perspective, push the limits of social expectation, and basically, live my dream of having complete freedom over where and when I work. To me, that is success.

Although I have built my life in Calgary, there is nothing holding me to my hometown. My business is internet-related, so I can work wherever there is wifi, and I've been systematically stripping back my possessions to strive for utilitarian minimalism. I don't need much to be happy. I already AM happy! I'd just rather spend money on travel than on rent.  

To address curiosity, I'm doing it as a solo road trip on purpose, with intentions to meet up with friends and new people along the way. My dog will keep me company on the road, and keep me grounded to a routine. He's got a very important role!

Creative Possibilities

I will be updating my Facebook page leading up to, and during, this entire experience. There will be status updates, pictures, and then the plan is to do frequent video blogging so you can see/hear how I'm doing and what the highlights were in my own words.

I've been tossing around a few ideas about what else I could do with this trip, including how I could use the travel to expand my business into the US and across Canada, BUT the more interesting stuff are the creative projects.

I have a well-known film producer who has offered to help me make this personal project into a bigger story. There are two different ideas right now:

  1. A documentary about choosing a traveller's lifestyle and running a business from the road to become a true laptop CEO. 
  2. A film about the connectivity of people through social media, both online and in person. 

What the Money's For

  • Purchasing a van! The van itself is a cost, but so is the registration, insurance, and any custom work I do to it to make it my home. 
  • Any additional funds will go toward gas or equipment for the trip. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute cash, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! 

  • Donate items: Grocery gift cards, gas cards, See the Facebook Page for a list of items I'm looking for in the Notes section. 
  • Get the word out and make some noise about my adVANture!

story_txt:
Why this adVANture?It is a personal challenge to myself to experience life in-the-moment and enjoy the pleasure of live simply. 2007 was my last big trip that taught me important lessons about life and fundamentally changed me, so it's time for a new pilgrimage. I'm doing it to gain perspective, push the limits of social expectation, and basically, live my dream of having complete freedom over where and when I work. To me, that is success.Although I have built my life in Calgary, there is nothing holding me to my hometown. My business is internet-related, so I can work wherever there is wifi, and I've been systematically stripping back my possessions to strive for utilitarian minimalism. I don't need much to be happy. I already AM happy! I'd just rather spend money on travel than on rent.  To address curiosity, I'm doing it as a solo road trip on purpose, with intentions to meet up with friends and new people along the way. My dog will keep me company on the road, and keep me grounded to a routine. He's got a very important role!Creative PossibilitiesI will be updating my Facebook page leading up to, and during, this entire experience. There will be status updates, pictures, and then the plan is to do frequent video blogging so you can see/hear how I'm doing and what the highlights were in my own words.I've been tossing around a few ideas about what else I could do with this trip, including how I could use the travel to expand my business into the US and across Canada, BUT the more interesting stuff are the creative projects.I have a well-known film producer who has offered to help me make this personal project into a bigger story. There are two different ideas right now:
A documentary about choosing a traveller's lifestyle and running a business from the road to become a true laptop CEO. 
A film about the connectivity of people through social media, both online and in person. 
What the Money's For
Purchasing a van! The van itself is a cost, but so is the registration, insurance, and any custom work I do to it to make it my home. 
Any additional funds will go toward gas or equipment for the trip. 
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute cash, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! 
Donate items: Grocery gift cards, gas cards, See the Facebook Page for a list of items I'm looking for in the Notes section. 
Get the word out and make some noise about my adVANture!
Donate services: Things like insurance, gym memberships, places to stay (and shower) are equally as valuable and important! See the Facebook Page in the Notes section for the list of requests. 
Advocate for corporate donations from your company (in-kind or cash!)

story:
Who is Joshua Lyntton and who is behind this campaign?!!

The Book! ~ Joshua Lyntton!

The book that has been written called Joshua Lyntton is a story about a young teenager growing up in a small coastal town! Josh is a little different from most of his friends as he has the ability to talk to animals! Josh finds the insight he receives from his animal guides, helps him cope with the many challenges he comes across in his life!

As the story unfolds, Josh is led by his guides to find a hidden box from an old shipwreck that has been buried deep in the sand dunes for 100's of years! The box he discovers contains a unique amulet (pictured above) that when worn gives Josh the ability to travel back and forward in time! Josh discovers he has worn this amulet many times before!! 

The Authors! ~ Who are we!

The Joshua Lyntton story has been written by us, Karl & Claire Camden-Burch! We meet just over 6 years ago and since coming together have discovered our love of writing and connection. Even though this is a book of fiction, many of the stories are based around our life growing up as teenagers in different countries! By sharing our stories together and mixing our experiences with fantasy and adventure we believe this will help connect the reader to the feelings of the experiences in the book!

Through our 1st Joshua Lyntton book we wish to share positive messages of self acceptance and acceptance of others, because in the end we are all just a little bit different! 

We plan to create a series of Joshua Lyntton books that will grow and expand as Josh experiences adventures on many different dimensional levels!! 

What We Need! ~ (Thank you from us!)

The reason for this Funding Campaign is that we are going to Self Publish! The funds are required to be able to have our book professionally edited at a standard that is required for Self Help and motivational books. We need your help to raise the funds so that our book can start the process of being published in 2013!

Our 1st book consists of 21 Chapters of fun, adventure and insight! We have written just over 47,000 words to complete our first exciting book! 

What You Get ~ Your Thank you in return!

We have created some unique perks for you if you wish to donate to us!  These perks have been created so that those who give will also receive!  

All money donated will be used towards the publishing of Joshua Lyntton! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you wish to help us in any other way please share this campaign with your friends and Like our Facebook page! We have small exerts from the book on our page with other motivational message as well! The link to our page is https://www.facebook.com/JoshuaLyntton

Thank you to everyone who supports us in any way possible!

Much love & appreciation ~ Thank you Thank you Thank you!

Karl & Claire Camden-Burch

https://www.facebook.com/KarlandClaire

story:
Short Summary

CR's Leading English Language digital newspaper, Inside Costa Rica (http://insidecostarica.com) has been published daily since 2002.  

 

We operate on a shoe-string budget, in fact we don't even maintain offices in the traditional sense.  We are all 'on the ground' reporters and journalists.  

 

We make little if any profit when certain prolems arrise.  

 

For instance, our main vehicle now needs $3,000 in repair to get back on the road.  We don't have the funds at the moment which is hindering our newsgathering and business ability. 

 

We are a small proup of both Costa Ricans and Expats simply doing what we jove - journalism.  The financial rewards are next to to nothing, we just want to keep operating and bringing real, hard news to the English speaking population here.

 

In a small Central Amerian county of just 4 million people, and being an English language publication, our audience is limited but growing - some 45,000 unique monthly readers who read about 250,000 newspages per month, and growing.

 

With your support, we have big plans to grow our newsgathering and more original reporting.  Can you help us, both to surive and grow? 

 

If every single reader donated just $1 PER YEAR it would cover our needs, but unfortunantely the few must pick up the slack for the masses.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Right now we are looking for $10,000 towards the repair of our most important vehicle ($3,000), plus we are in severe need of a few new tools of the trade - some smartphones and better photographic equipment.

Each and evey donor will be mentioned on a special page on ICR.  Those who contribute $100 or more will get a special treat.

Shoud we not reach our entire goal, the first order of business is getting our work truck back on the road.  All funds will go directly to absolutely needed improvements for our small but scrappy news organization.  

The Impact

  • Read our news site: http://insidecstarica.com
  • We provide a much needed service for English speakers in Costa Rica and the rest of Central America.  Our news is frequently utilized by national syndicators like Reuters, AFP, and more.  In many cases we are the only reliable source of English news for the entire region.  
  • All of our material is originally writen or from our syndication parter,AFP.
  • Your contribution will help us to ensure that we bring you more consistent, daily news you can count on.  

Other Ways You Can Help

SIf you can't contribute yourself, please SHARE this campaign wih everyone you can and help us save Inside Costa Rica.  Some of competitors are better funded than we are, but we know that our covearge of real issues beats them hands down.  We work for the love it, not the profit potential, and just need the opportunity to keep doing what we love.
