story:
As founder of Manhattan User's Guide, I've watched New York City change in so many ways since I started writing about it over 20 years ago. One of those changes is the loss of many old-time, Mom-and-Pop stores which gave the city a lot of its character. As is often said, the only thing constant about New York is change, so many of those dusty shops with colorful proprietors are no more.

 

Yet you can still find just about anything here that you're looking for and plenty more that you didn't know you were looking for. Shop Talk: New York's 100 Most Interesting Stores celebrates some of those old independents that are still with us and exciting newcomers selling everything from clothing to home accessories to perfume, books, eyeglasses, and green products. The list of stores is still in formation, but I'm also looking at places that sell agate, supplies for superheroes, mobiles, Mid-Century Modern furniture, Peruvian retablos, 'magickal' herbs and resins, decorative rubber stamps, guitars, buttons, zines, apothecary products, t-shirts, bags, and, well, you get the idea. Places you won't find everywhere, and often anywhere, else.


The most important consideration for inclusion in the book is simply what's for sale -- is it interesting, cool, useful, beautiful, witty, or unexpected? Does the store have careful curation or comprehensive stock, what is the point of view, are there unique items, what's the atmosphere and vibe of the store and the staff, and do the owners have a story to tell?

 

I'm not including food and wine in the book for one main reason: there are so many interesting food shops in the city that they deserve their own book. If Shop Talk does well, a food shop guide will follow.

 

This campaign is designed to fund Shop Talk, a book that will be published this fall to celebrate the indie stores that make up our neighborhoods and survey the cool things that line their shelves. I'll be publishing it, with your help, as a digital book for Kindle--which is, I have to say, more than a little ironic, given the mission of celebrating the indie store spirit. It's the only way for me financially, though, to make the book happen. And I think that when you refer to the book on your Kindle or iPad as you're shopping the city, the format will feel right.

 

I need to raise $8,500 for time and shoe-leather, for the writing, the research, and photography, cover design, copyediting and marketing. Having written several previous guide books, I know the kind of effort involved to create an authoritative guide that's fun to read, useful, and accurate. That's the goal! Work is well underway for Shop Talk; your contribution will take it from there to the finish line.

 

Check out the great perks for contributors. And if you can't contribute but want to support the project, you can help spread the word to your friends and through social media. I'd also love to have you suggest a favorite store! (Send it to office@manhattanusersguide)

 

Thanks for giving Shop Talk a look.

Charlie Suisman

story:
The Pitch

For millenia, peace reigned throughout the lands, following a bittersweet victory against the evil king Cian. This victory came at great cost and with no small thanks to the Guardians, who used their special magic to obliterate Cian's armies and restore the land. Now, the Guardians are warned that Cian is returning, and they have little time to prepare. Focus swirls around Amae, a forest elf and new Guardian just coming into her powers; Ahern, a young, second-born prince unaware of his fate as a Dragon Warrior; and Somae, the strongest and oldest Guardian wielding the power of the sun. Along with their friends, they are called to aid Eamon, the long awaited savior, on a journey to cease Cian's power once and for all.

And that's just the first book!


The Project

So I'm sitting at my computer at 7:30 am, trying to muster up the strength to go back to my grey and beige cubicle, where I'll do mind-numbing work at a job I'm not really a good fit for anyway. Snow fell last night, and my poor old Crown Vic with no heat and no snow tires does not like slick roads. I wonder why I'm even thinking about risking life and limb to go to a job I so loathe. Sure, it pays the bills...but there is no passion. The only thing I can think of all day, every day is writing. More specifically, writing more of this fantasy series I have going.


I started the project a few years ago with big dreams and zero budget. Much of the story was written on post-it notes or other scratch paper and then typed into a Word file when I could find time to borrow a computer or go to the library. Now I have a second-hand laptop that has done wonders for the production of this novel series.


The story is written to be enjoyed as simply that - a story; but a thorough reading will bring out many hidden treasures. It is meant to reach an audience of many ages, especially those whose imaginations still soar. Characters such as elves, gnomes, dragons, satyrs, and many other mystical beings roam the land and find themselves intertwined in their land's history and fate.


Much time has been spent researching various legends and fairy tales, with countless hours passed creating cultures, languages, geography, and other such things that come with an intricate fantasy world. At least three books will be included in the series, with each having their own guide book focused on these details.


I would like to see this series turned into at least one film.


What We Need & What You Get

First, I want to apologize for not having PayPal as an option. There are many reasons for this. If I am able to add PayPal later, I will certainly be doing that. In the meantime, if you would like to contribute via PayPal, you can use jaeladarling@yahoo.com for that.


Obviously, this is a large project. I want to have my hands in it as much as possible, and I want to do this as organically as possible. I prefer hiring independent artists, marketing agents, etc. I respect individual and small businesses and want to support them as much as I can.


Some of what this funding will cover:


- Author's website (for book- and author-related purposes; not a personal site)

- Illustrator(s) for cover art, maps, and all other artwork related to the novels and specialty books.

- Start-up revenue for print-on-demand or similar.

- Marketing materials and/or publicity specialist(s)

- Necessary workshops related to self publishing

- Professional editing

- Any other costs related to self-publishing


All funds will go towards this project, regardless of whether or not the goal is reached. I have started a savings account specifically for this project and will do whatever I can to fund it.


I know I have set a high goal. As I was crunching numbers, I realized that it's going to take nothing short of a miracle to set this in motion. Here is a breakdown that is a little more specific:


- Upwards of $15,000 for editing, printing, marketing, and distribution.

- I will need to take up to a year or more off work to focus on this project. My rent for one year is about $4,000. This does not include electricity, and I am usually able to keep this down to $600-$700/year. This also does not include food, but I am a simple person and spend less than $100/month in groceries (less than $1,200 a year).

- Illustrations/cover art will be commission-based, and the prices will vary. I have several artists to choose from, and the final amount of this campaign will decide which one I can use.


Those are just a few of the costs that are necessary for this project. I'll need to get away for a few months to do nothing but write. I do have a couple of places that I can go to for free, but I'd have to pay travel expenses. It all adds up!


WHAT YOU GET:


I love my readers, and I want to do everything I can to give back to those that have helped. Perks include signed copies, special editions, extra content, loads of specials! I promise this will be well worth your while.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please pray. Some of you may not be the "praying" type, but I am, and I sure could use all the prayers I can get. I've been straying from my path for too long. It's time to buckle down and get this thing done. Please pray for strength, wisdom, and that my goals will be met.


And spread the word! Even if you're not a fantasy fan, maybe some of your friends are! Facebook and Twitter are good ways to promote. The greatest asset to an author is word-of-mouth, so please just start jabbering about the upcoming fantasy series to everyone that will listen.

story:
Help Me Take "The Traveler" On the Road -- And Beyond.

Join me in a new partnership of writer and reader to bring what I think is a thought-provoking, entertaining and truly unique little book to the world of readers.

My goal is to raise money to help me print and distribute 500 free copies of my newly published novel, The Traveler, to independent bookstores around the country. I'm hoping that by doing this, I can get booksellers excited about the book, and generate sales and word of mouth "buzz."

The next step after that is to adapt the novel into a screenplay and try to get it optioned as a movie.

What's The Traveler all about?

The Traveler is a novel in form of a travelogue by a young 19th century doctor who loses his parents, brother, young wife, all within a handful of years. Seeking to find his way forward by connecting to his genealogical past, he embarks on a journey, both geographic and spiritual, which ultimately leads him to a new comprehension of life and death -- but not before his understanding of what's possible is turned upside down, and he witnesses reality itself being challenged. (Think Gulliver's Travel with Twilight Zone twists!)

As you read, you'll follow the Traveler's adventures from Balmoral Castle in Scotland, to King Arthur's Cornwall, then on to Ireland, where he meets the wild Russian, Vanya. You'll race across Europe with Vanya and the Traveler to Hungary to celebrate The Day That Death Never Comes, to Romania where the miracle of resurrection is performed by a humble monk, and finally to Stamm, Switzerland, where an old man seems able to grant the gift of eternal youth to beautiful young women.

In the course of this journey, you will discover, as the Traveler does, that sometimes imagination is truer than reality.

What are people saying about 'The Traveler'?

Written during my recent travels to England and Ireland, The Traveler came to me in a burst of imagination and practically wrote itself. Early readers have told me that the book has inspired their imagination and sense of wonder.

Judith Horky, author of EarthShift and SoulShift had this to say about the book:

 I absolutely loved Tales of the Traveler. I couldn’t put it down. The stories resonated deeply into my heart, maybe my soul. It moves quickly, and the creative descriptions of the places visited, as well as the characters, are wonderful. I feel I really know this doctor and can visualize so much of his mystical life. It made me want to go traveling; to follow his tale to find where he experienced such amazing adventures.

My daughter, Jane Roper, an Iowa Writers' Workshop Grad and author of Double Time and Eden Lake, had kind words about my work. (And she's one of my toughest critics.) 

“Gar Roper has crafted a book that is moving, magical and utterly unique. Each picturesque, deceptively simple tale in this volume illuminates the fine line between what is real and what is true."

You can read an exceprt of the book here.

About Me

Most of you who will see this campaign already know me. For others, let me introduce myself: I'm Gar Roper, the author of this book and of a number of other works including mysteries, and a psychological drama. Some are pending publication. 

You can learn more about me on my website, www.garroper.com

Here's why I'm asking for your help:

Publishing today is a tough road for writers. Big names get published and new writers struggle to get an agent or publisher.  Most never do, even if their work is terrific. For a book like Tales of the Traveler -- one that doesn't fit any familiar, established genre -- mainstream publication is nearly impossible.  

But thanks to the self-publishing and crowdfunding revolution underway, unique books like mine are finding readers, and sometimes meeting with huge success. I believe that Tales of the Traveler can and will find an enthusiastic audience, and your contribution  can go a long way toward making it happen.

The Traveler is ready to hit the presses. Amazon's Createspace has helped me create a lovely little volume, which people will be able to easily purchase online. But to get the word out to more readers, I need your help.

What I Need & What You Get

I have planned a road trip to take the book from indie bookstore to indie bookstore, meeting store owners and readers throughout the New England and Middle Atlantic states.

The $2700 I want to raise will fund printing 500 free copies, and will cover the cost of gas for my camper. Plus it will allow me, while traveling, to write the screenplay of the book.

In return for your support, you'll get a free copy of the book with a personal message from the author, plus other incentives when you give at higher levels, including:

  • A copy of Gar's first novel, Hidden Grace, with newly added introduction. Hidden Grace is a fictionalized memoir that tells the triumph of a woman who suffered abuse in foster care.
  • A Traveler T-shirt with the words, "Imagination is Truer than Reality." (I will contact you to get your size info)
  • An advance copy of Deadly Hypocrisy, the first book in my forthcoming Suspense Trilogy, featuring Detective Lila Savantro and Psychologist Gray Ackerman. Why was 16-year-old Brenna supposed to die -- and who did it?
  • My e-book, Guide to Murder, Mystery and Mayhem - a compendium of psychological terms related to crime and the criminal mind. Great for crime novel enthusiasts!
  • All three psychological suspense novels in the Savantro/Ackerman series as they are publisehd.
  • A personal reading for your group/organization in your home or other location. This perk is limited to New England only.
  • A  cottage stay for a week in Ireland or England. Fully paid accommodations at Warren Farm Cottages or at Fremington Cottage in Reeth. Choose either of these two bedroom country cottages located in the very heart of "Traveler" territory. Certificate good for one year, dates subject to availability.

 

The Impact

This road trip, with your support, will -- I hope -- help Tales of the Traveler "go viral" as readers discover its magic and tell their friends. Let's sell 100,000 copies...Why not? And you will be able to say you were part of it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Get the word out and make some noise about The Traveler. Buy the book from my web site www.garroper.com and share your own amazing adventures and incredible events.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell other people about my project.

And that’s all there is to it.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Help Me Take "The Traveler" On the Road -- And Beyond.
Join me in a new partnership of writer and reader to bring what I think is a thought-provoking, entertaining and truly unique little book to the world of readers.
My goal is to raise money to help me print and distribute 500 free copies of my newly published novel, The Traveler, to independent bookstores around the country. I'm hoping that by doing this, I can get booksellers excited about the book, and generate sales and word of mouth "buzz."
The next step after that is to adapt the novel into a screenplay and try to get it optioned as a movie.
What's The Traveler all about? 
The Traveler is a novel in form of a travelogue by a young 19th century doctor who loses his parents, brother, young wife, all within a handful of years. Seeking to find his way forward by connecting to his genealogical past, he embarks on a journey, both geographic and spiritual, which ultimately leads him to a new comprehension of life and death -- but not before his understanding of what's possible is turned upside down, and he witnesses reality itself being challenged. (Think Gulliver's Travel with Twilight Zone twists!)
As you read, you'll follow the Traveler's adventures from Balmoral Castle in Scotland, to King Arthur's Cornwall, then on to Ireland, where he meets the wild Russian, Vanya. You'll race across Europe with Vanya and the Traveler to Hungary to celebrate The Day That Death Never Comes, to Romania where the miracle of resurrection is performed by a humble monk, and finally to Stamm, Switzerland, where an old man seems able to grant the gift of eternal youth to beautiful young women.
In the course of this journey, you will discover, as the Traveler does, that sometimes imagination is truer than reality.

story:
RESERVE AN EARLY COPY OF HACKING POLITICS

Help us finish producing the book and keep on working to defend

Internet freedom

The book Hacking Politics tells the story of how suits, geeks, artists, Occupy, the Tea Party and millions of other Americans came together to save the Internet (for now).  We're honored to get to include contributions from several prominent authors: Cory Doctorow, Lawrence Lessig, Senator Ron Wyden, Congressmembers Ron Paul and Zoe Lofgren, and so many more.

(Please read on for the nitty-gritty.)

---

Last fall and winter millions of Americans came together to protest Internet censorship and defeat the Stop Online Piracy Act.

The effort culminated in a week of unprecedented activism, but it took months -- even years -- to lay the framework that made that possible. 

The book Hacking Politics is the story of many of the activists, politicians, academics, artists, and others who helped attune the Internet public to the threat of SOPA -- and beat it back.

It will be edited by Demand Progress and Don't Censor the Net -- two of the many groups that helped kill SOPA and save the Internet (for now).

Pledged contributors include the following individuals and representatives of the folowing organizations*:

Center for Democracy and Technology * Cheezburger Network * Cory Doctorow * Demand Progress * Don't Censor the Net * Electronic Fontier Foundation * Erin Mckeown * Fight for the Future * FireDogLake * Flobots *  Free Press * Future of Music Coalition * Google * Lawrence Lessig * Congressmember Zoe Lofgren * Occupy * Congressmember Ron Paul * Public Knowledge * Reddit * Suicide Girls * Tea Party * Tech Freedom * Senator Ron Wyden, and many more.

*The overwhelming majority of content is new, but the book will include interesting artifacts from anti-SOPA effort, and some content that's adapted from speeches and existing writing.

What We Need & What You Get

This project is under way, but design, editing, and publicity costs are piling up way beyond our capacity to keep pace.  Your support will help guarantee that it comes out on schedule (before the end of the year), tells this complicated story as thoroughly as possible, and has the farthest reach and broadest impact.
 
Our publisher, O/R Books, has agreed to let us offer the ebook on our sites on a pay-what-you-want basis, but our organizations (Demand Progress and Don't Censor the Net) need to guarantee the publisher a few dollars per copy; your donations will help us make sure that we are able to cover our costs. Additionally, many of the contributors are releasing their essays via a Creative Commons license.

We're trying to raise $20,000, but staff time that's gone into writing and editing has already exceeded that value -- and we've recently had to hire on some contractors to help with supplementary editing.  All of these funds come directly out of the same small pool of money we'd use to run activism campaigns.

Then, once we release Hacking Politics we'll want to hire a publicist to help make sure the book has the broadest possible reach and impact -- your donations will help make that possible.

Any extra proceeds will help fund our organizations' scrappy, ever under-capitalized efforts to keep the web free and open.

The Impact

It's shocking, but there hasn't even been a serious long-form article about the anti-SOPA effort -- even though it dominated online discourse for months, took over global political discourse for much of December and January of 2011-2012, and was an exceedingly rare instance of public outcry actually compelling our lawmakers to do the right thing.
 
It's critical that we document what happened and try to derive lessons from it that can be applied to future activist efforts: There are countless cool stories to tell about what happened -- online, in the streets, and in the halls of power -- and all sorts of new tools and tactics that were developed in the process of killing SOPA that ought more widely studied and understood.
 
Proceeds from the book (ebook to be sold on pay-what-you-want basis) will go to Demand Progress and Don't Censor the Net, so we can keep fighting for online freedoms:
 
Even as we've worked to pull together Hacking Politics, we've been engaged in (successful) campaigns to beat back privacy-infringing cyber security legislation, compel the major political parties to adopt Internet freedom platform planks for the first time, protect the right to resell goods online, help fund and promote a lawsuit against the NDAA's indefinite detention provisions, and much more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our effort with your friends and download the ebook when it comes out!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Rachel, and I'm working with Amanda--a high school senior at Democracy Prep Charter High School in New York--to plan a day that celebrates reading and writing. We're working with an organization called The Future Project to turn Amanda's love of all things literature into a day that brings the community together to share stories, learn from authors, and celebrate books. Learn more about Amanda's project here: http://spreadwords.blogspot.com/ 

The event will be held at the Housing Works bookstore on Crosby Street from 11:00am - 1:00pm on Saturday, April 20

To fund the space, I'm running my first half marathon...a little bit of a "Future Project" of my own! By donating to this campaign, you're supporting both me and Amanda. So please, please donate :)

What We Need & What You Get

As I mentioned, Amanda is planning to host the event at the Housing Works bookstore on Crosby Street...but we need your help to afford the space!

I'm committed to running 13.1 miles to Spread the Words. How much are you able to contribute?!

The Impact

In Amanda's own words: 

"Spread The Words" will be a day full of reading and writing. There will be books from different ranges of genres and writing workshops on poetry and short stories. Through all this I want to encourage students to read and write.  I want to encourage all people to read and just to understand the impact that it could have on your life.

Other Ways You Can Help

-Attend the Spread the Words event on April 20th - and bring everyone you know!

-Stop by the More Magazine half marathon on April 14th in Central Park!

story:
Hello. Maybe we've met before. Maybe we haven't. My name is Matty. I was born almost 24 years ago. I went to college. Im not sure how much I learned. I studied about God. I studied what I thought could know for certain. I left with nothing. Back then, the nothingness haunted me. Left me sleepless and full of despair.  Now the nothingness makes me smile. I don't think I know anything. I hope you could teach me something. 

I wrote Cross Talk over the past two years. In coffee shops. On the basement floor of the Sullivan's in Northeast Portland. At my childhood home in Livermore. Alongside my father. My grandmother. I wrote in silence. I was at my lowest. Paralyzed by my own existence. The permanence of my words were not ready to be spoken. They are now. This isn't a book. It's a collection of experiences. It's like a long walk. You and I are just talking it out.

The importance of Cross Talk is to start an ongoing conversation. It's not for my benefit or fame. Those things don't mean anything. I want to open the door and invite you into my world. The pain. The beauty. Hopefully we can meet in the middle. Cross Talk is about God. Christianity. My own struggles with Obsessive Compulsive Disorder. Decisions. Freedom. Loss. Love. Travel.

If you choose to help me financially, I can share. As I share, it is my hope you will share too. These are not my words, they're from somewhere else. I'm only a mouthpiece. 

Unfortunately creative endeavors cost money. I'll be direct. I need 2,500$ to print Cross Talk  150 copies and pay those who have helped with editing, promoting, and design. In between $2000-$2200 will be dedicated to the printing process. the remaining $300 will be distributed to those who had a hand in helping. I want to share this with you. I don't want to make money. 

For those of you who give generous contributions, I will be in contact regarding the perks of such donations. I thought about making the perks more concise based on specific dollar amounts contributed, but I'd much rather work out the details with you personally.

More than a tangible piece of myself, I want to share with you so you can share yourself with others. Any help, whether strictly financial or strictly communicative is, and will be greatly appreciated. 

I'm glad we've met. 

Thank you.

Matty

story:
¿Qué?

Como pez en regaliz narra una historia optimista y llena de esperanza; un viaje hacia la madurez a través del cual nuestro personaje se encontrará a sí mismo.

Si a Lucas Graham le hubieran dado a elegir entre ser un Especial o vivir fuera del alcance de la magia, no habría dudado en decantarse por la segunda opción. Sin embargo, Lucas no puede cambiar su vida. Él es un Especial y lo será para el resto de sus días. La profecía, por el contrario, tambaleará su modo de ver las cosas. ¿Podrán Lucas y sus amigos reunir el poder suficiente para salvar La Academia? O lo que es todavía más importante, ¿conseguirá Lucas encontrar a Nora?

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Ione Espinosa.

Nacida en Navarra en 1997, estudia Filología Inglesa en la Universidad Nacional de Educación a Distancia. Desde muy pequeña, su afán por la lectura la empujó a querer contar sus propias historias. Como pez en regaliz ha sido el primer resultado de ese gran amor hacia la escritura.

¿Por qué?

Por aquí un fragmento del texto a modo de muestra:

«—Muchacho —habló el mago—. Una vez conocí a un hechicero que lo único que podía hacer era leer su propio pensamiento. Aquel era un problema bastante más serio que el tuyo. Sus pensamientos y preocupaciones retumbaban es sus cabeza seis veces más fuerte de lo que puedan retumbar en la tuya. Siempre estaba triste o bajo de moral. Sin embargo, pasado un tiempo, empezó a desarrollar un segundo poder. En su caso emanaba mucho más poder al estar enfadado, y como motivos no le faltaban, acabó por desarrollarlo en menos que canta un gallo. 
     Lucas quiso preguntarle de qué segundo poder se trataba, sin embargo, se había quedado tan pasmado por el hecho de que el hechicero pareciese una persona normal, que se atragantó con sus propias palabras»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Como pez en regaliz que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ione Espinosa vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Ione Espinosa.
Nacida en Navarra en 1997, estudia Filología Inglesa en la Universidad Nacional de Educación a Distancia. Desde muy pequeña, su afán por la lectura la empujó a querer contar sus propias historias. Como pez en regaliz ha sido el primer resultado de ese gran amor hacia la escritura.
¿Por qué?
Por aquí un fragmento del texto a modo de muestra:
«—Muchacho —habló el mago—. Una vez conocí a un hechicero que lo único que podía hacer era leer su propio pensamiento. Aquel era un problema bastante más serio que el tuyo. Sus pensamientos y preocupaciones retumbaban es sus cabeza seis veces más fuerte de lo que puedan retumbar en la tuya. Siempre estaba triste o bajo de moral. Sin embargo, pasado un tiempo, empezó a desarrollar un segundo poder. En su caso emanaba mucho más poder al estar enfadado, y como motivos no le faltaban, acabó por desarrollarlo en menos que canta un gallo.      Lucas quiso preguntarle de qué segundo poder se trataba, sin embargo, se había quedado tan pasmado por el hecho de que el hechicero pareciese una persona normal, que se atragantó con sus propias palabras»
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Como pez en regaliz que saldría después a la venta.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ione Espinosa vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Positive is an international magazine founded in 2007 by Giacomo Cosua, together with Marco Folin and Livio Chiodega.

Our idea was to create an online space where people can find great pieces of journalism, amazing photos and projects, all aimed at embodying 1 fundamental element: quality.

WHAT WE HAVE WORKED ON SO FAR

We first launched Positive as a PDF-formatted Magazine whose contents were entirely free for anyone to download, and we have in fact been keeping them free for everyone ever since. 

In 2008 we started the website www.positive-magazine.com, and in 2013 we decided to expand our content offers by creating a new platform for our Italian readers (www.italy.positive-magazine.com)

Until today, 14 issues have been released online, which contain thousands of pages featuring interviews, photographs, critical reviews and overviews on various projects from all over the world.

In collaboration with the German Publishing company Seeds Project UG, we have been able to turn our dream into reality:

In 2015 we published our first print issue. This was an important achievement for us, as we have always been focus on challenging ourself into new goals. 

Printing our first magazine was just a new beginning for our project. So far after our first issue, we have been printing another 2 issues and now we are working on a new one.

WHAT YOU CAN FIND INSIDE POSITIVE:

Photography: You can find interviews with established young photographers, reviews and presentations of innovative and unreleased projects, plus one or more focuses on new trends.

Reportage: Initially set up as an ad-hoc project, these pieces talk about various international topics both chosen by the editorial staff and suggested by the contributors’ network of POSI+TIVE.

Art: Reviews and interviews with emerging artists together with particular attention to Italian and overseas events.

Design&Architecture: Interviews and reviews concerning emerging and established designers and architects.

Fashion: interviews, reviews and editorials dedicated to Italian and foreign fashion and emerging stylists, with a special focus on the Made-in-Italy.

Street Culture: Here the readers can find a showcase with the latest trends and cultural models concerning new medias, music and sports.

FACTS:

1) We distributed more than 2.500 articles online on our 2 websites from 2007 onwards.

2) On Issuu, one of the most important platforms for online magazines, we have gained almost 2.000.000 views on our 14 editions.

3) We covered significant affairs all around the world:

The Arab spring for instance, documenting the revolution which took place in Egypt day by day.

The American elections. We have been independently produced together with Tom Green a documentary in 2017 about the presidential election in America, traveling around different states, such as Texas, New York, Michigan, Maryland and Washington DC.

Cultural events, such as the Venice Film Festival, The Venice Art & Architecture Biennale, the G20 in Canada, The Cop21 in Paris, the international design week in Milan and many others.

The Fashion weeks all around the world, ranging from Milan, Paris, Berlin to London, showing the backstage scenes and the shows of the most noteworthy and emerging brands.

4) Social Media activity: With more than 29.000 likes on Facebook, we keep our followers updated everyday with new articles and all the other contents we have been creating.

PRINT ACTIVITY

5) First issue activity: Positive Magazine issue 1 has been printed, distributed and sold all around the world and has been recognized for the quality of images, the selection of articles and the stories produced in different fields.

6) Second issue activity: Positive n.2 has been presented in June 2016 during “Fashion at Iuav”, a 2 days event organized by the IUAV Architecture and Design University in Venice. Positive Magazine has been presented by Maria Luisa Frisa, one of the most important fashion design professor in Italy.

7) Third issue activity: Positive n.3 presentation took place at Spazio Punch in Venice. An incredible space that has been in 2017 also the exhibition area of the Icelandic Pavilion during the Venice Art Biennale.

KEEP WORKING

Positive has also an office in Marghera, just few steps out of Venice. Marghera is not just an industrial area, but it’s also a new opportunity. In the last years this area that was abandoned by the main industries became the perfect spot for young creatives and start-up companies. You can read more about Marghera on this article written by the Guardian.

WHAT’S NEXT?

With the help of our international sponsors such as Parley for the Ocean, Crash baggage, Bauer Hotel and few others, and the support of our amazing crowdfunders, we have been able to print 3 issues of the magazine.

Now We are ready to print our forth paper issue which will be distributed and sold around the world, thanks to our international distributor EXPORT PRESS present among the best bookshops and newsagents.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

We have a magazine ready to be printed with original stories from all over the world, fashion editorials, interviews with both prominent and emerging actors, musicians, photographers, architects and so forth. Exclusive contents that you will find only on our magazine.

What we need now is your contribution.

To continue to be independent and to keep up the quality of the contents and also to cover part of the costs of printing and shipping of our second issue (and paying our talented crop of local freelancers and all-volunteer team) we will need to raise at least €2,000.

What you can find on our issue number 4:

Some of our interviews:

1) François Civil, actor

2) Antoine Olivier Pilon & Antoine Desrochers, actors - Cover story

3) Rodolfo Cova, Film Producer

4) Alex Altman, sound engineer

5) Eudes Santana, photographer

6) Eliott Erwitt, photographer

7) David la Chapelle, photographer

8) The Libertines, band

Other contents:

9) Altana Skateboarding

10) Venice Film Festival Portraits

11) A reportage from Argentina by Jordi Ruiz Cirera

12) A refugee basket team by Liam Alyott

and much more... don't miss the chance to get your copy!

story:
The Story Behind My Book

Give it Our All is an overview of the non-profit sector within the United States. As someone who is passionate about charity, my interest lies in enlightening readers on its current state and the potential of what I am calling “sustainable charity”.

My name is Jennifer Ailey and I am the author of Give It Our All. I was interested in writing this book because of my experience talking about being a non-profit professional. It is primarily met with optimism and positive questions. Unfortunately, there are also times where it has been met with dismissive responses due to the perception that wages are incredibly low. Whether or not that is true is dependent on the organization and its mission, but my hope is to expand readers’ preconceived ideas. I particularly want to engage with my generation on the variety of forms in which charity takes shape, and why it is so important to give.

In reading this book, my hope is to share how rewarding charity can be. Because of the diversity in charitable campaigns and organizations I also hope to encourage a newfound respect for non-profit/charity leaders. Ultimately, I want you to see this book used as a tool to both aid where understanding charitable passions lie and how to successfully put those to good use.

In this book, you'll learn about grant writing and professionalism. You'll hear stories such as...
  • The gravity grant writing holds, especially for smaller, lesser known organizations
  • First hand experiences of the professionalization of the non-profit sector
  • Where effective altruism grew from and why you should implement it in your daily life

You will love this book if you are a history buff, a future entrepreneur, or if you enjoy any sort of volunteer work.

Give It Our All is a nonfiction book that speaks to both Gen Z and working professionals who want to look at ethical business strategies in a new way or expand your volunteer network.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in late Spring/early Summer. 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Jennifer is a recent graduate of Dickinson College, where her studies focused on English Literature and American Studies. Writing has always been a huge passion of hers, thus making the possibility to write a book an extraordinary opportunity. She currently works at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts in Philadelphia as a visitor associate.

Emboldened by her past professional experiences in creative non-profit spaces, Jennifer knew that her inkling towards charity was greater than the occasional visit. But there were times where her optimism on non-profit organizations was met with dismissive responses on the low wages and difficult success rates associated with the sector. Her point of entry into the research was to investigate this perception and illuminate other positive attributes of working for a non-profit.

Jennifer is outgoing, forward-thinking, and fun. She is often placed in leadership roles, both professionally and recreationally, because of her natural charisma. She is capable of banter with almost anyone and loves to get the conversation going. To complement writing, she spends a lot of her time reading novels and memoirs or stretching it out on a yoga mat!

For more information, you can connect with Jennifer at aileyj97@gmail.com and on her Instagram Page

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #[GiveItOurAll] and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

I truly appreciate support of any kind! 

Thank you so much, 
Jennifer Ailey

story:
Story of My Book

The Impact Mind: Understanding How to Drive Social Change in the New Economy uncovers the 12 key principles that can make you a more impactful individual. There has been a strong push to make positive change in our communities, but it can be difficult to know where to start or how to do that. Through insights from leaders across emerging industries, my book will help you pave a path to creating impact in today’s globalized world.

My name is Fareeha Mahmood and I am the author of The Impact Mind: Understanding How to Drive Social Change in the New Economy. I’m from Dhaka, Bangladesh, but I lived in Jakarta and Dubai before starting college in New York City. In every city I lived, I always witnessed a stark contrast between the life I was living and the lives of others. The unique mixture of luck, privilege and hard work (of my parents’ and a bit of mine) landed me in a position where I could harness these opportunities to truly make an impact.

I was determined to spark positive, tangible change. I wondered, “What are the new and innovative ways of creating social impact? What careers could I pursue to be most impactful? How would I get there?” To answer all of those questions, I wrote this book!

I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for driving social change, in you. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your ability to be impactful. From the stories I’ve gathered and collected, I’ve extracted key pieces of wisdom that can help you shape your life around your mission and make a change in the world.

In this book, you'll learn how to incorporate the 12 principles of The Impact Mind just like today's pioneers of change. Some of the principles include:
  • Discover your Mission: Amany Killawi, a driven and selfless entrepreneur who started off as a social worker, propelled by the desire to empower Detroit’s Muslim community after 9/11. As she got involved in fundraising for inner city youth, she discovered the power of crowdfunding and sought to bring it to the Muslim community by co-founding LaunchGood.
  • Lead with Impact: Rehana Nathoo, whose incredible careers in social finance at BNY Mellon, Rockefeller Foundation and Case Foundation ultimately inspired her to found her own impact investing strategy firm, Spectrum Impact.
  • Be Driven to Act: Chris Molaro, a former Army captain whose first-hand experiences with the inadequate and ill-equipped mental health system left him frustrated. Determined to advance the mental health space, he co-founded NeuroFlow, an integrated behavioral health platform that helps doctors engage their patients’ mental health through data and evidence-based practices.

 

The Impact Mind is a non-fiction book that speaks to driven and ambitious individuals who are looking to explore impact-oriented roles. You will love this book if you are curious to learn how can you maximize your impact - whether that’s through small, local changes or even large scale and structural ones. I hope the unique stories I share resonate with you and show you that there’s no one way to create social impact.

The Book - The Impact Mind

The book is written in 2 Parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction and the first chapter which provides an overview of the 12 principles by defining key terms and provides context of social impact in the new economy. You’ll get a glimpse into the exciting stories that encapsulate the impact mindset.

Part 2 includes Chapters 2-13. Each chapter includes stories of individuals who are creating an impact through their passions and fascinating careers. The chapters show how each change maker integrated these principles into their mission and how you can do the same. The chapters include stories from Essma Bengabsia, Georgia Grace Edwards and countless other trailblazers driving impact.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Fareeha Mahmood is a third-year college student at New York University majoring in Economics and Public Policy and minoring in Business Studies. Growing up in three drastically different but dynamic cities, Dhaka, Jakarta, and Dubai, Fareeha has been decisively shaped by her global perspective. She is driven to find purpose in everything she does, whether it’s fostering community through Student Council, learning about finance through the Islamic Finance Group at NYU, or analyzing programs and policies at the NYC Department of Small Business Services. But more importantly, the remarkable love and support of her parents, brother, family, and friends have driven Fareeha to push herself and embark on crazy journeys such as as writing a book!

Excited to pursue a career where she’s able to create impact, she thought, ‘Why not write a book to find out how?’ She’s determined to find ways to maximize every opportunity to make a change in this world, whether that affects one person or her entire community.

She is an ambitious, driven, but awkward-20 something at heart. She loves exploring New York with her friends, brunching with her cousins and watching the latest Netflix original.

For more information you can connect with Fareeha at fareeha.mahmood@gmail.com, @fareeha.mahmood (Instagram), or https://www.linkedin.com/in/fareeha-mahmood/ (LinkedIn)!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people aren’t able to contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheImpactMind and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Feel free to do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

story_txt:
Story of My Book
The Impact Mind: Understanding How to Drive Social Change in the New Economy uncovers the 12 key principles that can make you a more impactful individual. There has been a strong push to make positive change in our communities, but it can be difficult to know where to start or how to do that. Through insights from leaders across emerging industries, my book will help you pave a path to creating impact in today’s globalized world.My name is Fareeha Mahmood and I am the author of The Impact Mind: Understanding How to Drive Social Change in the New Economy. I’m from Dhaka, Bangladesh, but I lived in Jakarta and Dubai before starting college in New York City. In every city I lived, I always witnessed a stark contrast between the life I was living and the lives of others. The unique mixture of luck, privilege and hard work (of my parents’ and a bit of mine) landed me in a position where I could harness these opportunities to truly make an impact.I was determined to spark positive, tangible change. I wondered, “What are the new and innovative ways of creating social impact? What careers could I pursue to be most impactful? How would I get there?” To answer all of those questions, I wrote this book!I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for driving social change, in you. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your ability to be impactful. From the stories I’ve gathered and collected, I’ve extracted key pieces of wisdom that can help you shape your life around your mission and make a change in the world.In this book, you'll learn how to incorporate the 12 principles of The Impact Mind just like today's pioneers of change. Some of the principles include:

Discover your Mission: Amany Killawi, a driven and selfless entrepreneur who started off as a social worker, propelled by the desire to empower Detroit’s Muslim community after 9/11. As she got involved in fundraising for inner city youth, she discovered the power of crowdfunding and sought to bring it to the Muslim community by co-founding LaunchGood.

Lead with Impact: Rehana Nathoo, whose incredible careers in social finance at BNY Mellon, Rockefeller Foundation and Case Foundation ultimately inspired her to found her own impact investing strategy firm, Spectrum Impact.

Be Driven to Act: Chris Molaro, a former Army captain whose first-hand experiences with the inadequate and ill-equipped mental health system left him frustrated. Determined to advance the mental health space, he co-founded NeuroFlow, an integrated behavioral health platform that helps doctors engage their patients’ mental health through data and evidence-based practices.

 
The Impact Mind is a non-fiction book that speaks to driven and ambitious individuals who are looking to explore impact-oriented roles. You will love this book if you are curious to learn how can you maximize your impact - whether that’s through small, local changes or even large scale and structural ones. I hope the unique stories I share resonate with you and show you that there’s no one way to create social impact.
The Book - The Impact Mind
The book is written in 2 Parts...Part 1 contains the introduction and the first chapter which provides an overview of the 12 principles by defining key terms and provides context of social impact in the new economy. You’ll get a glimpse into the exciting stories that encapsulate the impact mindset.Part 2 includes Chapters 2-13. Each chapter includes stories of individuals who are creating an impact through their passions and fascinating careers. The chapters show how each change maker integrated these principles into their mission and how you can do the same. The chapters include stories from Essma Bengabsia, Georgia Grace Edwards and countless other trailblazers driving impact.

What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

 

About the Author
Fareeha Mahmood is a third-year college student at New York University majoring in Economics and Public Policy and minoring in Business Studies. Growing up in three drastically different but dynamic cities, Dhaka, Jakarta, and Dubai, Fareeha has been decisively shaped by her global perspective. She is driven to find purpose in everything she does, whether it’s fostering community through Student Council, learning about finance through the Islamic Finance Group at NYU, or analyzing programs and policies at the NYC Department of Small Business Services. But more importantly, the remarkable love and support of her parents, brother, family, and friends have driven Fareeha to push herself and embark on crazy journeys such as as writing a book!Excited to pursue a career where she’s able to create impact, she thought, ‘Why not write a book to find out how?’ She’s determined to find ways to maximize every opportunity to make a change in this world, whether that affects one person or her entire community.She is an ambitious, driven, but awkward-20 something at heart. She loves exploring New York with her friends, brunching with her cousins and watching the latest Netflix original.For more information you can connect with Fareeha at fareeha.mahmood@gmail.com, @fareeha.mahmood (Instagram), or https://www.linkedin.com/in/fareeha-mahmood/ (LinkedIn)!

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people aren’t able to contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheImpactMind and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Feel free to do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you all so much for your love and support. I could not do this without you!Thanks again,Fareeha Mahmood

story:
Story of My Book

Tasting YOUR OWN Medicine: How to Advocate for Yourself in Healthcare Settings is a book meant to empower individuals to take control of their medical decisions and to advocate for themselves during conversations with their health professionals and in determining the course of their care. It includes research and narratives from people who have experienced the healthcare system as patients or loved ones of patients and from professionals working within the system itself, while also including some of my own personal experiences as a patient.

My name is Karan Mirpuri and I am the author of Tasting YOUR OWN Medicine. I wrote this book because I wanted to provide individuals with an understandable, narrative-based resource that gives them guidance on how to become involved in their conversations with their health professionals. Being inquisitive and curious about your care does not make you a bad patient and providing patients with that voice both as a loved one and a health professional can be immensely valuable in their ultimate outcomes and benefit all parties involved. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover novel techniques to make conversations with your health professionals easier and less scary. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for patient advocacy and health education and awareness. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you navigate situations and conversations pertaining to your own health and supporting others who you care about in similar instances.

In this book, you'll learn about the doctor-patient relationship, emotional literacy, and the value of self-care. You'll hear stories such as...

From Karan to Karen - My journey going “undercover” as an expecting mother attending various Zoom classes on childbirth and pregnancy. It is filled with humorous moments and valuable insights about what we can learn from the doula model of care to support those we love through their medical experiences.

Emily Ross - The story of a young teenage girl in Michigan and how a simple blood test made her realize the value of being thorough and doing your due diligence as a patient.

Fred Lee - Having served as a vice president at two major medical centers and a cast member at Walt Disney World in Orlando, Fred Lee provides valuable insight regarding what the medical field can learn from amusement parks to enhance the quality of their care and the overall patient experience.

You will love this book if you are a patient in any stage of treatment, are a loved one or caregiver of a patient, work or are interested in working in health-related professions, or are interested in learning how to advocate for yourself in healthcare settings.

Tasting YOUR OWN Medicine is a nonfiction book that speaks to ordinary adolescents and adults, trained patient advocates, and healthcare professionals who want to look at patient advocacy, empowerment, and support in a new way.
 

The Book - Tasting YOUR OWN Medicine

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. This section is meant to provide context regarding how the doctor-patient relationship came to be what it is today, why we crave autonomy and the factors that motivate us to make the choices that we do, and what health education currently looks like for American youth and ways in which it can improve.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6. These chapters serve to develop the concept of the curious patient and caregiver, emphasizing the qualities and approaches that are applied to healthcare, such as viewing medicine as a team sport rather than a one-sided discussion, while also exploring the importance of emotional literacy from both the personal and professional perspectives. 

Part 3 contains chapters 7-9. As a culmination of the previous parts, Part 3 is meant to provide more actionable items for patients, their loved ones, and aspiring healthcare professionals so that they can apply this approach directly to their own care.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Karan Mirpuri is a sophomore at Vanderbilt University on the pre-medical track to pursue a career in the medical field. At Vanderbilt, he works as an undergraduate research assistant at the Vanderbilt SENSE (Social Emotional NeuroScience Endocrinology) Lab, where he assists in studies examining social and neurological development in individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorders. He also volunteers as a student VUceptor (Fall Orientation Leader), serves as one of the Alumni, Marketing, and Public Relations Coordinators of Camp Kesem at Vanderbilt University, and is one of the captains of Vandy Raas, Vanderbilt’s garba-raas dance team.

As a former patient who has undergone multiple procedures throughout his life, Karan wrote this book in hopes of learning more about the emotions and anxieties patients of all ages may experience in healthcare settings, regardless of the severity of their conditions. With this book, he seeks to provide individuals with a first step that motivates them to speak up during their doctors appointments and ensure that they reassure them that being curious and inquisitive about one’s care is not the sign of a bad patient.

Aside from his academic aspirations, Karan loves watching movies and TV shows, going to the beach, excessively snacking, and playing with his three yorkies Sophie, Lucy, and Lily. According to his friends, you may also recognize him as the sole person sprinting across parts of campus minutes before his next class or meeting.  

For more information, you can connect with Karan at karan.mirpuri@vanderbilt.edu and at @karan.mirpuri (Instagram).
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #[TastingYOUROWNMedicine] and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Karan Mirpuri

story:
SUMMARY

Maya Cameron-Gordon is a mom and former teacher based in Oakland, CA. Recognizing the lack of diversity in children's books, her dream in creating The Mermaid Princesses was to increase representation in stories for young readers.

Maya remembers people casting a lot of shame around having African heritage when she was growing up. Having a 6-year-old daughter, (to whom the book is dedicated) Maya wants to be a part of changing that narrative of shame toward one of self-love, pride and readers feeling like they can do anything. For kids outside of the African-American experience, she wants them to have a healthy exposure to characters from diverse backgrounds that they admire and want to be like.

Being that there are only so many "seats at the table" for creators of color in the publishing industry, this campaign aim is to help show people are willing to support diverse artists and diverse stories via fiscal contribution. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

This $10K will help us produce the books and other items at a healthy enough volume that we can be sustainable and continue to print and share the products in the future.

The money raised will be used in the manner below:

  • 70% | Developing + printing the FIRST EDITION PRINT of The Mermaid Princesses
  • 20% | Creating the MERMAID PLUSH TOYS sold in book packages
  • 10% | Producing custom MERMAID NOTEBOOKS sold in the book packages for kids to write their own story ideas after reading the story Maya wrote.

THE IMPACT

THE SAD TRUTH: According to the Children's Book Diversity Council, less than 10% of children's books in 2018 featured a main character of color. By the numbers, there are 3x as many books published featuring animals in the U.S. than those featuring Black, Latinx, Asian, Native American and African children COMBINED! Let's help to change this. 

A LONGSTANDING MYTH in the publishing world is that people just don't dig into their pockets to support creators of color in a financial way that justifies printing and publishing their works on a large scale.

Let's prove them wrong and show that diverse books of all kinds deserve a place on the shelf.

THE TEAM

Maya Cameron-Gordon | Author and Art Director

Maya is the creator of The Mermaid Princesses. As a mom and former expressive arts and mindfulness teacher for grades K-6, she's studied the lack of diversity and misrepresentations of ethnic groups in print and visual media. Her deeper hope is that the positive reflections in this book and works like these will help people better value Black life, intellect and ability from a young age. In addition, Maya is passionate about showing the diversity in mythologies from different places across the globe (include African mermaid myths amongst others).

Jesse Byrd | Campaign Lead, Editor, Art Director

Jesse is an award-winning children's book creator whose family has been in publishing for over 31 years with New York Times Bestselling works to their credit. Believing so much in this mission, Jesse's helping to lead this campaign to assure the project makes the most of every dime raised and this book receives its deserved exposure.

Mirelle Ortega | Illustrator of The Mermaid Princesses, 3D Artist, Concept Artist 

Mirelle is an illustrator and concept artist from south east Mexico, based in LA. Mirelle has a BFA in digital art and 3D animation, as well as an MFA from Academy of Art University in San Francisco. She has a passion for art and storytelling with some of clients being: Harper-Collins, Oh My Disney LA, Scholastic, Benchmark Education, ABDO and Little Bee.

Andressa Meissner | Typography, Illustration, Design

Andressa is an award-winning children's book illustrator based in Brazil who handled typography, text/print layout and design for our mermaid toys and notebooks.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Publishing Partnerships: Our ultimate goal is to partner with a major book publisher/distributor to guarantee this book and those to come are accessible in locations around the country and world.

Distribution: Our biggest challenge, as with many direct-to-market books, will be placement in bookstores and libraries. Even with over 50% of book sales taking place via Amazon, we are passionate about having a local presence in small businesses as well as chain bookstores. We have a growing list of target locations and will be updating you here as we add new libraries, bookstores, gift shops and organizational partnerships.

Being Evergreen: To extend the lifespan of this product beyond it will be important to build a community. Any referrals for virtual (later, in-person) storytime readings and book purchases for schools, libraries and organizations will be incredibly helpful. We have a list of those we plan to approach and have begun reaching out.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We're stronger and more effective together. Every purchase, referral and mention amongst your network and community truly matters.

If you're unable to help fuel this mission financially, please help us out by sharing the word amongst your social and personal circles!

story:
"Jenny needed a bath... But Jenny didn't like baths."

My name is Alexander Jackson.  I'm a UK based illustrator and writer.  I recently recently wrote a children's book titled Jenny's Bath.

In Jenny's Bath, a boy named Saul discovers that something stinks.  After discovering that the smell is coming from his dog, Jenny.  Saul tries to give Jenny a bath, but Jenny doesn't like baths.  The story cover Saul's various attempts to get Jenny into the bath.

My book has received a great deal of positive feedback including an honourable mention in 3x3 magazine after being entered into a worldwide competition and offers to be stocked  and sold by various independently run bookshops if it goes to print.  I have been contacted by a number of people requesting a copy.

Jenny's Bath is particularly good for children with autism.  Throughout my own experiences of having ASD I have become particularly interested in story telling through observing body language, facial expressions and mannerisms as these kinds of things can be very challenging to pick up on for people with similar problems.

HOWEVER - As much as I would love everyone to own a copy of this book, my attempts to get the work published have been unsuccessful in spite of the demand for it.  It looks like the self publishing route is currently my only option - which is very expensive and I can't afford it.  That is where YOU come in.  I'm in need of assistance in funding the whole messy process so I won't have to charge unrealistic amounts for copies to help cover the costs of production.  Money will go towards printing, marketing, promotion, developing the finished product, which should hopefully include an ebook version.  Unfortunately all of this stuff costs a bit more than I had previously anticipated.

I'm in the process of writing a couple more in the series, so if this is a success it'll hopefully get the follow up books made.

If you're unable to contribute, financially, then if you could just share the cause and spread some awareness of my work that would be fantastic.  If you are able to donate, then still spread the word!

story:
ABOUT US

Hi! This is Elisabeth and Phillip. We are producers who use poetry and performance to nurture community and creativity. We’ve formed The Poetry Society of Los Angeles and produce and direct The Poetry Brothel on the West Coast. We also facilitate writing and performance workshops that seek to positively transform our community of participants.

Over the last year we have piloted Poetry Brothels and Writing and Performance Workshops in San Francisco and Los Angeles. We are ready to build on this powerful momentum, and we need your help!

HOW WE’RE GOING TO BUILD

Starting May 2014 we will take our work to the next level. This campaign will fund venue rental and supplies for an entire year of programming including:

  • 3 Poetry Brothels in Los Angeles 
  • 3 Poetry Brothels in San Francisco Bay Area
  • 4 writing and performance workshops between LA and SF

Campaign funds will also subsizdize:

  • 2 writing and performance workshops for at-risk homeless youth and women in our community
  • Travel for 2 performers to the 2014 New York Poetry Festival produced by the visionary Poetry Society of New York
  • Care and nurturing of our growing network of performers, community-builders, and audiences

OUR VISION

We believe creativity is a force to unite and strengthen communities. Poetry and Performance make it even funnier and sexier.  Shazam!

We are determined to strengthen ties between Los Angeles, San Francisco, and other affiliated hubs of creativity in California, and beyond. And we’re not alone. The Poetry Society of Los Angeles is a part of a growing movement sparked by the innovative Poetry Society of New York, the founders of the Poetry Brothel. Through community building and generosity of spirit, they have inspired the creation of poetry and performance communities across the globe—from New York to Bogotá, to Madrid, Zurich, New Orleans, to our groups in Los Angeles and San Francisco.

JOIN OUR MOVEMENT!

Whether you have known us for years, or our new to our work, we invite you to join our movement. Please contribute today and share our campaign with your community!
