story:
Short Summary

100% GOAL REACHED!  THANK YOU FEARLESS FUNDERS.

EVERY PENNY WILL BE SPENT TO THE WORD OUT ABOUT THIS GRASSROOTS STORY FROM THE DARK HEART OF CAPITALISM.

And you can now contribute on IN DEMAND until the end of time.  We will need ongoing support so please don't forget us.  No contribution too large or small. 

Thanks to our fearless supporters we already have some orders for the book.Graveyards of the Banks - I did it for the money) But we need to reach a much much broader audience which is not accessible to a small publisher.  We are competing with the biggest boys on the planet.  Promotion is very very expensive -both in time and in money.  We can't do it all alone.

Help us! Even a tiny contribution makes a difference to us. 

'Graveyards of the Banks'  is a haunting trilogy that tells the inside story of the Most Successful Bank in the Universe from a unique perspective, the story of a forgotten tribe of jobless humanities graduates who abandon all hope and enter the Third Basement of the Building Without A Name for a life on the graveyard shift.  

The author worked on that night shift herself for seven years in a toxic bubble of bitches and bullies where the Bank conducts human experiments to select the Fittest to Rule.  'I smuggled that story out in my head and my heart', she says.

How does it feel when you spend night after night in an iron chair with no toilet breaks and fear of being fired at the end of your shift?  How do you survive the angry bankers, fighting to be noticed by their superiors who groom them for 'leadership'?  Their shouting resembles constant gunfire.  They see themselves as predators, and Nyla is their prey.  But almost all of them will fail.  How do you make it through the next cull, when 20% of the workforce must be eliminated?

How do you live, how do you love? How can you sleep during the day while the Monsters are Arising?

Most of the stories about the world of finance are told in the voice of the bankers.  It is tough for a small voice from the graveyard shift to be heard, but Nyla is daring to raise that voice.  She speaks not just for herself but for many others. 

What We Need & What You Get

Help us get the word out about this book.  We need an investment of at least $1,000 as seed money to start a publicity campaign to get Nyla's voice heard and the story of her forgotten tribe out of the midnight shadows.No one will hear that story unless we get it out.  And getting a story heard is very very difficult.

The author and the publisher have invested in all the creative and administrative tasks: writing and editing the book, creating the covers, layout, videos, blurbs...  What we need now is a publicity campaign  to reach as many people as possible and for that we need funding.

All the money raised will go towards our campaign to get this book to the readers. We will conduct a sophisticated and specialised online publicity campaign.  The kind of campaign that works.  But it costs money.  Nyla's entire share of the proceeds of this book will also go into promotion for the first year.  (After investing  5 years of working on the book which she financed from her savings.)

Your donation will be rewarded by unique perks - and you will be part of an exciting journey.  You can be as close or as distant to our campaign as you like, and you can of course contribute anonymously.

Volume 1: 'I did it for the money' will be published on 6 March 2015 and is already available for pre-order on Amazon. http://www.amazon.com/Graveyards-Banks-Midnight... 

Volume 2: 'Monsters Arising' and Volume 3: 'Slaughterhouse Morning' will be out later in 2015.

    The Impact

    In spite of high praise by big name publishers (Nyla was published by a 'Big Five' publisher a few years ago under a different, very secret name), 'Graveyards of the Banks' was considered too controversial for publication.

    If you contribute to our venture, you will give a voice to people like Nyla and her former colleagues who know too much and are still invisible.  We promise you will never look at the world of finance quite in the same way again.  You may even change your mind about the meaning of success and happiness.

    'I did it for the money' is also a great read.  Dark, acerbic humour and deeply felt emotions follow each other as the clock strikes midnight, as night turns to morning, as the dawn rises behind St Paul's.  It will make you laugh, it will make you cry...

      Risks & Challenges

      'Discoverability' is everything in the world of books.  And the only way to get it is through a professional publicity campaign.  This was done very very successfully with one of Nyla's secret books and she knows it works.  But it all depends on the funding.  

      The risk is that the book we will not get that funding and that we will therefore not be able to reach enough readers.  But we will do everything we can, whatever the outcome of this campaign. Every penny will be put to good use.  'Graveyards of the Banks' needs to be read.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        In spite of a contribution ticket starting at $5, some people just can't afford to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

        WRITE A REVIEW!  REVIEWS HELP PEOPLE TO BUY THE BOOK!

        • One way to help is to buy the book.
        • If you can place a professional review, please let us know.
        • If you can help with getting the word out in some other way, again, please let us know.  Share whatever you can on social media and in real life.  It's free to like Nyla's facebook page! https://www.facebook.com/NylaNox 
        • And please use the Indiegogo share tools!  Even if you don't contribute, it will help us to get the attention of other potential donors here.

story:
My name is Damian Kolodiy and I am a documentary filmmaker. My biggest project was a documentary on the Orange Revoluiton in Ukraine called "The Orange Chronices". I was initially going to raise funds specifically for me to return to Ukraine  ( I was there from Dec 14, 2013-Jan 10, 2014) to do additional filming and continue doing an English language video live stream:

www.ustream.tv/channel/dkvovk

But in the scheme of current events, it feels selfish for me to ask money specifically for my work, when there are people in Ukraine physically suffering who need it more. The video says it all I think. A generous donor has agreed to cover my airfare, so I have decided to act as a messenger to deliver funding personally to Maidan. I have set the minimum benchmark for $3000. So we must hit that goal for Indiegogo to release any funding. There are several different categories that could use funding: 

-Medical (money goes specifically towards medical supplies, resources etc)

-Maidan general (would be delivered to Budinok Spilok for food, blankets, supplies etc)

-Spilno TV- Do live streaming from the front lines. I will be working with them to do English language live stream and daily English language updates. Funds are always needed for live streaming cameras and mobile internet etc.

Donors may indicate their preference, if any.

I will do my best with the limited resources I have to continue to do my own live streaming with English commentary while I am there. I have noticed that there are many campaigns on Indiegogo trying to raise funds for Maidan. And it seems to me that there is a question of trust. I can promise this:

I will document the delivery of said funds through the live video stream for transparency and accountability.

If you don't know me personally, you can learn more about my point of view on the situation in Ukraine in this essay I wrote here:

http://storify.com/DamianKolody/war-in-ukraine-...

I feel having a commute could be dangerous, so if anyone has any reasonable leads for avail apts on or near Maidan, that would be very helpful. Please feel free to reach out with any questions or suggestions. 


Slava Ukrayini!

story:
I'm making a 20-page zine about Linux debugging tools I love. I'm going to give it away online, and give away printed copies to people I meet at conferences.

I've done this before! I made a zine about strace that I give away on my website for free, and it's helped a ton of people debug their problems better. It was super popular, and I think you'll love this one too.

But printing isn't free. Last time I spent $400 to print zines and give them to people. To print 500 zines, it costs me about $500. I don't need or want to make money from this (telling people about `perf` is its own reward <3), but it's becoming a somewhat expensive side-project.

So! You can either get early access to the zine PDF for $5, or get one shipped to you. If you want to end up with more than one physical copy, the best way to do that is to print a bunch on your own :). I'll put up a guide to how to print it at a print shop.

If you just want the zine when it's out, awesome!! You can follow my blog (http://jvns.ca) or twitter (@b0rk), and you can have it for free. If you want to support linux debugging tools evangelism here (and get early access), that would be amazing ❤.

To get an idea of what this will look like: here are 3 sample pages from my latest draft:

story:
ALL donations are Tax-Deductible!

Starbound Youth Ministries is the youth ministry of Faith Church of the Valley, an Evangelical Free Church located in Chandler, AZ. We are disciples of Christ who are on mission to make more disciples of Christ and to share the love and peace of Christ to the needy, broken, and lost. 

Americans often tend to think of poverty as distant and global instead of local and national. Let's be honest: the majority of us are privileged and are able to sustain some form of a comfortable lifestyle. But what's unfortunate is that our local and national poverty issue tends to dismissed, overlooked, even ignored. It is sad when students and adults are able to live without ever coming in contact with the struggles and needs of others.

This is why Starbound Youth Ministries is heading to the heart of Los Angeles. In Los Angeles alone, 90,000 people experience homelessness (with only 18,000 shelter beds in the city) each night with more than 10,000 people living on what is commonly referred to as, "Skid Row." Skid Row is an area in Los Angeles that makes up 5 square miles that is essentially a dwelling place of homeless in the city. 

Skid Row is often looked at as a place of hopelessness and depravity, unreachable and unchangeable. But isn't this description true of what Scripture says of each one of us? We were all hopeless, depraved, unreachable, and unchangeable until the Word became flesh and made His dwelling among us. If Jesus walked the earth in flesh and blood today, Skid Row would be His dwelling place ministering to the "least of these."

In the book of Acts, we see what the early Christian church looked like: "All who believed were together and had all things in common; they would sell their possessions and goods and distribute the proceeds to all, as any had need" (Acts 2:44-45).

Partner with us and help us get to Los Angeles where we can embrace the hurting, feed the hungry, clothe the naked, and be the hands and feet of Jesus loving on those who need to experience the love of Christ.

Would you consider donating to our cause? Maybe this means sacrificing your latte from Starbucks, skipping In n Out burger, or even digging deep and making your monthly tithe to this mission. We will take anything and everything, including your prayers!

*NOTE: ALL donations are tax-deductible. Upon donation, you should receive a receipt with tax information.

The Impact Abroad and at Home

The hope and prayer for this trip is that our efforts and work in Los Angeles changes lives. We pray that God would move hearts and that the Spirit would work through us in Los Angeles. Similarly, we pray that we learn innovative and creative ways to minister locally in Phoenix, AZ. 

It is my (Ryan) prayer that this trip will change the lives of Starbound students and ignite a passion in them for the lost, needy, and hurting. I want Starbound to be known more for our love, heart, and service to the "least of these" than what happens inside our walled youth room. 

In Christ,
Ryan Collins

story:
(Logo abaixo tradução para o português)

The black publishing house Ogum's Toques performs this campaign to raise $ 30,000 which will enable the publication and dissemination of ten (10!) books in different literary genres written by black writers: juvenile, novel, poetry, short stories and science.

The publishing market in Brazil, as well as the Brazilian society, practice an extremely sophisticated type of racism, the institutional one, honoring authorship white, male, heterosexual, bourgeois and from the Southern /  Southeast of Brazil.

In order to transform this scenario, this will be just another chapter in the history of struggle against the Brazilian cultural genocide, and it will be writen with maximum possible hands. Come and be part of this script. All the donators will have their names at the acknowledgements of the books.


The donation can be of any amount, from $1 to any other amount. All donations above $ 100 will receive a shirt from Ogum´s Toques, a symbol of trust in this endeavor. Join us!

story:
My Brother Earl
We are reaching out for help for our brother, our uncle and our friend and his family. His name is Earl Burgess Jr , He grew up here in Plymouth Mass, went to the school here and graduated here. Got married here, bought his home here, had his 4 children here. On December 10, 2011, He was diagnosed with a very rare type of cancer it is called Mantle Cell Lymphoma. He has already endured 6 months of Chemotherapy and everything that goes along with it. Currently he is getting more treatment at Massachusetts General Hospital and is also going through a Stem Cell Transplant. This particular type of Lymphoma is very aggressive and is highly likely to return. Even if this stem cell transplant works he will still be fighting for his life.
Earl is the kindest most caring person anyone could meet. Like most of us (working class people) he was barely getting by when he was healthy. He was always trying to be positive, as he worked two jobs and struggled to pay their mortgage every month. Being a relatively healthy young man at 47 he did not have health insurance because of the financial expense . He got a sore throat in November of last year. When he didn’t think twice about it due to the fact it was the holiday season and he couldn’t afford to miss any time from work . After all… it was just a sore throat and was nothing to be too concerned about.
Being the bread winner of the family he hasn’t worked since November of 2011. He has been going through his treatments and has applied for disability. This is extremely degrading for him because of his pride and he has never not worked for anything in his life. He is in denial and still in disbelief as we all are.
Getting to the point of this letter, we are in the process of having a fundraiser for him and his family. He is in the process of losing his home at this time, for falling behind on his mortgage since he can not work. Just recently he got a foreclosure notice. They only have one vehicle which is old and very unsafe. This vehicle is the only thing that is able to shuttle him to the hospital, his wife to work and them both home again safely. We would love to raise enough money to pay for his mortgage and get them a safe vehicle. Please make an effort to try and donate to this family in need in any way you can. Anything you can do to help us help him would be greatly appreciated. If you could make it to the fundraiser which will be held on July 21, 2012 at 6pm at the Garibaldi Club in North Plymouth. It is $25.00 per person. If you are unable to make it then please find it in your heart to donate to the website . The website is www.Indiegogo.com and go to search bar in the upper right hand corner and type in My brother Earl (he is the first picture on the left, created by Cynthia Zaniboni). Thank you from all his family and friends. Your donation are desperately needed and are greatly appreciated . Contributions are not tax deductible. Also all the funds will be sent up in trust account for him.

story:
Hello, thanks for visiting us! My name is Lisa and my daughter is Hannah. Recently, Hannah asked me with imploring eyes that sought the truth...'Is Santa real?'

What happens now, I wondered....? Does this mean no more joy at discovering that a tooth can become a coin? No more wide-eyed wonderment at the tree fairies who magically make green leaves turn gold? Will there be no more magic in her little world?

Kids grow up quickly these days. They are more perceptive and aware than ever before. They know what's real and what's not....they lose belief in magic far too young. 

Our idea is to create a new approach to Christmas stories for children. The story blends reality with myth to appeal to the modern, intelligent, globally-aware 21st century child.

The solution: Visit the North Pole, and record the journey as a photo storybook. Hannah will visit Santa's playground to dine with elves, ride with reindeer, make a snowman, and meet the Man Himself (hopefully)!  By weaving stories of magic into the real story of a young girl's adventure, we hope to encourage other children to keep finding magic in their own world.

There is too much harsh reality in our world. Let's encourage magic for as long as we can! 

What We Need 

Hannah is trying to raise funds for her trip to the North Pole. Her idea was to charge $2 per child for facepainting at our local cafe, but she may need a little help with fundraising!  

We are hoping for $9000, which is the cost of Hannah's trip to the North Pole, and some money towards publishing. The amount we are seeking is half the total money we need for the journey and publishing costs. We would be VERY GRATEFUL if we receive more than our target. 

The Impact

The photo storybook - North Pole Dreaming - is a new approach to children's books. It  blends fact and fiction for the 21st century child. 

Not all beautiful stories need to be fictional. Likewise, not all reality has to be ugly. This new approach to children's stories will help kids find the beauty in truth. And hopefully, it will be a way of seeing the world that they will accompany them into adulthood. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute money to our campaign. If not, we would really appreciate your help in spreading the word! Please tell your friends and family, and share our campaign on social media. 

Help keep childhood magic alive!!!

Love, Hannah and Lisa xx

Thank you for taking an interest in my campaign. I'm trying to raise funds for my first appearance as a published author at the Author Reader Convention in New Orleans. This amazing event is this July, and I couldn't be more excited. I'm also hoping to make enough to attend DragonCon this September, in Atlanta.

Any funds raised will go toward my accommodations, as well as promotional materials required for the event, such as banners, glossies of my eBook covers, business cards, and swag gifts for the readers.

Your help would be most appreciated, no matter what amount you're able to donate. Every bit helps me reach my goal. I love being a romance author, and I hope to do this for the rest of my life.

My 1st novel, Dark South: Shifter, is available from my publisher's website. Loose-id.com

My 2nd novel, Secrets of Salem: Equinox, will be released April 21st.

Both novels are MM (gay) erotic romance, with a paranormal edge.

Again, thank you for taking the time to stop by my campaign. Your generosity will help me fulfill my dreams.

story:
Continuing with my determination to get something good out of last year's challenges, I'm putting together a small limited edition signed and numbered chapbook, hopefully illustrated, of 15-20 cancer poems.  Boy, 'cancer poems' sound depressing.  But I think these are not, actually.  Aiming to raise $500 to cover designer, printing and mailing costs.  Here's a sample (not yet illustrated):

Tornado

We knew it would rain today, but

driving to the first chemo appointment,

the radio upgrades the warnings _

thunderstorms, yes, the drops hammer

against the windshield. But hail too,

strong winds, the chance of a tornado.

The garden is waking slowly, early snowdrops

giving way to scilla and chiondoxa,

tiny and tough. With rising warmth, bluebells

and crocus emerge, daffodils open. Cool whites

and blues are joined by warmer tones; pink

hyacinths release their scent _

washed away in today’s storms.

Some flowers may survive. Others will be beaten

down, petals tattered, leaves and stems dragging

in the mud. Tomorrow I will walk my garden

and count the toll of devastation, mourn each

brave blossom _ my hands dug them in,

planted them deep, for this?

But roots survive, the bulbs beneath the soil.

Most daffodils still hold themselves tight-budded,

will open when the sun returns; the tulips

will spring forth, straight and proud and tall.

Into every life a little rain must fall. Last night,

we read over the lists of symptoms and side effects.

No toxins in my soil, but we still pour them

into my body, to fight this strange unwanted growth.

At garden club, I ask, despairing, what to do

about the burdock _ I dig and dig, but it keeps

coming back, the bastard. A long taproot, tenacious.

She says even eco-conscious sorts

may resort to poison in the end. But rather

than pouring it over the plant, the soil,

they paint it on, delicately, with a paintbrush.

The new drugs work like a paintbrush _ focused,

targeted. We hope their poisonous effects

will be lessened and contained. There will still,

undoubtedly, be some damage.

We ask the universe for a favor today.

Let the worst of the storms pass us by,

let the tornado touch down, lightly, and rise again.

Let the winds dissipate

while there are still flowers on the bud.

Let the sun return.

story:
Hello, my name is Christine Anderson. I am an artist/photographer/designer who lives in North Jersey, USA. I am looking to fund the print production of my book Wizard. I am very proud of this book because I not only created the art but I also designed the book myself so book works as a whole and is exciting and interesting rather then being  a book made from do it yourself software. This is the first time I have created a book for myself and I am creating a small run of 250 7.5 by 11 inch soft cover books on text paper with cover stock. I am printing the book digitally because I am creating a small run of book and wish the project to be cost effective.

WIZARD is a creative portrait of my car mechanic and his shop. I was inspired to create the book during one of my many visits to my mechanic.

WIZARD Project Statement.

I love my car.

I hate my car.

I hate my car.

I love my car.

After 14 years and 78,000 miles my car—a green Volkswagen Beetle—is still cute despite worn seats and pitted exterior. I don’t blame her for breaking down once in a while. Really, I don’t. You see, I’m a sentimental person. We have bonded and mostly I like to think of her as vintage rather than old. It makes me feel better about our relationship.

Over the years, many mechanics have serviced the car. Kal, our current mechanic, has a way of giving me bad news without making me feel bad. His manner and his expertise inspired me to create the pictures featured in Wizard. Kal is a lot like the Wizard from the Wizard of Oz story and I am perhaps a bit like Dorothy in the story. I bring my broken down car for repair and he fixes the car and sends us on our way. Dorothy, of course, sends herself home with the Ruby Slippers and eventually I will find my way to a new car. But for now I am thankful the Wizard is here keeping my car and me together.

Kal allowed me to photograph his shop during working hours, giving me access to premises, people, and auto parts. This book is a portrait of Kal’s car repair shop loosely based on the Wizard of Oz story enhanced with my own creative inspirations.

ARTIST BIO

Christine Anderson

Christine Anderson was born in 1964 in New Jersey (United States). She received her BFA in Painting from Long Island University, Southampton in 1986. A professional Designer / Art Director, Christine is a well known and respected Fine Arts Photographer. Her work has been shown in Europe and the United States and has been featured in Vogue Italia, L’Oeil de la Photographie, and other publications.

Where is the Money going?

The money I am looking for is for the actual printing of book. The production of the book is finished and I plan to have the book printed within the next month or two. An help would be appreciated and any amount would help greatly. Any money made from the sale of book will go towards future projects.

story:
In March 2015, a new creative writing project called Fighting Words Belfast was born.  Supported by a partnership between Young at Art , 174 Trust , Skainos and Fighting Words in Dublin, Fighting Words Belfast is a place for children and young people to come and play with words, to share their ideas and imaginings, to write stories and hear those of others. 

As Project Co-ordinator for Fighting Words Belfast, and previous volunteer with Fighting Words in Dublin, I thought it would make for a grand adventure (and a good story or two) to take part in the Co-operation Ireland Maracycle, pedalling the 108 miles from Dublin to Belfast. All money raised will be shared between Co-operation Ireland and Fighting Words Belfast. 

You can follow the progress of Fighting Words Belfast by clicking here.

Thank you for your support!

story:
INDIE MAG is a new online and print magazine for independent musicians highlighting scenes, musicians, and music-driven causes from around the world. It’s all about spotlighting the best independent musicians and innovators and celebrating them. INDIE MAG’s mission is to create a publication that is positive and of value to the global independent music community.

The INDIE MAG Project – Publishing with a conscience.

INDIE MAG has been operating as a passion project for 1 year. We are now on a mission to create a social enterprise that raises funds for the indie music community through the publication of INDIE MAG. In order to do this, we need to keep INDIE MAG viable. If you value the kind of platform we are providing for independent musicians all over the world, then we ask that you show your support by making a contribution to this campaign.

How will it work?

We are developing a funding program that gives artists/bands grants to create projects – whether that project is an album, a video, a tour, a music program in India, etc. We want to provide artists with another opportunity to seek financial support simply on the merit of their ideas and their musically-inspired vision for themselves and the world. Profits generated through sales from the issues will be funneled back into the independent music community. Throughout this process, we will also be establishing key partnerships to bring even more opportunities to our readers and artists in the community.

Join In

You can join us in making this ideal publishing utopia a reality. Why not just give the funds raised here away? Because by building a stable foundation for the magazine, we will be able to accomplish so much more than what just one campaign can. We will also be able to create a foundation for the project that is self-sustaining. 

Talking to artists has shown us that the time is right for this kind of platform. Now, more than ever, indie artists need support and they need tools that can help them get their music and their message out into the world.

Our newest issue is our biggest yet. At this stage, we are maxed out with what we can produce without a budget. But producing the content is only one piece of the puzzle. To make this project work, we also need to be able to enhance our online presentation, put together social networking initiatives and develop a workable grant procedure that can be launched in less than a year.

The funds raised on Indiegogo will go towards:

  • Building our website
  • Designing the issues
  • Developing the content
  • Partnership Development
  • Marketing & Promotional Campaigns
  • Research & Development
  • Editorial Consultancy
  • Development of project grant process

Who have we featured so far?

Our coverage has included Derek Sivers (founder of CDBaby and frequent TED speaker), Kevin Jennings (CEO of Be the Change and former Education Czar for President Obama), Patty Schemel (Hole/The Cold and Lovely), Concrete Blonde, Neon Choir, PJ Harvey, Joseph Arthur, Juan Alderete (The Mars Volta/Big Sir), Noah and the Whale, Corey Hart, Lisa Papineau, Rock n' Roll Camp for Girls Los Angeles, Frank Turner, Indie On the Move, Tom Waits, Maximum RNR, Lexapalooza, Tinariwen, Handsome Furs, Yuto Miyazawa, the Layne Staley Memorial Fund, Deli Radio, Animals Asia, SoundOut Singapore, The Novocaines, Kitara Digital Guitar, the EARS foundation, Hunter Valentine and many, many more. Please visit our Tumblr page to view all of our issues.

Rewards

Indie Mag has proudly teamed up with Wear Your Music to offer some awesome rewards for your contributions! Wear Your Music is a brand that represents the intersection of music, fashion and philanthropy with everything from stone picks to personalized guitar string bracelets to vinyl record bowls. Their strings have been donated by the likes of Eric Clapton, Joan Jett, MGMT, Keith Richards, Pete Townsend, Bonnie Raitt, Ani DiFranco, Kirk Hammett, Noel Gallagher and many, many more. There are also co-editor contributions, house concerts, advertising slots, fitness plans and much more up for grabs!

Indie Mag is a global endeavor with contributors and advisors based in Europe, Asia and the US. Everyone’s bio is too long to list, but feel free to Google us for more comprehensive info!

We receive so many emails telling us how much INDIE MAG's presence is appreciated. We appreciate your appreciation:) If you truly value the kind of platform we are providing for independent musicians all over the world, then we ask that you show your support by making a contribution to this campaign. Long live indie!

INDIE MAG is a new online and print magazine for independent musicians highlighting scenes, musicians, and music-driven causes from around the world. It’s all about spotlighting the best independent musicians and innovators and celebrating them. INDIE MAG’s mission is to create a publication that is positive and of value to the global independent music community.
The INDIE MAG Project – Publishing with a conscience.
INDIE MAG has been operating as a passion project for 1 year. We are now on a mission to create a social enterprise that raises funds for the indie music community through the publication of INDIE MAG. In order to do this, we need to keep INDIE MAG viable. If you value the kind of platform we are providing for independent musicians all over the world, then we ask that you show your support by making a contribution to this campaign. 
How will it work?
We are developing a funding program that gives artists/bands grants to create projects – whether that project is an album, a video, a tour, a music program in India, etc. We want to provide artists with another opportunity to seek financial support simply on the merit of their ideas and their musically-inspired vision for themselves and the world. Profits generated through sales from the issues will be funneled back into the independent music community. Throughout this process, we will also be establishing key partnerships to bring even more opportunities to our readers and artists in the community.
Join In
You can join us in making this ideal publishing utopia a reality. Why not just give the funds raised here away? Because by building a stable foundation for the magazine, we will be able to accomplish so much more than what just one campaign can. We will also be able to create a foundation for the project that is self-sustaining. 
Talking to artists has shown us that the time is right for this kind of platform. Now, more than ever, indie artists need support and they need tools that can help them get their music and their message out into the world.
Our newest issue is our biggest yet. At this stage, we are maxed out with what we can produce without a budget. But producing the content is only one piece of the puzzle. To make this project work, we also need to be able to enhance our online presentation, put together social networking initiatives and develop a workable grant procedure that can be launched in less than a year.
The funds raised on Indiegogo will go towards:

Building our website
Designing the issues
Developing the content
Partnership Development
Marketing & Promotional Campaigns
Research & Development
Editorial Consultancy

story:
Tina Brooks lived in a quiet rural area that was incredibly normal until the Parker family moved in. Within no time at all, very strange things began to happen that affected both the Brooks and the Parker families.
David, Cody and Sherry Parker get sucked into a mystery that is very frightening, but know that without their help, Tina will never figure it out.

story:
Coffee Table Books About Their Boats By Owners and Crews

 

   

 

Here's the thing - you don't need to own a boat to participate in this campaign.

  

                                 

BoatBio's campaign is to preserve in literal form, as personalised self-published coffee table books, the magnificent legacy that the world of recreational boating / sailing has delivered.

The BoatBio program is convened by Mick O’Keefe, an experienced technical documenter, and also a lifelong sailing, boating and fishing enthusiast.  Partial visual impairment now restricts Mick’s on-site technical documentation activities, but hasn’t affected creativity, organisational capabilities or productivity. 

BoatBio is our “magnificent obsession” to give the boating community an easy way to express and record the bounty that boats have given us. 

 

Our Campaign

We want to encourage and facilitate people who appreciate boats everywhere to compose a quality coffee table book about their special boat, for posterity. And ensure this a labour of love.

 

            

                                  

Recreational sailing / boating is such a special blessing we humans get to bestow upon ourselves.  Millions of people take to the water in all forms of craft as often as they can, in all kinds of weather conditions, because they enjoy it so much. 

But do they accord proper appreciation of the trusty vessels that give them such joy – their cherished boats?  Memories will fade over time, so it is essential to organise and preserve the details of stewardship and enjoyment of a boat. One day it will pass into other hands, but if a well-crafted book remains, owners and following generations will always be able to enjoy their published legacy. 

So BoatBio is really all about extending the involvement, pleasure, and enjoyment of a boat's life, and most importantly, the memories.

 

How Your Participation Will Progress Our Cause

By contributing to our campaign here, you will enable us to greatly extend our reach and involvement with like-minded boating enthusiasts, story-tellers and readers around the world.

A modicum of extra resources immediately will greatly accelerate the development, packaging and roll out of the BoatBio programme, and assist with the recording of the universal romance of boats.

 

We Need To Raise $10k For Development

We need to raise development capital of $10,000 to progress technical work which will seamlessly integrate content capture, manuscript compilation, editing and final print production.The array of software tools we currently use require step-change interventions which can be tricky when a number of people are collaborating on a publication.  We want this to be fun all round for all, through a system that accommodates contributors progressing at different speeds on various aspects.We also need to produce presentation / demonstration materials (‘kiosks’) and establish a central direct contact / support function to place our BoatBio ‘kiosks’ in numerous strategic locations around the world (39 regional catchments around the world account for some 17,300 yacht clubs, marinas, harbours, chandlers, brokers).

 

Rewards for Participants

Apart from funding, we also want to attract people who might enjoy associate involvement in our quest. 
 
Accordingly, the rewards we offer are designed to attract people who can see the bigger picture - the possibility of a global community of hobby-writers lovingly recording their experiences with their special boats. In time, the literary record will be richer for these stories.
 
So whether you are interested for your own boat or one you sail on, or you would enjoy to see someone you know get a book about their boat underway, or you would like to help as a biographer or previewer, we have a 'perk' for you.
 
 
Whatever The Washup, We Will Persist

All net funds received by BoatBio from this campaign will be applied to the activities described herein, to the benefit of our contributors, even if our total target raising is not achieved. 

In other words, not raising the entire $10k will not be a complete show-stopper for us, just a delay while we grow organically more slowly. 

 

 Together We Can Make BoatBio A Huge Success

We are not newcomers to the field of producing collaborative publications for special-interest groups. 

Confidentiality undertakings prevent us from displaying the works we have done in online technical content collaborations with numerous partners.  The BoatBio system harnesses this wealth of experience and expertise.  We build our own websites and content compilation tools & templates.

Should anyone be interested in partnering with us to accelerate the rollout of BoatBio globally, and you'd like to discuss any aspects, we would be pleased to VOIP with you (Skype or Facetime).  Just drop us an email to set up the time / connection. Email mick@boatbio.com

As a contributor to or supporter of the BoatBio project, you will enjoy a great deal of personal satisfaction from helping to preserve for posterity the untold stories of devoted stewardship of special boats all around the world.

Even if you won’t be participating in our BoatBio campaign yourself, please tell everyone you know who is into boats about BoatBio.  Ultimately, we want BoatBio to be a viral phenonemon within the global boating community.

Please just use the share tools here to send this story out to everyone you think might be interested.

story:
Introduction. 

                     

Nearly ten years ago I had an idea for a sci-fi/fantasy adventure story. It would tell how two young brothers, along with their tutor and uncle, get sucked into a timecrack (a type of wormhole) and travel through time and space into another universe. This begins the search for their missing parents who were also taken by a timecrack.

A short run of the book was published and tested in the UK and Ireland under the title Timecrack, with a plan to follow with a series: The Timecrack Adventures.

The result, mainly through my own efforts in the UK and Ireland, saw the book selling successfully to a cross section of readers, including children, young adults and older fans of the genre. The book is now in local libraries, as well as a request by the prestigious National Library of Ireland in Dublin, to deposit my books there. See the early reviews.

More recently, the book has been sought by readers in the USA and Overseas. As a result of professional advice at the recent London Book Fair, I decided to use a well-established American publishing and marketing company to introduce a New Edition of Timecrack to meet the requests from these markets. The campaign will be followed by other books in the series.

I have already invested in the UK market, but publishing and marketing in the overseas markets is a very expensive business! However, with Indiegogo’s support and contributors who wish to help, we can meet the demands in these markets.

The new Timecrack print and eBook editions are already in preparation and will be available in late 2019/early 2020. The next two books, Copanatec and Varakite will follow in 2020.

I’m fortunate to have a team of friends and associates ready to help. And for those of you who want to support this campaign, there is a choice of PERKS to reward contributors, including the new exclusive Timecrack T-shirt!

 

My Background

I was born in Belfast, Northern Ireland, to parents who were profoundly deaf, so it was a silent house I grew up in. There was no radio, and TV was not available then; newspapers, books, and comics for me, were the prime source of entertainment. Outside, although my mother couldn't hear what was being said, the local cinema was a major attraction for both of us. My father was a shipyard painter, and was usually away in some part of the UK working on the big ships.

During my teens, I joined the Air Training Corps (ATC), which became part of a lifetime interest in aviation, space travel and the cosmos. I would read anything on these subjects, as well as early sci-fi and fantasy stories, including works by H. G. Wells - especially, The Time Machine and The War of the Worlds, which really captured my imagination!

I travelled extensively through Canada and America for a couple of years, before returning home to Ireland, where I built up a business supplying companies such as Coca Cola and sports organisations with their promotional advertising goods. Including the 5 Nations Rugby Championship tie, which I created and produced and sold internationally.

A few years later, I was diagnosed with prostate cancer. After a period of successful treatment, I was spurred to write about my experience, which, in due course, led to writing short stories. Eventually, it all resulted in exploring a long-held idea I had for writing The Timecrack Adventures.

The early reviews of the first short run of Timecrack were very encouraging, but with enquiries coming in from overseas, I soon realised I needed to invest in a proper marketing programme to reach new readers. On a visit to the London Book Fair (a massive event for authors and publishers to meet and discuss the potential of new books) I met with Steven Spatz, the president of BookBaby. The decision was made to pursue and upgrade the New Edition for the international market.

The New Edition of Timecrack will be produced by BookBaby, one of the biggest and most important marketing and self-publishers in America. This edition will be available in late 2019/early 2020, to be followed by the next two books, Copanatec and Varakite, during 2020. 

 

Early Reviews

A review by www.tellest.com the American fantasy website gives an overview of the first adventure:

‘Hey folks!  We’re using some of the momentum from our latest venture into the Otherworld to turn right back around and visit more works of great fiction.  And there’s no better tale than today’s issue to go with the theme.

One of my favorite Michael Crichton properties was Timeline.  And yes, I even loved the movie with Paul Walker and Gerard Butler.  If you’re a fan of the concept of finding ways through time and space, today’s promo is going to be right up your alley.

William Long’s Timecrack is one of those entertaining books that pulls you out of the monotony of day to day life, and thrusts you upon a whole new world.  In this first book in his series, we join the Kinross family in a beautiful, humorous, thrilling adventure when a portal opens and pulls them through to a fantastic, new world.’

Timecracks act as portals to other dimensions. They have existed since the creation of time, and when one arrives during a storm at the newly discovered pyramid site in the Yucatan jungle, it’s the beginning of a nightmare journey into another world for archaeologist, Malcolm Kinross and his wife, Lucy.

And when another timecrack strikes the secretive energy facility in New Mexico, their sons, Archie and Richard, along with their tutor, Marjorie, and their uncle, Professor John Strawbridge, all find themselves thrust into the same world of New Arrivals, ancient warring tribes and deadly enemies.

Richard is endowed with the ability to ‘see’ beyond his own world. Can he help Archie to find their parents, and help the scientists at Mount Tengi to find a way for all of them to return home, and can he escape the clutches of the mad high priest, Prince Lotane?

‘Timecrack is a lovely endeavor by William Long, you’ll be happy to know there are two more in the series, coming soon.  It has characters that are endearing and easy to relate to, and a world that is fully realized with secrets left to be discovered.  If you’re interested in this fun fantasy romp, get your copy today!’

M. McCullough  Daily Mirror  'William Long's Timecrack is a good old-fashioned science fiction romp in the true spirit of the father of the genre, H. G. Wells. This dizzying Boy's Own escapade through the wormholes of space and time will have you gripped to the last with its fantastical vistas of new exotic worlds and ancient civilisations.'

Karen Maitland  Bestselling Author  'A Rollercoaster Sci-Fi adventure that flings the reader headlong into other worlds that are all the more unnerving because they blend the fantastic with the familiar. You catch yourself thinking - somewhere in our past or our future this might actually be happening in all of us.'

 

Funds Raised                       

As mentioned earlier, publishing and marketing is an expensive business. The funds raised will cover a wide range of essential services, which will include the following:

Editing                                                   Copy and line by line corrections. 

Front & Back Cover                           Design & text formatting

Publishing                                             Minimum & maximum print runs

Marketing                                             UK, Ireland, USA & Overseas

Shipping                                                Worldwide

eBooks                                                   Creation & distribution

Website                                                  Ongoing development & promotion of the series

Indiegogo                                              Campaign costs

The Perks                                              Material costs

N.B. There will be updates on future campaigns in preparation for Copanatec and Varakite.

 

Books Plan

Timecrack                                                                     Est. publishing & shipping date: Jan. 2020

New Worldwide Edition

 

Copanatec   A Timecrack Adventure

New Worldwide Edition                                          Est. publishing & shipping date: Early 2020

 

Varakite   A Timecrack Adventure

New Worldwide Edition                                          Est. publishing & shipping date: Mid 2020

 

10 Tips On How I Wrote My First Book                                             eBook                    Current

                                                                                     

 

Other Ways You Can Help         

                      

Not everyone will be ready to contribute, but if you can email or share this message with other book lovers, anyone who might be interested in supporting the new Timecrack Adventures campaign, that would be great!

Everyone who does contribute will have the option of choosing one of the Perks, including the exclusive T-shirt which is already proving to be a winner! There is also the option of a personally signed copy of the New Edition of Timecrack. Due to cost and time constraints, this Perk is limited to 50 copies only, which involves shipping to me for signing and then shipping again to the contributor.

This is an exciting time for the campaign, and if you have read this far, I would like to thank you for taking a look at what we are trying to achieve here.

Bill Long

‘Timecrack is a lovely endeavor by William Long, you’ll be happy to know there are two more in the series, coming soon.  It has characters that are endearing and easy to relate to, and a world that is fully realized with secrets left to be discovered.  If you’re interested in this fun fantasy romp, get your copy today!’
M. McCullough  Daily Mirror  'William Long's Timecrack is a good old-fashioned science fiction romp in the true spirit of the father of the genre, H. G. Wells. This dizzying Boy's Own escapade through the wormholes of space and time will have you gripped to the last with its fantastical vistas of new exotic worlds and ancient civilisations.'
Karen Maitland  Bestselling Author  'A Rollercoaster Sci-Fi adventure that flings the reader headlong into other worlds that are all the more unnerving because they blend the fantastic with the familiar. You catch yourself thinking - somewhere in our past or our future this might actually be happening in all of us.'

Editing                                                   Copy and line by line corrections.

Publishing                                             Minimum & maximum print runs
Marketing                                             UK, Ireland, USA & Overseas
Shipping                                                Worldwide
eBooks                                                   Creation & distribution
Website                                                  Ongoing development & promotion of the series
Indiegogo                                              Campaign costs
The Perks                                              Material costs
N.B. There will be updates on future campaigns in preparation for Copanatec and Varakite.

story:
Visions of the past, an antique journal and a forgotten girl may not be the only barriers between Adelaide Anson and the truth about her parents’ deaths.

Fractured Past is the second book in the Crimson Time series that combines elements of history and time travel to creatively engage readers with the past and the women in it.

My name is Emily VanderBent, and I am the author of Fractured Past. I wrote this book because I believe in the power of words to create change, preserve the past and promote healing. We are all a sum of a million different stories. The Crimson Time series as a whole is my way of giving voice to women in the past, creatively sharing some of my own story and encouraging women today to own the narrative of their individual stories.

In reading this book, I hope you will discover the truths only fiction can speak. I hope you come to appreciate the past and find the courage to embrace your own story; every beautiful, horrible, lovely, wretched part of it.

Picking up where Crimson Time left off, Fractured Past follows Adelaide as she delves deeper into the world of the Red Rose Society, a secret order composed of the descendants of historical figures. The deeper she gets, the further away the truth about her parents’ deaths and the night of the fire seems to slip. With the help of her fellow Kindred, some figures from the past and her new found ability to see fragments of history in objects and places, Adelaide just might gain the answers she seeks. And some she never asked for.

You will love this book if you enjoy stories involving time travel, altered history, secret societies and women in the past. Fans of TV shows like Timeless, Reign and Outlander; or people who enjoy reading series in which each book builds on top of the next will also be swept up in the world of Fractured Past.

Fractured Past speaks to young adults and the young at heart who want to grapple with remembrance and history in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope Fractured Past inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Why is it important to remember our collective and individual past?
  • How can we change the narrative so the stories of women are recognized and remembered?
  • Does my story really matter?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder with the real cover coming later this year)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy and ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Note from the Author and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback as a Beta Reader.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

 

Emily VanderBent is a writer and historian. A natural born storyteller, she desires to share and celebrate the stories of women in history. Fractured Past is the second novel in a series that uses elements of history to creatively engage readers with the past. She hopes her writing will encourage young women to fearlessly pursue their passions and own the narrative of their own story.

With a degree in history, Emily uses her talent for writing, research and design to create blog posts, online content and design for Girl Museum. She also helps walk new authors through the publishing process as an Author Coach for New Degree Press. While living in the real world, Emily dreams of days long past and stories yet to be told.

For more information, you can connect with Emily VanderBent at vanderbentem@gmail.com and on social media at the following accounts:

Instagram: @emilyvanderbent_author
Facebook: Emily VanderBent: Author
LinkedIn: Emily VanderBent
Goodreads: Emily VanderBent
Website & Blog: emilyvanderbent.org
Twitter: @emvan6


 

 

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks.
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page).
  • Use this International Shipping Form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

 

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #fracturedpast and #crimsontime and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Twitter - @emvan6 / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Blessings,
Emily VanderBent

story:
The Story of My Book


Perfectionism comes with an aura of greatness, of genius, of specificity. We associate perfectionism with Oscar-winning directors whose meticulous details make their work exceptional. We connect it with self-made millionaires who worked ninety hour weeks to support their families. We see it in the valedictorian that knew the answers we didn’t. Seeing these perfectionists succeed reminds us of how imperfect we personally are and everything we need to improve.

This is not perfectionism. Perfectionism doesn’t create success. It creates vulnerabilities to anxiety, depression, eating disorders, and suicidal ideation. It creates a negative loop of constant dissatisfaction. It distorts reality.

Maybe it starts with noticing something about someone else: an impressive job title, a clever sense of humor, a sparkling white smile. Perfectionism magnifies qualities as essential markers of success, of self-worth. The perfectionist constructs life around this funhouse mirror—this distorted image that if they don't meet these arbitrary markers, they lack worth. So they work harder in hope of achieving enough recognition to validate their worth. But because perfectionists see themselves in comparison to others, they can never quite feel satisfied in their own accomplishments.

I’m Chloe Cullen, and I’m a perfectionist. My book Perf: The Unspoken Flaws in a Perfect Culture explores the perfectionist’s unrelenting quest to do, have, and be the best. The book also reflects on how perfectionism appears in cultural and mainstream ideas like The American Dream or self-described perfectionists such as Gordon Ramsay and Martha Stewart as well as socioeconomic institutions such as education and market-based economies.

Through interviews, research, and storytelling, you will meet:

  • Megan Tan, who made the podcast Millennial at 24 years old documenting her post-grad perfectionism in 2015
  • Delanie Fischer, who co-hosts the podcast Self-Helpless and re-evaluated her life after experiencing burnout
  • Thomas Curran, who studies how institutions influence perfectionism on British, Canadian, and American citizens


I hope this book will provide a tool to help understand perfectionism in our everyday world and learn how perfectionism impacts our lives through my personal examples.

You will love this book if you balance a passion project outside of your full-time job, listen to the Hamilton soundtrack, read Big Magic or Untamed or Trick Mirror in the last year, feel that you’re “not doing enough” in the pandemic, follow every and any rule (including rules that you assume other people want you to do), or wonder whether your life is caught in a cookie cutter mold.

 

The Book - Perf


Perf is a nonfiction book, written in three parts.

Part 1: This section includes an introduction and chapters on Hamilton and the American Dream and Billie Eilish and the paradox of a pop star. There is also a quiz to determine whether you are a perfectionist and a chapter identifying perfectionism’s roots in paralyzing fear and burnout.

Part 2: In this section, we’ll track perfectionism through the mainstream and examine its impact on an individual scale (i.e. self-care practices, New York City lifestyles, creativity self-help books, and cooking). For example, one chapter looks at the TV show Hell’s Kitchen hosted by Gordon Ramsay (a self-proclaimed perfectionist) and explores how the reality competition encourages heckling for contestants who make mistakes and ultimately other people who appear less than perfect.

Part 3: This last part pivots away from cultural analysis into my own journey with perfectionism, including the institutions that have impacted me (e.g. my all-girls high school environment, familial roles). It includes a somewhat meta look into the process of unpacking my perfectionism while writing this book.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

Perf will be published with New Degree Press. To help cover the costs for publishing my book, I’ve set up pre-order tiers. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor who’ll help me revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover designer who’ll replace this mock placeholder with a professional, custom cover design.
  • The layout editor who’ll put together the interior of my book and create my ebook.
  • The copy editor and proof reader who’ll polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts when I publish this summer.

When I reach 120 campaign backers, I will publish my book in paperback and ebook formats. When 150 people back my campaign, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When my campaign reaches 200 backers, I will bring these stories to life in an audiobook.

As a campaign backer, you’re not buying a copy of a book. You're investing in an opportunity to ride shotgun on my path to publishing. Pre-order my book now to receive an exclusive VIP experience, including:

  • You’ll receive a signed copy of my book when I publish this summer.
  • You’ll see your name in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You’ll be invited to join my Author Community for early access to excerpts from my book.
  • You’ll have an opportunity to share your insight in the selection of my book cover.
  • You'll get a rare glimpse behind the curtain of the publishing process to see what it takes to go from first draft to print.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Author Chloe Cullen writes short stories, personal essays, and scripts and perhaps thinks too much about how perfectionism impacts her daily life.

A script analyst and assistant to two VPs at a talent agency, she has a passion for stories in all media (TV, movies, podcasts, books) and writes to process her own stories with the hope that sharing her vulnerabilities will help others.

Chloe is the oldest of six kids. Her fondest childhood memories involve chasing her little siblings in the backyard after she finished her homework or giving them baths at her “shampoo salon.” She read aloud from a rocking chair for her kindergarten classmates, and she carries three books and a pen with her as her purse essentials. She currently lives in New York, where she is trying to take things one minute at a time from her collapsible desk.

To learn more about this project, connect with Chloe at chloeacullen@gmail.com and at her social media handles below.

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/chloe-cullen-b9aa4a...
Instagram: @chloeecullenn
Writing Instagram: @ischloeawriter
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/cacullen95/

 

International Preorders

For international pre-orders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers apprised of my anticipated publishing date. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people simply cannot contribute to my campaign. If you find yourself in that position, I hope you’ll show your support in other ways. At the top of this page, you’ll find the option to Share my Indiegogo pre-sale campaign. Please copy the link and share it widely.

Share it with your friends, family, and network on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn. If you’ll use #PERF and tag me (@ischloeawriter) as well as my publisher (@NewDegreePress), we’ll help amplify your efforts.

Share it with five friends, neighbors, colleagues, or classmates who might enjoy my book or the opportunity to join my publishing journey.

Share it via text message. Share it through direct messaging or email. Share it on social media. Share it and know that you’re making a difference.

Thanks for your support!

Stay well,
Chloe Cullen

story:
The ABC's of Self is a book that teaches and invites people of all ages to recognize, appreciate, and love the greatness that is within them. Each page leads the reader through insights that foster self-awareness and self appreciation, set to the backdrop of spectacularly beautiful and serene original nature photography.

 


The Story 

Over the years, I have played with the idea of writing a book.  In April 2012, I decided it was time.  My normal work as an Occupational Therapy Assistant had slowed down significantly. I got so much enjoyment out of creating this book.  Without a doubt, it has been, and continues to be a wonderful adventure!  I had no idea that it would involve as much as it has.  During this time, I have closed chapters of my life, created new relationships, learned how use a computer beyond just surfing the web or checking my email.  I realized how much I like photography.  Speaking in front of more than 3 people has never been fun for me.  However, sharing the book with students in their classrooms has given me a chance to decide I want to do more of it!  I have been touched by the ongoing magic of people wanting to share in the excitement and passion of something I believe in.  Writing the book seemed to be the easiest part so far. I have had great opportunities to meet people and share the experiences and unfolding of The ABC's of Self. 

My inspiration comes from the ongoing journey I have been on. This book is my way of continuing to offer ways for people to feel good and connect with that special part of themselves that we all have.

Last summer I believed I could make it to the top of Mt. Rainier and I did. I believe that I will get my book printed! All of the money that is raised will go to printing the book and anything beyond the $15,000, which is the cost of the first order, will go to  promoting the book.  I LOVE the idea of visiting as many places as possible to share the book.  I would be happy and honored to visit classrooms, shelters, nursing homes, hospitals, and more!

I imagine a genuine sense of self is a good thing for all! We all have many areas of life we show up to and daily situations we encounter.  How would the average day in school change if children were showing up with a strong sense of self?  Or, if anyone for that matter, was showing up in all the areas of their life with a sense of connectedness to themselves? 

Thanks to all the people that make great things possible!!!

story:
Chairman Mao on the Wall

                     -- A Documentary Photo + Oral History Project

Introduction
Thirty-seven years after his death, Chairman Mao is still watching over the nation he once ruled.
This documentary photography project tells stories of rural families who hung Mao’s portrait on their wall alongside pictures of their ancestors, of Buddha and local goddesses, and of bikini girls. Documenting oral history of the family’s experiences under Mao’s rule as well as those of today, the photographer explores the historical, political, economic and social rationales that have kept the late chairman on the wall watching the family’s private space 24/7.  By capturing and examining the rich texture of rural life in early 21st century China interwoven with ideologies, beliefs and expectations beyond stereotypes of the mainstream media representations, the project shall offer its viewers a rare perspective from which they can make their own observations, interpretations and appreciations.

   

 

Why Mao Zedong On The Wall?
Hailed as the founding father of a “New China”, Late Chairman Mao Zedong once ruled a quarter of the world's population and played a defining role in late 20th century world politics.

To some, he was the revered savior of the nation; to many others, Mao represented the regime who brought famine and persecution and thus countless grievances to the nation, most of which cases are still yet to be disclosed.

An icon for the regime, Mao’s portrait has for decades been hung on Tiananmen, or the Gate of Heavenly Peace, at the heart of the city of Beijing. During the decades under Mao’s rule, almost all Chinese families had to hang his picture in their office and home in order to announce their loyalty to the paramount leader. Thus “the big brother” was watching everyone in every household and there was no escape from it.

Today, hanging Mao’s portrait on the wall is no longer conformity out of political pressure, but rather a personal preference and voluntary choice of the family. And different from what was like during and before the Cultural Revolution, when traditional beliefs, religions and “Capitalist lifestyles” were suppressed, the walls of the household today set a stage for much more than just political images – they are now occupied by posters or pictures of bikini girls on the beach, Hong Kong film stars, local gods and goddesses, Buddha and Bodhisattvas, ancestors, as well as their own snapshots. The imagery on a rural wall has thus mirrors the ideologies that play a role in the family’s life. They interact with one another in the household and create a surreal space where Maoism, Capitalist consumerism, ancestral veneration, local god worship, Buddhism, Taoism, Confucianism “coexist” peacefully.

Just as the imagery in the private rural space is a slice of the Chinese life of early 21st century, the fact that Mao remains with the household reveals the way the rural family relates to its past, present and future. Often occupying the central spot of the wall, Mao’s image speaks for what the family chooses to remember about the past, and perhaps more significantly, what it wishes the present had.

 

 

 

And So The Story Goes…

I spent four and half years in school and then the Culture Revolution began. The Party stopped schooling and sent us young people to the countryside for reeducation. In the 1970s, I was part of the labor force that built the local Taihe Airport. I was earning a dozen or so “labor credits” a day.

There was this night when we were all watching a show in the Hall of the Peasant Workers. The soldiers were sitting at the front rows. Suddenly there was a chaos and I thought it was starting to rain. Everybody got on their feet and started to run. The officials took out their guns and started to shoot. Some people fell down and a stampede started…. A couple of days later, each of the survivors was asked to fill out a form and was told to keep an eye on class enemies.

I had three opportunities to join the Party but I declined because I was not interested in becoming an official.

A man will be judged three times – by law when he is alive, by History when he is dead and also by Hell. Man should do good deeds whenever he can, help others, serve humanity and give more. I was once a Christian, and had joined services. Once an old man told me that I was not supposed to cry when my parents died…. Chairman Mao told us that Failure is the mother of Success. A lot of what he said is valid regardless of time. Mao had a great influence on my life and that influence is not going to go away.

The world is still what it has always been – there are the rich and the poor. It is better off now in the sense that you make more money if you are more capable. In the old days, the more capable earned the same amount as those who were less so…. Mao said China was on its way to Socialism, yet then Deng said that we were only at the primary stage of Socialism. And he said “If a good cat catches mice, should it bother me if it is white or black?” Nowadays, making money is all that matters, regardless of the cost.

Above is part of the story of a 52-year-old rural man who lives in rural Jiangxi, China.

Everyone who has lived through Mao’s era has a story to tell about Mao’s rule. And they all must have a reason to remember. These stories bear invaluable witness to a time about which open discussions are still off limit for ordinary Chinese citizens. They also provide clues to what social changes are necessary from the perspective of the rural population before social tension accumulate to a point of no return. Instead of engaging its views with political arguments, the proposed project shares in-depth insiders’ view on the future of the world’s largest nation, and very likely economy.

 

 

 

Who Am I?
I am a college junior and, for the last two and half years, have been receiving training at IFChina Original Studio, one of China’s pioneer community-based non-profit art organizations focusing on collecting social memories. Since July 2011, I have been photographing rural households with Mao’s portrait(s), documenting their stories and making a feature-length documentary film on a 67-year-old man who is known as the most active marginalized Mao supporter in the region.

 

Ji’an/Mt. Jinggangshan, the region where IFChina and where my projects are based, is known as the Cradle of Mao’s Revolution. Mao came to this region in Year 1927, started his first guerrilla warfare and went on to change China.

 


What Do I Want To Do?
A book with photographs and oral history stories of the 100 households in Mt. Jinggangshan region, “Cradle of Mao’s Revolution”. In order to keep the book within a manageable size, I will present 20 of the 100 families with greater length and details than the rest.

 

I will need six months to reach my goal for shooting (100 families, out of which 20 will be featured) and another six months to edit the photos, oral history stories and my journals into a complete photo book. My selection of the 100 households will be based on considerations of diversity in gender, age, ethnicity, education background, and financial status.

 

 

 

 

What Else Can It Bring To The World?
According to some, China is the nation that will change the world in the 21st century. Well, perhaps, for better or worse. But there is no doubt that understanding this nation helps us make better sense of the world we are living in.

 

I hope my proposed book will be one of the most candid photo books on modern history and present development. It will, of course, not be the most comprehensive book on Mao, but I believe it will be a most revealing one that will help its readers understand China through the pains and hopes of its “rank-and-file” citizens who are closest to the soil – the Chinese farmers.

 


What I Need?
I will be graduating from college in July, 2014. Having been quite a lot of work on this project in rural Jiangxi for almost three years now, I need your strong support to help me complete the last two stages of my project – in-depth documentation of the 20 households and production of the photo book. This project will have taken 3.5 years of my life – that’s a lot of time out of my four years in college! And with 100 households, you can be sure that there are a lot of stories to transcribe, photos to edit, and journals to work on.

 

During my interviews, I have heard met many kind-hearted families and heard their stories. And I believe these stories are worth being told to many others around the world.

 

So here I am raising funds for Chairman Mao on the Wall.

 

Below is a detailed list of where the raised money will go:
1. Local research trips including transportation board and lodging expenses, $150 per month for 6 months, $900;
2. Equipment rentals including a professional DSLR camera kit, a tripod, an audio recorder and other accessories, for a estimated total of 60 days over the span of six months, $800;
3. Modest fees for assistant editors/oral history transcribers, $500;
4.Modest fees for English translator of the edited book, $500
5. Modest fees for visual designer for the book, $300
6. Photocopying, courier service, etc., $100.
Total ,USD$3,100

 

What You Get For Your Contribution?
USD$10 – you get 1, 2, 3
USD$20 – you get 1, 2, 3, 4
USD$50 – you get 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
USD$100 – you get 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
USD$200, you get 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7
USD$500 and above, you get 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8
1. An electronic “Thank You” card with my signature and a photo from the project

 

2. Project updates and links
You will receive access to project updates and links.

 

3. Listed as a sponsor in our website.

4. Listed as a sponsor in this photography book
You will be listed as a sponsor in the complete photo book.

 

5. A series of e-cards of rural China landscape
The e-cards will be made out of unique photos I take of rural China landscape during the course of the project.
.
6. A series of e-cards of Chairman Mao on the Wall
The e-cards will be made out of selected photo works from the proposed project.

 

7. An electric copy of this photography book Chairman Mao on the Wall

 

8. Guided tour in rural China to visit families in the book!
We will be your guide to take you to visit these families appeared in this photography book.

 


Other Ways You Can Help.
Please help us spread the word about this campaign. Share our link on your Facebook , Twitter and other social media pages or tell anyone who might be interested in the subject.

 

You can also leave comments on our Indiegogo page here, which will increase our Gogo Factor and help drive traffic to the campaign.

 

If you are interested in China’s Communist history, Mao Zedong, rural China, and other related topics, please feel free to contact me. I would also be excited to discuss possibilities for joint projects. And, of course, if you have a DSLR camera or accessories which you are no longer using, we will be grateful if you can donate it/them to us.

 

I would like to thank all of you who care for this project.
