story:
Baby Marcus is sixteen months old and has retractable seizures.  Also known as epilopsy.  We are trying to raise funds so we can  get him a dog that will warn us before he has a seizure.  It will allow him some independence with the monitors he is constantly on.  We only know he is about to have a seizure when his heart rate rises and his stats on breathing are low.  By that time it is pretty much to late to try to prevent it.  As any meds we give do not help.  He has seizures for a hour at a time not the normal few seconds.  When he has a short ten minute or less seizure we call it a burp and normally do not worry that much.

His little body jerks, his jaws lock and his breathing is unstable.  If we cannot detect these seizures ahead of time we cannot give him the meds to help slow them down.  We will never beable to stop them but we can slow them down.

Little Marcus is what we call a Drug baby.  He had over four meds in his system when born and went through two weeks of withdrawel at birth.  I just wish mom's to be would please stop taking drugs while pregnant.  Please these babies are the real victims.  Unless we control these seizures little Marcus future is bleak.

He has twenty some words in his vocabulary, loves his adoptive Dad, is fed via GTube, is learning to sit up, roll over and has a strong personality.  Once you meet him you cannot help but fall in love with him.

He has a will to live as most of these babies are dead within hours of being born.  But Marcus has a fighting spirit and we need to give him every chance we have to help him reach his full potential.  All we are trying to do is raise funds so that we can get him a dog that will warn us prior to his seizures so that we can give him meds to stop them before they start.  It is a long process and we cannot do it alone.  We feel that we can get him off the monitor and more mobility.

We know if we can stop the seizures before they start he will spend less time in the hospital and more time at home where he belongs.  He is such a fighter.  Please lets raise the funds so that little Marcus can have his dog and allow us to be warned prior to him having one and giving him a chance to be more independent.

Marcus is amazing.

story:
I am going to Afghanistan this December to embed with U.S. combat forces in the field as a freelance journalist for United Press International (UPI) — an international news wire service.

Ostensibly, my embed is to cover the drawdown and the evolving role of U.S. combat forces as the Afghan National Army takes on greater responsibility in the lead-up to the 2014 withdrawal.

But the embed has a larger purpose - it will also give me the opportunity to report on the experience of seeing my little brother in a war zone.  My younger brother is a Captain in the Air Force and currently deployed to Afghanistan.

For most Americans the war in Afghanistan has become an abstraction, a series of events that have no connection to their everyday lives. The intent of my embed and my reporting will be to find a way to make the war personal for people back home, to find some way to make combat in a faraway land a reality for people who have no real experience from which to draw on for comparison.

Seeing my brother in a war zone, I believe, will be the rare opportunity for a journalist to relate the unexplainable costs of war to an audience back home

I am a former special operations pilot and a combat veteran of Iraq and Afghanistan. I graduated from the U.S. Air Force Academy in 2004 and have master’s degrees from the Sorbonne in Paris, France, and from Northwestern University’s Medill School of Journalism, where I was a McCormick Foundation fellow. My brother is a 2008 Air Force Academy graduate and a Captain in the Air Force. 

Both my brother and I are graduates of Pine View High School.  Our father, Guy Peterson, is a Sarasota-based architect, and our mother, Cindy Peterson, is the force behind the recently launched Center for Architecture Sarasota.

The requested funds will fund my travel expenses to Afghanistan.

Please contact me with any questions or concerns.  Thank you for your time and consideration.  I look forward to hearing from you.

Very Respectfully,

Nolan Peterson

story:
Quick Summary of the Campaign:

Help two entrepreneurial authors breathe life into CLaW Publishing & achieve their goal of entertaining readers with their stories aimed at both young and old.


*  *  *


Who are Ben Finn and Marc Webb?

Ben Finn:

Ben loves to entertain. Since he can’t sing and can’t act...well...he turned to writing. Kill Them Dead was written with his best friend and writing partner Marc Webb.

When he is not writing you will find Ben spending time with his 2 year old son and wife, on the golf course (cursing), reading, enjoying a movie or getting involved in some new TV series. But most of the time he will simply daydream another story…

Marc Webb:

Marc grew up in a relatively poor environment. Not having access to the toys and other luxuries of the more “better-off” kids in the neighborhood, he turned to books and soon consumed up to three novels per day. He also cultivated his imagination by turning everyday objects like sticks and stones into battleships and castles.

His love for storytelling began when he cut out the characters (in various poses) of a Superman comic. He would then re-structure the characters to play out hundreds of other stories that his mind conjured up. Today he likes to write thrillers and horrors and looks forward to creating interesting stories and characters with his friend and writing partner, Ben Finn.


*  *  *


What is Kill Them Dead?

Kill Them Dead: Genesis is a serialized Zombie Horror story that’s broken down into five bite-sized episodes. Almost like a television series, each episode ends with a cliff-hanger, leaving the reader hungry for more.

After the final episode went up, we bundled the lot and released the entire first season as a box set available on Amazon for Kindle readers.



We currently have Season 2 and 3 planned for 2014 after which we would like to release a HOW TO WRITE SERIALIZED FICTION book. Most of the book will consist of practical advice and examples based on how we planned and wrote our serialized stories. From there we will open the Kill Them Dead universe to fan writers who would like to branch out and take the story into unique and exciting directions.


Praise for Kill Them Dead - Genesis:

“Best thing I’ve read in all 2013, if you ever release it in physical form you have 3 purchases from me.”

“I just GOT TO KNOW what happens next.”

“The story had me in its grips.”

“Zombie lovers and sci-fi horror fans, I'm sure this will be right up your alley. I mean, come on, how often do you find a book about zombies in space?”

“I was gripped from the moment I read Episode 1.”


Fan Trailer from the awesome guys over at FilmChrome:



*  *  *


What is ClaW Publishing?

When we initially sat down to discuss writing something together, we soon discovered that we had more ideas for stories than we had time to write. This prompted us to register ClaW Publishing Pty (Ltd), an indie ePublishing company through which we will publish and upload our collaborative and single works.

As we neared the completion of the Kill Them Dead: Genesis series, we realized that in order to release Season 2 and 3 (as well as a ton of other stories) sooner, we would have to put some serious thought and effort into running the business full-time.

To achieve this goal of entertaining readers with our stories, we decided to turn towards crowd funding, to humbly ask friends and fans to pitch in and help out. In short, we need YOUR help to get there!


*  *  *


Our IndieGoGo Goal: How much funding do we need?

In order to take the risk of building CLaW Publishing into a sustainable business venture, we would need at least $40 000 to cover all expenses.

This is not a short-term campaign that will stop once a book is written or a movie is made. We aim to dedicate the rest of our lives to the business and hopefully leave a legacy that our children and their children could be a part of long after we’re gone.

Your donation, no matter how small, will make a huge difference and we are well aware that we couldn’t have done it without a single dollar being contributed.


*  *  *


Why?

Your gracious donations would allow us to obtain a small office from where we could work every day and will also cover basic costs such as Internet access and hardware & software required to perform our day-to-day duties. We believe that if we can write full time, we would be able to produce ten times more courses and books than if writing part time.

This will enable us to dedicate all our time on releasing new products, be available for personal coaching sessions to aspiring authors, and much, MUCH more!


*  *  *


Pipeline ClaW Projects:

As CLaW Publishing, we would like to produce (yet not nearly limit ourselves) the following:

-  Kill Them Dead: Season 2

-  Kill Them Dead: Season 3

-  Audio Book of Kill Them Dead: Genesis

-  YouTube Web Series of Kill Them Dead: Genesis (Through FilmChrome)

-  HOW TO WRITE book on writing and publishing serialized fiction

-  Open the Kill Them Dead universe for aspiring authors

-  Young Adult Inter-galactic Spy Series

-  Alien Invasion Serialized Series

-  Sci-Fi Serialized Story about a Government Assassination

-  Young Adult Mystery Series


We would also like to give back to the community through a series of writing and marketing tutorials and workshops, thus helping struggling authors establish their own little place in the eBook universe.


*  *  *


Incentive Breakdown:

$2 - No donation is too small. We tip our hats at you and think you're an awesome human being!

$10 - PDF file of episodes 1, 2 and 3 sent to the e-mail address of your choice. Yay!

$15 - PDF File of Episodes 1, 2 and 3 and a shoutout on Facebook, Twitter and the Hall of Fame post at www.killthemdead.net

$25 - Digital Download of the complete Season 1 Box Set of Kill Them Dead. PDF File of Episodes 1, 2 and 3 sent to a friend of your choosing. Includes shoutout on Facebook, Twitter and our Hall of Fame

$50 - Same as $25, but you also receive a digital copy of the entire Season 2 before it launches on Amazon

$75 - Same as $50, but includes a personalized message to you inside the Season 1 Box Set PDF file

$100 - Same as $50, but includes a physical printed copy of the Season 1 Box Set

$250 - Same as $75, but includes a physical printed and signed copy of the Season 1 Box Set with a personalized hand-written message to you. Also includes free PDF copies of our next five books over and above the Kill Them Dead Season 2 episodes.

$1000 - (Only 30x available) Same as $250, but includes four extra printed and signed copies of the Season 1 Box Set with personalized hand-written messages to the family and friends you would like to give the books to. Also become a minor character in one of our future books (not necessarily Kill Them Dead). Finally, you receive digital copies of all our books for life!

$2500 - (Only 10x available) Same as $75, but includes 5x physical printed and signed copies of the Season 1 Box Set and 5x physical printed and signed copies of the Season 2 Box Set, all with a personalized hand-written message to you and your loved ones. Also become a minor character in one of our future books (not necessarily Kill Them Dead). Finally, you receive digital copies of all our books for life!

$5000 - (Only 1x available) Same as $2500, though you'll be a MAIN character in the 3rd Season of Kill Them Dead. We’ll include photo copies of all our original notes, brainstorming ideas, and edits while plotting & writing Season 2. Also, receive a step-by-step overview of the entire process on how we create our covers, from thumbnail sketches to final product. Over and above this, we will create a Season 3 cover that stars YOU on it! Finally, you receive digital copies of all our books for life!


*  *  *


FAQ:

Q: Can I purchase a perk for someone else as a gift?

A: Sure! Simply contact us via e-mail or Facebook once you’ve contributed and let us know who you would like the perk to go to.


Q: When will I receive my perks?

A: All perks will be sent upon the completion of the campaign. We pledge to send all promised perks regardless of whether we obtain full funding or not.


Q: What happens if you don’t raise the full amount?

A: Our very first responsibility would be towards those of you who funded, and ensuring that you get the perks that we committed to as quickly as possible. From there we will reassess our financial situation to determine the best way forward. Any amount donated by you will bring us a step closer to our dream and you can rest assured that all funds raised through this campaign will go towards creating entertaining stories for our readers.

the best way forward. Any amount donated by you will bring us a step closer to
our dream and you can rest assured that all funds raised through this campaign
will go towards creating entertaining stories for our readers.

story:
As I look back over my life, I would have never thought that I would have gone down the road that I have. Never thought I would be abused by a man; never thought I would ever want to kill someone or ever spend two days in jail. Who would have ever thought that I, Nicole Rogers, would have grown up to be a single mom that overcame a situation that was headed towards a fatal end?

I am Nicole Rogers, author of The Spirit Within due out Fall 2014. This is my first book that I am using as a platform to share my story. I am a single mother of three beautiful children that I am trying to build a legacy for. In 2010 I started my entrepreneurial journey with a local magazine. From that first magazine I realized that I wanted to work with young girls on building their self-esteem and that's when I founded Flourish "Empowering Youth Is Our Mission". Then came along Pink Pearl Magazine where our mission was to Motivate, Uplift and Empower ALL women. From those avenues I have developed a passion for empowering others.

Because I made it out of my situation but am still a work in progress, my message to all is, “NO SITUATION TO YOUR DISLIKE IS EVER FINAL. YOU ARE IN CONTROL OF YOUR OWN DESTINY!”

With your help I can reach more people than I can imagine. I will be able to work with one of the best literary service companies to help tell my story and reach a nationwide audience.

What I Need

I am trying to raise $1500 to get started. Who knows maybe by the time I use all the funds a publisher will pick my book up and I get a book deal!  $200 will go towards the initial signing of the contract and the remainder will either be used for monthly payments of $100 for unlimited consulting time or go towards editing and rewriting.  I want to tell my story the best way possible!


The Impact

I am excited about the impact my story will have on others. I am glad to be a light to others that sees no way out. People are already reaching out and saying "thank you for telling our story!"

.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am on Facebook. Please feel free to "LIKE" my page and invite others to do so.

https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Spirit-Within/675415842503346?ref=hl

AGAIN THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

story:
*****10% of funds raised until the end of the campaign will be donated by Collin to Dallas Truth Racial Healing and Transformation!*****

Stretch goal of $8,500 to raise funds for Dallas, Truth Racial Healing and Transformation!!

 

Story of My Book

Paved A Way is a book about infrastructure, race, and public policy and how those forces shape inequalities in our cities. It’s a look at how we can re-frame, re-design, and re-invest toward more equitable cities.

My name is Collin Yarbrough and I am the author of Paved A Way. I wrote this book because I was researching for a paper and discovered that a highway I use everyday was responsible for the relocation of over 1,100 bodies within a Freedman’s cemetery. It led me on a longer journey of unearthing the story of infrastructure built upon inequality.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to spot the patterns of injustice that exist in our cities. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to walk with me through the history of Dallas and my unpacking the structures and policies that shaped the city of today. Dallas is a city like many others, and I hope engagement in this book will encourage you to embark on a similar journey of discovery in your own city’s history.


You will love this book if you like to learn the history of cities, are curious about issues of equity, and learn how to engage in justice work in your city.

Paved A Way speaks to architects, urban planners, and citizens who want to grapple with equity and infrastructure in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Paved A Way inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What is my role in creating and sustaining inequity around me?
  • Why do some neighborhoods end up in decline and disinvestment?
  • How might our cities be improved through a better understanding of how they were built, and who made those decisions?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing the intersection of infrastructure, race, and public policy will change us all for the better.
 

The Book - Paved A Way


The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 - (Re-Frame) contains the author’s note + chapters 1-7. This section is focused on reframing the historical narrative of several neighborhoods in Dallas. By bringing the narratives together, we are able to more clearly see the patterns of injustice existing in the built and political environment. We learn about how commonly highway construction bi-sected several communities of color in Dallas like North Dallas, Little Mexico, Deep Ellum, Tenth Street, and others. This section critically evaluates the history of a city thought to have no history at all and born out of nothing...which, is very far from the truth.

Part 2 - (Re-Design) contains chapters 8-10. This section is focused on the ways we can take steps toward redesigning our cities in a more just and equitable way. The section highlights ideas from architects and designers across the country exploring how space and place play a role in shaping the way we interact with our cities. Stories, like Detroit Future City and Patterned Justice: Design Languages for a Just Pittsburgh, show how communities can identify disinvestment and create new patterns of justice in their cities. This section also explores how simple objects like plywood and shipping containers can reclaim space in and for a community. and imagine a new future.

Part 3 - (Re-Invest) contains chapters 11-14. Finally, the book explores the ways various stakeholders can engage in more equitable reinvestment in their cities. Reinvestment applies not only to structures in the built environment but to the people involved in the process of building as well. We hear stories of developers in Dallas are changing the the traditional model of development and building community rather than corporate wealth. This section contains a few of the cornerstones for the foundations of an equitable city.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing and shipping my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mock ups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats, etc.).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this coming spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an expanded hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish the hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author


Collin Yarbrough is a former pipeline engineer and compliance manager who began seminary a year ago. In the process, he was reunited with his passion for design and the way things are made, particularly cities.

Collin wrote this book because he wholeheartedly believes that our cities and towns do not have to reinforce and amplify inequities. He has spent the last eight months working to understand his hometown and rebuild his understanding of it’s history.

Collin is an avid runner and cyclist. When he isn’t running or writing, he is helping his mother run their non-profit cookie bakery. He’s an easy target for a wide range of jokes and is currently working toward his Masters in Sustainability and Development at SMU in Dallas.

For more information, you can connect with Collin at:

e-mail: yarbrocr@gmail.com

Instagram: @collinwritesdesign

Linked In
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks so much,
-Collin

story:
Summary

  • This campaign is to hire my editor to do his job so I can finish this book and get it out there. The cover is done, and my editor will be able to receive my manuscript once this campaign concludes and he is available. After that, it's revision and release.
  • I am committed to getting this done, despite being hospitalized this past year, and to that end I need help on financing critical steps.
  • All backers shall be thanked, by name upon request, when the book is published in addition to whatever Perks backers select. All backers who choose to get a book get a digital copy of the previous book as well.
  • The success of this campaign shall also serve to gauge interest for tie-ins to the series, and how to go about pursuing them
  • Stretch Goals are covered in the FAQ Tab.

The Book

     We pick up where "Reavers" left off, with our story's focus shifting to Earth and her solar system. Countess Gabriela Robin is in hiding, but she's threatening to go to Earth to speak of her experience at New Edinburgh to the Court of Stars and thus directly threaten the master villain of that raid: Count Vikuun Qis.

     Qis calls upon a new figure, Master Nimrod, to hunt her down before she can expose him. To ensure this succeeds, Qis throws Red Eyes and his pirates at the Solar Guard to keep them busy. The two strategies are meant to converge when Nimrod delivers Gabriela to the pirates to fulfill his promise to their mutual benefactor: the Architect.

   The action and intrigue goes from Ganymede to Rome, and from ship-to-ship down to man-to-man, as both villain and hero attempt to outwit as well as outfight each other to determine the fate of the Songbird of Second Salisbury.

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need $1000 (US) to cover the cost of hiring my editor and ensuring print copy delivery to backers who opt for a copy. This is an all-or-nothing campaign, so if it fails you lose nothing.
  • All backers that select books for Perks get a copy of the first book in the series in E-Book format (Kindle or Epub). This ensures that you can catch up without worry if you're late to the party.
  • The array of Perks include the ability to become part of the series in some form if you like. Some will be locked at launch, requiring a threshold to be hit before I make them available. 

 

Impact

  • The previous campaign for Reavers of the Void did far better than I expected, and despite my post-campaign problems (being hospitalized makes things difficult) I cannot abandon my audience now. I'm continuing out of gratitude, and I hope you enjoy Hounds of Nimrod.

story:
The best longsword book since 1410? ... maybe. Since 2004 for sure.

Thank you all! The campaign is now closed, and we have plenty of funds for layout, printing and shipping. I am blown away by your generous support. 

If you missed this campaign, do not despair; as soon as the books are available to buy I will post a link here. You can also keep track of the latest developments on my blog. 


We're past 10,000€!

By way of a thank-you to you all, I will video and put online my take on the famous duel from the Princess Bride: how should you "attack with Capoferro"? And how would Thibault "cancel out Capoferro"? And so forth. Expect it in June!

If we hit 12,000€ I will take the footage from my last 4-day Fiore seminar, held in Melbourne, edit it into shape, and put it online for free. 

And now for the actual pitch:

If you like swords, martial arts, or history, these books are for you. 

The Medieval Longsword

is a complete training method for the medieval Italian knightly longsword, based on Il Fior di Battaglia, written around 1400 by Fiore dei Liberi. The book covers everything from fundamental martial arts principles, to choosing equipment, to footwork, guard positions, strikes, defences, and drills all the way up to freeplay (sparring). It is lavishly illustrated with over 300 beautiful photos (see gallery for examples). 

AND

Swordfighting for Writers, Game Designers and Martial Artists.

I have collected together a decade's worth of articles and essays that I have written on the subject of swordsmanship, added a lot of new material, and organised it all  into a book. This will have something to offer everyone who is interested in swords, swordfighting, training, or learning any kind of martial art. 

  • There will be a lot of previously unpublished material, material that has been published but is now out of print, and highlights from my blog, Ragion della Spada.
  • The first draft, about 100,000 words or 250-300 pages, is already done. I need funds for editing, layout and printing costs only. 
  • You will be able to determine some of the content, by asking a question to be answered in the book!

Please note that ALL backers at every level, from 10€ and up, will get the full ebook package: both The Medieval Longsword, and Swordfighting, plus most of my back catalogue of books. 

You also get both books in paperback and/or hardback too. 

And since we hit our early stretch goal of 

4000€: Wiktenauer support: 5% of the total raised will go to Wiktenauer. When we hit 4k, they get 200€; enough to pay their website upkeep for a while; if we hit 10, they get 500€, and so on. 

The good folks at Wiktenauer have put a lot of time, and their own money, into making the original treatises available and providing an incredibly valuable resource to all scholars of the sword. This stretch goal is a tip of the hat to their efforts, and a thank you. How big a thank you depends on you, the backers...

So tell your friends to buy the book; it’ll support a good cause!

Second stretch goal: 5000€:  I will go through the first chapter of longsword techniques, and video every drill and action, and post it online as a free resource. 

Third stretch goal: 6000€: I have another book in the works; originally entitled Swordfighting for Geeks and Gamers, it is now more cautiously titled Swordfighting for Writers, Game Designers and Martial Artists.

In it have collected together a decade's worth of articles and essays that I have written on the subject of swordsmanship, added a lot of new material, and organised it all  into a book. This will have something to offer everyone who is interested in swords, swordfighting, training, or learning any kind of martial art. 

  • There will be a lot of previously unpublished material, material that has been published but is now out of print, and highlights from my blog.
  • The first draft, about 100,000 words or 250-300 pages, is already done. I need funds for editing, layout and printing costs only. 
  • You will be able to determine some of the content, by asking a question to be answered in the book!
The book is organised into the following sections: 

  1.  “What is historical swordsmanship?” which covers aspects of researching and recreating the Art.
  2.   “Lessons from the Art”, which covers some of the wider real-world benefits of training, especially dealing with questions of mistakes, risk, and fear.
  3.   “Swords” which describes the main classifications of the weapons we use, and includes discussions of appropriate training tools.
  4.   “Fighting” which includes historical examples of duels, contexts in which fights can occur, the differences between training and fighting.
  5.   “Writing Swordfights”, which is all about how swords and swordfights should be represented in fiction, with both good and bad examples.
  6.   “Gaming” which is a discussion of the ways in which swordsmanship can be adapted for game design purposes, and includes material about how we developed Audatia.
  7.   “Training”,which is largely insights into how I train myself.
  8.   “Teaching the Art”, which is about how I train my students.
Please note that the sections on Writing Swordfights and Gaming were written on a grant given by the Finnish non-fiction writers society (Suomen Tietokirjailijat Ry), for which support let me here make public thanks. 

About the author

I am a professional swordsmanship instructor, founder and head of The School of European Swordsmanship. I have been working on my interpretation of Fiore dei Liberi's Art of Arms since the mid-90s, and full time for a living since 2001. In 2004 I produced The Swordsman's Companion, which got a generation of longsword enthusiasts started on the path. I have refined and developed my interpretation, improved my training methods, and written it all down in a series of books starting with Mastering the Art of Arms volume 1: The Medieval Dagger. This new book, complete with over 300 beautiful photos, is volume two: Longsword Fundamentals. I need your help to raise funds for layout, some copyediting, printing and shipping.



About The Book

The book is organised as a training curriculum; so rather than having sections on the blows, the guards, defences, counters to the defences, etc., it more closely follows how I actually teach the Art to my students. It begins with the following sections:

  •  Introduction by Christian Cameron (yes, THE Christian Cameron)
  •  Introduction to Historical Swordsmanship
  • Chapter 1: Equipment: everything you need to know about what kit to buy.
  • Chapter 2: General Principles of Martial Arts in general and Fiore's art in particular
  • Chapter 3: Footwork and Mechanics

And then the sword training begins, which is organised like so:

  • Chapter 4: One Strike, One Defence.
  • Chapter 5: More Strikes, More Defences.
  • Chapter 6: More Strikes, More Guards.
  • Chapter 7: Counter-Remedies, Their Counters, and Improving the Guards.
  • Chapter 8:  Counters to the Break, The Sword in One Hand, and Exploiting Mistakes.
  • Chapter 9: Binds, Malice and Deceit.
  • Chapter 10: Preparing for Freeplay.
  • Chapter 11: Freeplay!

This is followed by three Appendices:

  • Appendix A: The System by Numbers.
  • Appendix B: Warming Up.
  • Appendix C: Glossary of Italian Terms.

I hope you can see that there is something there for everyone! So what are you waiting for? Choose your perk!

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise at least 2000 euros, of which most will go on layout and editing, and the rest on printing, shipping, and, if we go over the target, feeding my children. 

Your perks:
For only 10 euros, you can buy the electronic version of the book, as a pdf, epub and kindle (all three together). These are DRM free. You also get a credit in the book. All higher perks include these electronic versions, and credit (you can choose to be anonymous).

For a mere 25 euros, you can buy the paperback, of either book. This includes shipping inside Europe; please make it 30 for shipping worldwide. (The additional 5 euros is below cost, but it seems unfair to penalise the colonies  rest of the world).

For a piffling 45 euros, you can get both books in paperback. This includes shipping inside Europe; please make it 50 for shipping worldwide.

For just 50 euros, you can get the hardback, of either book. This includes shipping inside Europe; please make it 55 total, for shipping worldwide. 

For a trifling 90 euros, you can get both books in hardback. This includes shipping inside Europe; please make it 95 for shipping worldwide.

For a robust 100 euros, you can get the hardback, and a question answered on my blog; the question must be a) about swordsmanship b) answerable in 500-2000 words. This includes all shipping. 

For a generous 200 euros, you can get the Group Discount: 10 copies of either book (but not a mixture of both books) for your group to work from. Please add 20 euros for shipping outside Europe. You can add as many extra copies as you like for the same price: so eg. 15 copies would be 300, or 320 outside Europe. You can trade out any two paperbacks for one hardback, so if any of your group members have expensive tastes, this is a cheaper way to satisfy them.

For an outstanding 500 euros, you can choose between 6 hardbacks or 12 paperbacks, a skype call, and request a video explanation of any section of the book, up to three separate drills. This will be posted on the wiki. The selection must be made within a year of the books being shipped.

So, you really love books? I have already decided to dedicate the Longsword book to my parents, so that spot is taken, but please feel free to throw as much money into the pot as your generosity and current liquidity allows! I promise it will be spent both wisely and well.

This is my fourth Indiegogo campaign. The previous three were:

  1. The Syllabus Wiki Campaign was to raise money for the Syllabus Wiki: my swordsmanship curriculum videoed and put online as a free resource. We didn't make our target, but the work was done. You can see some of the longsword material here: 
  2. Veni Vadi Vici was to publish a translation of a medieval combat treatise. That made its target, and the book came out on time.
  3. Audatia was to raise funds for a card game based on a real medieval combat system. We raised a lot of money, and have just made good on the first two parts of our promise.
I hope it's clear that I make good on my promises: your money is in safe hands. So please help make this happen, by choosing a perk, and sharing this campaign!

The Impact

The Longsword book is about making Fiore dei Liberi's Art come alive in your hands. It provides everything a beginner needs to know to begin training, and I expect that some of the tips and tricks I have picked up in nearly 30 years of martial arts training will be useful to even the most advanced practitioners. By buying this book, you are supporting my work, and making it possible for me to spend all my efforts on recreating our lost martial heritage. I can't do it without you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like my work but are strapped for cash right now, then do not despair: please share! Let everyone know that this is happening, so that the books will be published, and you can buy them when circumstances improve, or borrow them from a friend. Thank you!

I am blown away by your generous support. If you missed this campaign, do not despair; as soon as the books are available to buy I will post a link here. You can also keep track of the latest developments on my blog. We're past 10,000€!By way of a thank-you to you all, I will video and put online my take on the famous duel from the Princess Bride: how should you "attack with Capoferro"? And how would Thibault "cancel out Capoferro"? And so forth. Expect it in June!If we hit 12,000€ I will take the footage from my last 4-day Fiore seminar, held in Melbourne, edit it into shape, and put it online for free. And now for the actual pitch:If you like swords, martial arts, or history, these books are for you. The Medieval Longswordis a complete training method for the medieval Italian knightly longsword, based on Il Fior di Battaglia, written around 1400 by Fiore dei Liberi. The book covers everything from fundamental martial arts principles, to choosing equipment, to footwork, guard positions, strikes, defences, and drills all the way up to freeplay (sparring). It is lavishly illustrated with over 300 beautiful photos (see gallery for examples). ANDSwordfighting for Writers, Game Designers and Martial Artists.I have collected together a decade's worth of articles and essays that I have written on the subject of swordsmanship, added a lot of new material, and organised it all  into a book. This will have something to offer everyone who is interested in swords, swordfighting, training, or learning any kind of martial art. 
There will be a lot of previously unpublished material, material that has been published but is now out of print, and highlights from my blog, Ragion della Spada.
The first draft, about 100,000 words or 250-300 pages, is already done. I need funds for editing, layout and printing costs only. 
You will be able to determine some of the content, by asking a question to be answered in the book!

When we hit 4k, they get 200€; enough to pay their website upkeep for a while; if we hit 10, they get 500€, and so on. The good folks at Wiktenauer have put a lot of time, and their own money, into making the original treatises available and providing an incredibly valuable resource to all scholars of the sword. This stretch goal is a tip of the hat to their efforts, and a thank you. There will be a lot of previously unpublished material, material that has been published but is now out of print, and highlights from my blog.

 “What is historical swordsmanship?” which covers aspects of researching and recreating the Art.
  “Lessons from the Art”, which covers some of the wider real-world benefits of training, especially dealing with questions of mistakes, risk, and fear.
  “Swords” which describes the main classifications of the weapons we use, and includes discussions of appropriate training tools.
  “Fighting” which includes historical examples of duels, contexts in which fights can occur, the differences between training and fighting.
  “Writing Swordfights”, which is all about how swords and swordfights should be represented in fiction, with both good and bad examples.
  “Gaming” which is a discussion of the ways in which swordsmanship can be adapted for game design purposes, and includes material about how we developed Audatia.
  “Training”,which is largely insights into how I train myself.
  “Teaching the Art”, which is about how I train my students.

In 2004 I produced The Swordsman's Companion, which got a generation of longsword enthusiasts started on the path. I have refined and developed my interpretation, improved my training methods, and written it all down in a series of books starting with Mastering the Art of Arms volume 1: The Medieval Dagger. Chapter 5: More Strikes, More Defences.

Chapter 6: More Strikes, More Guards.

Chapter 8:  Counters to the Break, The Sword in One Hand, and Exploiting Mistakes.

Chapter 9: Binds, Malice and Deceit.
Chapter 10: Preparing for Freeplay.
Chapter 11: Freeplay!
This is followed by three Appendices:
Appendix A: The System by Numbers.
Appendix B: Warming Up.
Appendix C: Glossary of Italian Terms.

story:
Should philosophy be left to professors in academia? Or, is it a field open to everyone?

I’m Steve Patterson, and I’m a philosopher working outside of academia. For the past couple years, I’ve been publishing articles, videos, books, and I’ve been traveling the world, interviewing professors from elite universities about big ideas.

To Professor Jason Brennan, that’s not good enough. He says he needs $1000 to even read my book, but if I pay him, he’ll also write a 1200-word review that he will try to publish in an academic journal.

So, this campaign is to raise the necessary funds he needs to read and review Square One: The Foundations of Knowledge.

story:
Animal Behavior by Keller & Marian Breland has been out of print for a long time, only available in rare situations.  The Brelands’ research broke ground for the development of animal behavior and training as a systematic process.  Understanding the science of how animals learn allows behavior modification of any animal of any species.  It’s easy to read, though the concepts are profound. 

 B. F. Skinner’s first graduate students, Marian and Keller Breland, helped him develop Operant Conditioning into a systematic technology that could be taught to others.  Moving forward with a successful business creating animal shows, working with the CIA and military organizations, and using operant conditioning to train animals of all kinds, they ended up partnering with Bob Bailey, the U.S. Navy’s first director of dolphin training.  The three of them brought this technology to the world.

Keller Breland died young, but Bob and Marian continued to impact the academic world of animal behavior, the sea parks of the world, military animal training, service dog training, and so much more over 50 years of running their business, Animal Behavior Enterprises, which in turn ran other businesses like the famous IQ Zoo.  Take a look at some of the fascinating information about their work here:

https://www3.uca.edu/iqzoo/iqzoo.htm

The relevance of this book to current animal behavior and training is unmistakable.  It’s the foundation of the techniques animal trainers and behavior consultants use every day.  You will learn why and how operant conditioning works.  You’ll gain important insights into behavior modification in many species and the history of the Brelands’ important discoveries about Instinctive Drift.  You’ll have your own reference to the basis of animal behavior and training, including writings of Ivan Pavlov, Konrad Lorenz, and others that were included in the 1966 edition as well as the 2018 edition. 

 The 2018 edition includes a brand-new introduction by Dr. Robert E. (Bob) Bailey, ScD, providing modern insight into this foundational work.  Pre-order your copy today.  Help us make the foundation of animal behavior and training available to everyone who cares about science. 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to raise at least $5,000 for the initial publication of this seminal work, to ensure that it's once again available to the world. This money will offset the initial costs of publishing the book and cover the cost of the Indiegogo pre-release campaign.

We believe in the value of this book to the world, so we have made the necessary commitments to ensure it will be published. This book is only the first of a series of projects that will bring much more information on science-based animal training to trainers, behaviorists, and everyone who is interested in animal training and science of all kinds.  Your support of the re-release of this important text will let us know you want to see more!  Those of us committed to what is possible in humane, efficient, and effective animal training want to share the power of the science.  More books, DVDs, and even a documentary are in the works.

What you get in return:

If you order now, you can be among the first to get the 2018 edition of Animal Behavior, with a brand new introduction by Dr. Robert E Bailey, Sc.D. As an added incentive, your book will be autographed by Dr. Bailey himself.   There are also incentive packages available featuring clickers with custom artwork and even mouse pads specially designed for the book release, only available here . Check out our incentives for more details and pricing.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to pre-ordering your own copy of the book, copies for your friends, and proudly displaying the promotional gifts you choose with your order, you can help this project succeed by letting all your friends and colleagues know about the 2018 Edition of Animal Behavior by Keller & Marian Breland.

Check us out on Facebook (https://fb.me/BrelandAnimalBehavior) and share that page, too Your mentions on popular social media sites help bring this project to people's attention.

Lastly, please mention us to all your friends on Indiegogo! Sharing our project here will help more people find us and help bring this crucial work to the world.

Thank you!

Nancy Kelly, Campaign Director & the Animal Behavior  Campaign Team

story:
Signed Preorders Have ENDED! 

But copies are still available! To get your copy of Blood on the Page Volume One, please click through to one of these fine retailers: 

Amazon.com -- Digital (Print Coming Soon!) 

Apple, Kobo, Nook, Other Amazon Countries -- Digital only

 

The Book 

Give your characters injuries that are more than skin deep. 

Are you worried that your story won’t stand up to scrutiny from discerning readers? Do you want to hurt your characters -- but make sure you get the complications and recovery times just right? Paramedic Samantha Keel has over a decade of treating life-threatening injuries firsthand. She’s helped thousands of writers understand the medical aspects of storytelling, and now, she’s here to help you heal the accuracy of your stories.

 

Blood on the Page: Volume 1 contains a detailed compendium of 31 injuries organized by type, lethality, and body part. From broken noses to detached limbs, Keel’s resource contains a diverse array of wounds that are ready to be added to your story. For each entry, you can delve into how the wound could be inflicted and how your characters would treat the wound with a variety of tools and technologies.

 

In Blood on the Page, you’ll discover:

  • How typical and atypical wounds would be treated and how quickly they would heal
  • How to plot your injuries in stages
  • Thorough sensory details to accurately describe each wound, including appearance, sound, and feel
  • Medical terms and common slang used when describing each wound
  • Insight into temporary and permanent disabilities, and much, much more!

 

This handy resource is a must-have guide for writers whose characters live on the edge of danger. If you like easy-to-follow tools, expert opinions from someone with firsthand knowledge, and you don’t mind a bit of fictional bodily harm, then you’ll love Samantha Keel’s invaluable handbook.

 

PreorderBlood on the Page today to add a whole new level of realism to your story.

 

Click here to download a sample!

 

The Author 

Samantha Keel is the author of the ScriptMedic blog and Tumblr, where she's answered more than 1500 questions from writers just like you in the last year alone. She's a paramedic with a decade of experience treating the sick and injured, and she's helped bring those invaluable real-world details to tens of thousands of writers. 

She lives in ██████, ██, USA with her beautiful wife and imaginary pit bull, Steve. 

 

Shipping

Unfortunately, the last time I ran a preorder like this, international shipping was significantly more expensive than USPS predicted. I'm only able to ship books to the US for this launch.

All books will ship via USPS Priority Mail 3-day shipping. Shipping costs will be added at checkout. 

The book will ship the week of 10/16, so your book will be in your hands BEFORE NaNoWriMo Starts!!

And even if your book comes late, you'll be covered -- the included digital edition will parasail into your inbox on the morning of October 23rd! 

Other Ways to Get the Book

Because signed digital editions will be limited and signed print editions will only be available in the US, here's the link for the standard digital preorder:

Amazon (Digital) 

All Other Retailers (iBooks, Kobo, Nook, ...)

Print editions will be on sale a few days before "official" launch so that people can have the books in hand in time for NaNoWriMo. You'll see that link here when the campaign is done. 

 

One More Thing... 

Extremely limited numbers of Maim Your Characters: How Injuries Work in Fiction are available, so if you want your print edition, get them before they're all gone! The book will come in a 2-pack with Blood on the Page Volume One, and will include digital editions of both books.

story:
What It Is About

"The world around her seemed to melt away and dissolve into thick grey smoke, the light of the passing street lamps dimming and finally going out. Complete darkness surrounded her and yet she could see, as was the way of the realm. Therkous was her favorite plane, she loved it much more than the physical plane of Yumakous. It held possibilities and a freedom she’d never known in the waking world. Its shifting grey smoke holding the possibility of everything and nothing at the same time. She burned some of her energy and began to impress her will on the smoke as it started to condense and change color, twisting and collecting until before her a great garden began to form. It was her favorite thing about Therkous, the ability to make the garden she could only dream of. Large flowers of purples and blues bursting from a thick yellow clove carpeting, giant trees with orange leaves and white blossoms sprouting on spiraling twisted trunks growing in seconds, a large pond began to pool in the middle of the garden with tiger lilies (her favorite) growing in the water. In only a minute she had grown her sanctuary, and she reveled in it. "

A Dream Of Therkous is the first book in a three book trilogy I am writing, book one is in the final editing process already with a publish date hopefully of April 2021. It is an inclusive fantasy novel set on a different version of our world, in a time not unlike Victorian times. The world is full of devilish characters, fantastical creatures, magic, and access to another realm while people sleep; Therkous. Therkous is the dream realm, the plane of possibilities. A place where one can create anything they wish, for the cost of their physical wellbeing. 

The book is a walk in the life of the main character Seracill, they are a genderless being from a species of changelings. They search for companionship in a world full of people with ulterior motives. They face a suppressive church that controls the country they live in. They make all the right choices with all the wrong people on their quest to not be alone. They face their building insanity and the consequences and struggles it brings.  Will they find the company they have always searched for? Or will the world and their mind consume them before they get the chance?

Who I Am

I am the kind of girl who has always found joy in the escape a good book brings. It has been my dream for many years to write something that I felt was worth the world's attention, and finally I have written it. I am a 23 year old pansexual polyamorous transgender woman who is on the spectrum and suffers from mental illness. I myself have quested for love all my life, and until recently had given up hope on finding anything good for me. That was before I met my fiancé and my house mate. They showed me what true love is, and I myself saw the journey it takes to get there. It is not my dream to be a successful author, it is my dream to write things that others can get lost in like I did when I was younger, and finally I have. 

You can contact me with questions or follow for regular updates on the progress being made in both book one and book two at either of the following addresses. 

https://www.facebook.com/AuthorLilithFox/

https://twitter.com/AuthorLilithFox

What I Will Do With Your Money

I am hoping to raise $900 to publish this book. This money will cover indiegogo's cut, go to commissioning local artists in the community to do supplemental images for the book of characters, scenes, creatures, and the calendar I designed for the world. The vast majority of the money will go towards commissioning artists. 

Publishing costs: I will be publishing through a print on demand retailer and distributer, this eliminates the large up front cost of some publishing sites. 

Copyright: Before you can publish you have to copyright your manuscript, this is going to cost $50. 

ISBN: To purchase an ISBN for the book in each of the formats it will be offered, it will cost $295

Supplemental art: All money raised over the copyright and publishing costs will go towards commissioning local artists and creators to do artwork for the book, going back into the community.

If I do not reach my entire goal then publishing will be delayed until I can raise all of the remaining funds personally to make this the book it was meant to be. This will delay the delivery date of the project considerably. 

What You Are Supporting Here

This world needs more books that are LGBTQ inclusive, it helps show others that who we are is valid. My book is just that as I am within the community myself. Your contributions will not only help me achieve my dreams, they will help add to the art produced by our community. 

Challenges

I have never published work before, but am in contact with people who have and have done extensive research to determine the best course to take. The greatest hurdle is actually writing the work to be published, and that is in the final editing stage already. 

One of the biggest challenge is getting noticed in the industry. I have many avenues to spread word around about the book's release as well as to spread this campaign. Most of all word of mouth and personal sharing is the best way to reach new people, and I am counting on you all for help. 

The second biggest challenge is the monetary investment, which is hopefully being solved by this campaign.  If it is not then I will be working hard anyway I can to raise the funds myself to see this through to the end.

Finally the current hurdle is getting the final edit and revision of the book completed and formatting it into a manuscript. I already have three editors working through the fourth draft which is already a third of the way completed.  Once they have finished editing it will be on me to polish it into a final draft then format it into a manuscript. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Another way to help is to please share this campaign to friends, family, and in community spaces. Every little bit of exposure helps. If you can't donate maybe someone you know can. Please share this to help get the word out. There are even built in tools on indiegogo to share to facebook!

Updates

For every $300 raised I will be posting a portion of a chapter from the book that includes no spoilers as an update.  This will be to help show the world I have already built that you are investing into, so keep an eye out!

Special Thanks

Header image is a portion of the cover design for the book, done by Zyra Taz. You can find her work at www.zyra.us
story_txt:
What It Is About
"The world around her seemed to melt away and dissolve into thick grey smoke, the light of the passing street lamps dimming and finally going out. Complete darkness surrounded her and yet she could see, as was the way of the realm. Therkous was her favorite plane, she loved it much more than the physical plane of Yumakous. It held possibilities and a freedom she’d never known in the waking world. Its shifting grey smoke holding the possibility of everything and nothing at the same time. She burned some of her energy and began to impress her will on the smoke as it started to condense and change color, twisting and collecting until before her a great garden began to form. It was her favorite thing about Therkous, the ability to make the garden she could only dream of. Large flowers of purples and blues bursting from a thick yellow clove carpeting, giant trees with orange leaves and white blossoms sprouting on spiraling twisted trunks growing in seconds, a large pond began to pool in the middle of the garden with tiger lilies (her favorite) growing in the water. In only a minute she had grown her sanctuary, and she reveled in it. "
A Dream Of Therkous is the first book in a three book trilogy I am writing, book one is in the final editing process already with a publish date hopefully of April 2021. It is an inclusive fantasy novel set on a different version of our world, in a time not unlike Victorian times. The world is full of devilish characters, fantastical creatures, magic, and access to another realm while people sleep; Therkous. Therkous is the dream realm, the plane of possibilities. A place where one can create anything they wish, for the cost of their physical wellbeing. 
The book is a walk in the life of the main character Seracill, they are a genderless being from a species of changelings. They search for companionship in a world full of people with ulterior motives. They face a suppressive church that controls the country they live in. They make all the right choices with all the wrong people on their quest to not be alone. They face their building insanity and the consequences and struggles it brings.  Will they find the company they have always searched for? Or will the world and their mind consume them before they get the chance?

story:
Hello!

My name is Jaime McDougall, and I am a US expat living in regional Australia. Like many, I have always loved stories - especially creating them. One of the first stories I wrote was a single page long and was about how my brother killed the world with a nuclear taco fart. It's been all uphill from there; I promise.

 
Thanks to a lot of help from some wonderful people, including my amazing teachers, this year I was able to work past health issues to start a professional writing and editing course at a local TAFE. My course will finish up at the end of 2013, but the novel class I took this year helped me to finish Fading Echoes.
 

The Project

Most of us have seen self-published books with horrible, slapped-together covers. Or self-published books that would have been fantastic if they had only been polished by a professional editor. I don't want this novel to be one of those books.
 
Fading Echoes started out as 80+ pieces of paper on my desk and turned into a finished novel with the help of supportive friends and chocolate.
 
 
Fading Echoes is the longest, most complex novel I have ever written. I know it can truly shine with both an amazing cover as well as the touch of a professional editor. Due to a string of emergencies, I'm not able to accomplish this on my own. I need help.

What I Need & What You Get

Your donations will help give Fading Echoes the best possible start. Your donations will go toward:

 
*Ebook and Print covers from Cohesion Editing and Proofreading
*Professional Editing and Proofreading
*Print copies of Fading Echoes (plus shipping)
*Small Online Book Tour to get the word out
 
If I don't reach my goal, money will go toward editing first. Not only will a professionally edited book sell more, it will help me to have more confidence that I have put out a book worth buying. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

This time of year is financially difficult for a lot of people. But that doesn't mean you can't help if you don't have the finances to do so. Please consider sharing this campaign on your blogs, Twitter accounts, Facebook, and other social media sites. Every little bit helps!

Read Excerpts

You can read an excerpt of Fading Echoes here.
If you'd like to read an excerpt of my first novel, Echo Falls, you can do that here with Amazon preview.
 
Fading Echoes Synopsis

Charlotte Peterson is the first of her kind in Echo Falls: a werewolf child of two naturally born werewolves. But being a ‘pure bred’ feels like a curse as she struggles not only to fit in with normal human beings but also to meet the expectations of her pack. Scarred by her past, she is unable to forget and struggles to move forward with her life.


Dr. Adam Baker arrives in Echo Falls and becomes friends with Charlotte despite having secrets of his own. He soon discovers that some families in Echo Falls have no medical files, including Charlotte’s family, and his questions begin to drive them apart. Both new and old friendships are tested as Charlotte struggles with wanting to share the burden of her secrets and the need to protect her pack.

Charlotte’s suspicions become a driving force as Compass, a company that tracks and kills werewolves, continues their genetic search to isolate the genes responsible for werewolf abilities. Calvin Stephens, National CEO, is focused on rising high in the Compass family and, following a trail twenty years old, he sees Echo Falls as a testing ground that will take him to the top.

The race to discover the secrets of Echo Falls forces Charlotte to choose between obeying her pack and following her heart.

story:
What is Dapper?

A campus men's magazine that seeks to represent the collective Northwestern male identity. The style tips, cultural wisdom, adventures, and longform reporting that every Northwestern man needs to know.

Why?

Because we're tired of Northwestern accepting its social division. There is one campus. There is one man. We are eclectic and curious and awkward and informed and ambitious. Dapper seeks to voice it all.

What We Need

$2000 ~ To print 1000 copies of a 28 page introductory issue to come out June 5th.

$300 ~ To publish the Dapper app, the first iPad app by any Northwestern student publication. (It will be a free download)

$200 ~ For web hosting and server costs, to prep for full website launch in the fall.

We're confident in our ability to reach our fundraising goal, but we know it's not a guarantee. We are also doing on-campus fundraising.

No matter what, we will be printing an issue and putting out an iPad app at the beginning of June. We have locked down the ability to be flexible with our printing company about paper and quantity options.

What Are We Doing?

Ian, Nate, and Tosten have spent the last four months clarifying concepts, planning early funding, building staff, and putting together master design templates.

Close to 25 students have spent the past month scavenging Chicago and Evanston for the most essential arts and culture, urban and weekend adventures, style wisdom, and vital in-depth campus features.

There is a design team laboring late nights to spew out beautiful code, racing against several other Northwestern student publications to be the first to go iPad.

We are doing this.

What Can You Do? 

Donate! Spread the word! Share this link! Help us establish ourselves. This is a team effort. We are excited for you to join our adventure.

---

Shout outs to the Dapper fam: Abbie Barronian, Alyssa Howard, Ashley Balcerzak, Bijan Verlin, Dan Hoffman, Emma Tyler, Gideon Resnick, Ian Robinson, Jamie Lovegrove, Jeremy Woo, Luke Vogelzang, Nicholas Knise, Peter Yoo, Rachel Reed, Roderic Figueroa, Steven Sachs, Susie Neilson, Willem Wang, and Zachary Woznak. Much love.

---

5/11 Update:

A little deeper into our heads.

story:
Who Am I?

Hello, friends! I am Vera Nazarian, writer, artist, creator of wonder, two-time Nebula Award Nominee.

You might know me as the author of the humorous mash-up parody Mansfield Park and Mummies, the first novel of my Supernatural Jane Austen Series. Or maybe you’ve run into one of my inspirational quotes that are all over the internet, originally posted on my creativity blog Inspired.Us and recently collected in The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration.

Maybe you’re a fan of my arabesque “collage” novel Dreams of the Compass Rose, or the cult classic epic fantasy Lords of Rainbow about an unrequited love in a world without color (yes, it’s the original “fifty shades of grey,” literally).

Yet again, you might remember me for the strange mythic stories in Marion Zimmer Bradley’s Sword and Sorceress anthologies. Or possibly, you’ve read my snarky pop culture essays on various TV shows and entertainment subjects such as True Blood, The Vampire Diaries, and Charmed, in various Smart Pop anthologies.

It doesn’t matter! We’ve probably “met” already, in one way or another. Now, let me share my project with you.

   


Cobweb Forest — Enter Me!

You are here because you genuinely loved Cobweb Bride, book one, and Cobweb Empire, book two of the Cobweb Bride Trilogy, my first new major novel series in a decade, written and published with the help of other successful crowdfunding campaigns.

It is an intricate epic fantasy flavored by Renaissance history, warfare, politics, and the romantic myth of Persephone and Hades in the Underworld, about death’s ultimatum to the world.

See the official Cobweb Bride website for more description of this compelling book series.

NEW! - Cobweb Bride (book one) is FREE for the Holidays! Get it for free on Amazon Kindle, B&N Nook Book, Smashwords (various), Kobo, Sony, and Apple iTunes!

So you’ve read the first book of the trilogy, went a little crazy—in a good way—then read book two, and really lost your heart—and now you are dying to find out what happens next!

What will happen romantically between Percy and Beltain?

What about Claere and Vlau?

Who is the Cobweb Bride?

Why is the world fading?

Well, get ready—in Cobweb Forest the stakes are now three times as high, and all the impossible mysteries will be answered at last!

The world is broken... All death and dying has ceased...

A dark Goddess rises... One maiden must stop her.

And at last you meet the dark Lord of the Underworld Himself... Hades!

Empires clash, kings and emperors and gods vie for supremacy, the living and the dead are at war, while love stories play out in amazing directions... secrets of life and death are revealed... and all the answers are here at last....

I am currently in the middle of writing book three, Cobweb Forest, the conclusion of this amazing story, and I cannot wait to share it with you!

If you liked the first book, I promise you will love this one! And if you loved the second book, now you will be blown away.


What's Needed & What You Get

Cobweb Forest is scheduled for release on December 25, 2013, Christmas Day, and I am sprinting to finish it in time. But all my resources are short! I desperately need your help!

In order for this third and final book to be as professionally presented, edited, packaged, and promoted as the first two, I urgently need to raise $3,500.

Your money will go toward:

  • Writing and office expenses
  • Copyediting
  • Editing
  • Final Cover design
  • Review Copies
  • Business Software monthly maintenance subscription
  • A new split ergonomic keyboard to replace my failing one.
  • Promotional and advertizing expenses.

The reward structure is very simple—for anyone who contributes at least $5, you will receive a copy of the finished ebook edition of Cobweb Forest in any ebook format of your choice. That’s a $1 savings off the retail price.

In addition, all contributors will be variously acknowledged inside the book!

  • $5 – Supporter
  • $10 – Patron
  • $25 – Benefactor
  • $30 and above – "Catch Me Up" Jackpot! ALL 3 BOOKS! (Complete Trilogy)

No need to contribute a huge amount, just $5 or a little above will do. But of course if you really want to be generous in any amount, I can only kiss you!

So that’s the fundraiser!

Short and sweet!


The Impact

Simply put, this will help me bring the book to you as fast as possible, in the most professional package.

It takes time and resources and sweat and basic work hours to make a book.

I am a full-time writer and publisher, and this is my day job.

Everyone needs to get paid for their work, whether you are a factory worker, business person, an entertainer, a computer programmer, a librarian, an accountant, a musician, a food industry worker, a contractor, a doctor, an artist, a teacher, a janitor, or a writer.

Please help me help you start reading Cobweb Forest as soon as possible!


Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough for everyone, and if you are unable to contribute with even a few bucks (believe me, I understand!), you can still help immensely, by spreading the word!

Tweet this campaign, post it on Facebook, Google+, LinkedIn, Goodreads, LibraryThing, or your blog, and just make some good noise! For your convenience, be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart, on behalf of myself and the hungry cats!

story:
CJ

As some of you know, I wrote a book! It is a book of Love poems that are weaved together to tell a story. story:
Adventures in  Yogaland Children's E-Book series

Adventures in Yogaland:  The Amusement Park is the first edition of a five book series of electronic yoga adventure books that mirror the experience of a children's yoga class.  The story featuring Chloe the Yogi is an engaging vehicle for learning yoga poses and reinforcing the emotional support that children get through stretching, breathing, and role playing.  Designed for tablets including iPad and the Nook, the  Adventures in Yogaland E-Book series was created as an answer to parents' desire to see and experience what their children are learning in the increasingly popular yoga classes offered for children.  It is cutting edge as it is the first book designed specifically to be enjoyed through electronic devices where both the child and the parent can benefit from seeing the movement in and out of the pose.

The Adventures in Yogaland E-book series is tailored toward children ages 3-7 and their parents.

How you can help

With a little help from you, we will be able to raise $50,000 to complete the development of the technology application for our first E-book in the Adventures in Yogaland series with Chloe the Yogi. 

Join the children's yoga movement and help Chloe the Yogi guide children through her many adventures in Yogaland!

Other ways you can help

You can also help by spreading the word! 

Share the link to this project page www.indiegogo.com/adventuresinyogaland on Facebook, Twitter, email, on your website.

Blog about our project and our campaign

Like us on Facebook

Follow us on Twitter

Tell your friends, family and co-workers about the project

 

Team Members Backgrounds

Lara Lauchheimer (Owner, President) is an Authorized Ashtanga Yoga Instructor who has traveled to India six separate times to study with the director of the Ashtanga Yoga Research Institute. In addition to study, Lara has used time abroad to give back, teaching yoga to HIV positive women in both India and Rwanda as a bridge to their healing.

Lara's yoga studio, Land Yoga, opened in Harlem in June 2011 to a large audience. Since opening the studio, Lara has been invited to teach at some of the most prominent private schools and yoga studios in the New York City tri-state area. Lara was also the recipient of the Birthright Next Grant which funded her original programming Yoga for the Jewish New Year.

Graduating with a BFA in theatre studies from Boston University, Lara uses her extensive knowledge of acting and story telling to create an adventurous, enticing yoga experience for her young students.

Nikoa Evans-Hendricks (Co-owner, SVP, Business Development Strategy) has worked as a corporate retail executive and strategic business consultant, helping national brands and retail developers expand business opportunities in emerging U.S. markets.

An accomplished entrepreneur, Nikoa was the founder and managing director of the successful retail venture N Boutique in Harlem. A premiere lifestyle retail brand hailed as ‘One the Top 25 Retailers in the US and Canada’ by MR Magazine, N Boutique has been featured in the New York Times, O Magazine, Uptown Magazine, Women’s Wear Daily, Elle Japan and other top publications.

A respected community/civic leader, Nikoa is a founding member and Executive Director of Harlem Business Association - Harlem Park to Park. Harlem Park to Park's membership includes 50+ of Harlem's premiere restaurants, retail, culture and arts and lifestyle venues.

Nikoa received her B.A. in Economics from Stanford University and an MBA from J.L. Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

Dr. Yolanda Lewis-Ragland (Medical Advisor) is a board certified pediatrician and community physician dedicated to the empowerment of disenfranchised and under-represented individuals. After completing her undergraduate career at Santa Clara University, she traveled to Cape Verde, West Africa as a Peace Corps Volunteer and Health Extensionist. During her tour there, she successfully implemented core curriculum health education and nutrition programs for young women and children while promoting women’s wellness and preparedness.

In1995, she returned to her original home of Washington, D.C. to train at Howard University College of Medicine (HUCM) graduating in May 1999. In June 2000, she began her residency training program at Howard University Hospital in Pediatrics and Child Health. Inspired by her community’s pressing needs and the growing trends of global health, Dr. Lewis-Ragland went on to obtain instruction in the fundamentals of Personal Training through the National Association of Sports Medicine and functions as a Fitness and Nutrition Coach to combat childhood and adolescent obesity in America and is the CEO of Family Fitness and Wellness, LLC, which she incorporated in January 2009. For two years (2009-2010) Dr. Lewis-Ragland was a co-investigator and fitness coordinator for the FitFamily Research Protocol for the Children’s National Medical Center, combating childhood and adolescent obesity alongside Drs. Nazrat Mirza and Yolandra Hancock. She now operates as one of the few providers for the IDEAL (Improving Diet and Exercise through Active Lifestyle) clinic as part of the Obesity Institute for Children’s National Medical Center servicing southeast DC where the majority of residents plagued by obesity and its co-morbidities reside.

Dr. Yolanda Lewis-Ragland currently resides in Washington D.C. with her three children and is a fitness/yoga practitioner.

Contact us

Do you need any assistance or have any problems with pledging? Please feel free to write to us at landyoga@gmail.com.

story:
Sister Spit began back in 1994 as an all-girl open mic night. While the spoken word craze of the 90s was in full swing throughout San Francisco, the city’s open mic events were largely male, largely straight, and largely douche-y. Recognizing a need for stages where girls (past, present + future) could perform their work without wading through shirtless Bukowski imitators, Michelle Tea and Sini Anderson created Sister Spit – a weekly, free, all-girl open mic. Sister Spit ran for two years, housed in a variety of venues – Blondie’s on Valencia (if you can believe it!), the back room at the CW Saloon during the lez dance party Muffdive, and the SoMA speakeasy the Coco Club.

   

In 1997, Michelle and Sini brought Sister Spit on the road. Using the same model of the touring their friends in punk bands used, they booked a month-long cross-country tour, with shows every night in a different dive bar, art gallery, queer club, sushi restaurant, punk basement, community space throughout the USA. Sister Spit’s Ramblin’ Roadshow toured constantly between 1997 – 2000 with year-round regional jaunts building up to the massive cross-country endeavor each August. 

       

In 2007, Michelle Tea revived Sister Spit as Sister Spit: The Next Generation. Having just edited an anthology of new, young, queer writers she was looking to take some on tour. She wanted to bring along some older Spit writers, and voila: a new generation of Sister Spit was born. Since 2007 Sister Spit has staged one major tour each year, bringing up-and-coming writers alongside their published, more established peers. Sister Spit shows allow writers new and old to promote their work to an audience they would not be able to access on their own. Books are sold, fans are made, and new opportunities – Literary agents! Foreign translations! – are seized.


Sister Spit has come a long way from the tours of the 90s, when sleeping on a stranger’s floor was the norm and writers were paid $80 for a month of grueling, non-stop work. Nowadays we rent our vehicles to be sure they are dependable – in the 90s, Sister Spit vans were famous for catching fire in Nevada or outright dying in Mississippi. Now, We stay in hotel rooms, making the rigors of touring a bit easier on the crew. And we make a point to pay the writers for their work on the road and time away from their jobs.

Because Sister Spit makes a point to travel not only to the big cities but also seeks smaller, underserved queer populations, Sister Spit is able to provide audiences hungry for LGBTQ, feminist, underground voices with a slew of new writers to read and watch out for each year. By pairing up with local writers in many of these towns, local writers get to be part of a really big show, and Sister Spit gets exposed to even more new voices to work with in the future.


We are asking for community support to help this tour be as successful and far-reaching as possible! By contributing to Sister Spit, you make it possible for us to travel into cities and towns that might not be able to fund the full cost to put up our show. You make it possible for us to pay writers working their butts off to support their art. You help sustain the work it takes to get the show on the road – work that begins nine months before we roll into town.

Please consider making a donation today!

Help us continue to bring Sister Spit to diverse locations across the country AND receive some awesome perks!  Just to name a few:

  • Books out on City Lights/Sister Spit
  • Your very own screening of Valencia!
  • Poetry chapbooks
  • A letterpress 'LEZ DO THIS' card designed by Jaye Fishel! 

  • Your portrait drawn by Amanda Verwey, illustrator of Valencia’s opening credits.
  • and A PRIVATE SISTER SPIT EVENT!

Spread the word and help keep the longest running queer literary touring troupe on the road!


Special thanks to CAG Productions for the great video!
