story:
What is the Transformative Language Arts Network?


The Transformative Language Arts Network (TLAN) is a national not-for-profit organization founded in 2006 to support individuals and organizations in promoting the written and spoken word as a tool for personal and community transformation. Watch an inspiring video about our organization, featuring the music of Kelly Hunt and further explaining our three main goals:


  1. Developing the field of Transformative Language Arts (TLA) 

  2. Networking people who are already working in this field, particularly through artist residencies, publications, education, and community programs 

  3. Providing right livelihood resources to help writers and artists in this emerging field make a living from their calling and work in service to their communities


The Network organizes the Power of Words conference; has published The Power of Words: A Transformative Language Arts Reader, the first study of TLA in theory and practice; distributes resources on TLA and Right Livelihood; and this spring we’re launching on-line classes, with offerings on writing and healing, poetry, ecology and art, and support for poets, writers, storytellers, and performers who want to develop skills that help them move toward make a living through arts-based community projects. This spring we want to get materials ready for a summer launch of our next endeavor: the One City One Prompt Project.


What is One City, One Prompt?

One City, One Prompt is a series of hosted writing, performance, and community-building events across the country.  Through “One City, One Prompt,” communities can come together to create writing, stories and other arts, and through the process of writing and speaking together, cultivate greater civility, deeper dialogue, and sense of purpose. Each community, working with writers, storytellers and performers with extensive facilitation experience, will write on one theme of importance to that community.

Each experience is unique but collectively threads ideas towards a shared understanding of our greater national community, allowing participants, through the power of poetry, to begin to bridge partisan political views and engage in a civil discourse on community values. These events will culminate through an extensive, interactive website that will share participants' writing, experience, and each participating city's communal discoveries about itself through a variety of media, including the written word, audio recordings, photography and film.



What We Need and What You Can Get

We are seeking funds to help us fully launch this project, including to create a One City, One Prompt organizing manual for facilitators, distribute support materials that will be used for the events, support local and national marketing, provide technical support for community facilitators and technical services to create and maintain the online component of this project. All the community facilitators have already agreed to volunteer their time, and all community events will be open and free to the public. We're just looking for the funds to get the other pieces in place. We currently have grant proposals out and are awaiting response, however we also thought we would reach out directly to see how people responded.


Folks donating will receive our gratitude and number of other gifts as our way of connecting with you and saying thanks. These include membership to the Network, advertising in our newsletter, sponsor pages on our site, and copies of the TLA Reader.    


Other Ways You Can Help

Visit the Transformative Language Arts website website and pass it along to all those you know who are engaged in writing, storytelling, performance and any artist committed to personal growth and social transformation.

story:
Short Summary

Do you realize that many of our “rights” are not actually mentioned in the Constitution?  For example, it says nothing explicitly about the right to marry or to have, or not have, any children.  While most of these rights are not controversial and we take them for granted every day, several were once restricted or prohibited by laws that had to be challenged in court.  These include the right have a job, to travel from state to state, to attend a private school, to learn a foreign language, to live with your grandchildren, and even to choose your child’s own name! 

 

I am Mark Thorburn and I am a freelance writer and the author of six books.  With graduate degrees (and a strong personal interest) in both history and the law, I want to write and self-publish a book about the court cases that have dealt with many of the rights not expressly mentioned in the Constitution.  My goal is to discuss the important and interesting decisions in a light, yet informative, way so that everyone can pick up the book and, after only ten or fifteen minutes, learn something about the history and development of our civil liberties and how judges decide constitutional disputes.

 

The book, You Have the Right . . . :  Constitutional Rights That Are Not Mentioned in the Constitution!, will summarize the background and results of each of these fascinating cases in short, 750 to 1500 word chapters.  (Just to give you an idea – this profile is about 750 words long.)  The final, paperback edition will cover between 30 and 40 cases in approximately 200 pages.  Give me a shout if you want more information of what I have in mind.  I also intend to put the book out in an e-book edition.

 

You Have the Right . . .  will be perfect for elementary and high school civics and history courses.  Lawyers and schools can use the book as a contest prize or giveaway at Bill of Rights Day and Law Day events.  It will be a great read for those with short periods of time to kill (like when sitting on a bus or in a waiting room).  Everyone interested in American history or the law will want a copy.  And I hope to eventually find You Have the Right . . .  in as many school, college and public libraries as possible.

 

You might be wondering why I’m self-publishing.   Quite simply, all of my previous books were written on a contract basis and that had many negatives, including payment by flat fee (no share in profits) and lack of control (no say in how to design or promote the work).  Dealing with a publisher who pays their authors with royalties involves even more problems, including a significant lag time in production (up to one year).  Self-publishing is a lot faster, I retain full control over all aspects of the production and marketing of my work, and I get a bigger share of the profits. 

 

I have already spent seven months on research and am now ready to put pen to paper, but I need your help! 

 

I want to devote myself full-time to the writing of the book so I can complete the manuscript in three months.  Otherwise, I’ll have to work on it bit by bit on weekends and evenings for a year or more.  Writing full-time means giving up my other job as a tutor and foregoing other writing assignments.  Unfortunately, I’m not independently wealthy.  Additionally, after completing the manuscript, another two months will be needed for those tasks that are required to create and market a book, like hire a professional editor and typesetter, design a cover, convert everything into an e-book, ISBN and Library of Congress registration, establish a website, and so on, all of which is not cheap.

 

The planned release date for the book is April 1, 2013 (just in time for Law Day!).  If I do not reach my $10,000 goal by Sunday, November 4, 2012, I will continue with the project as best I can and use the money collected to publish the best book possible over a longer period.  But the more funds I collect for this project, the sooner I can finish it and the higher quality product I can provide (sturdier paper, binding, etc.).

 

Finally, I would appreciate your help in spreading the word!  Please use the "Share" tools at the top of this page to tell your family, friends, colleagues, and online communities about this project.  Even if you can't contribute right now, just telling a few people about it will help immensely.

 

Thank you for taking the time to read about my book project!

 

P.S. If you would like to arrange a custom perk package that you don't see listed, please e-mail me at thorburn52@hotmail.com and we'll work something out.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Do you realize that many of our “rights” are not actually mentioned in the Constitution?  For example, it says nothing explicitly about the right to marry or to have, or not have, any children.  While most of these rights are not controversial and we take them for granted every day, several were once restricted or prohibited by laws that had to be challenged in court.  These include the right have a job, to travel from state to state, to attend a private school, to learn a foreign language, to live with your grandchildren, and even to choose your child’s own name! 
 
I am Mark Thorburn and I am a freelance writer and the author of six books.  With graduate degrees (and a strong personal interest) in both history and the law, I want to write and self-publish a book about the court cases that have dealt with many of the rights not expressly mentioned in the Constitution.  My goal is to discuss the important and interesting decisions in a light, yet informative, way so that everyone can pick up the book and, after only ten or fifteen minutes, learn something about the history and development of our civil liberties and how judges decide constitutional disputes.
 
The book, You Have the Right . . . :  Constitutional Rights That Are Not Mentioned in the Constitution!, will summarize the background and results of each of these fascinating cases in short, 750 to 1500 word chapters.  (Just to give you an idea – this profile is about 750 words long.)  The final, paperback edition will cover between 30 and 40 cases in approximately 200 pages.  Give me a shout if you want more information of what I have in mind.  I also intend to put the book out in an e-book edition.
 
You Have the Right . . .  will be perfect for elementary and high school civics and history courses.  Lawyers and schools can use the book as a contest prize or giveaway at Bill of Rights Day and Law Day events.  It will be a great read for those with short periods of time to kill (like when sitting on a bus or in a waiting room).  Everyone interested in American history or the law will want a copy.  And I hope to eventually find You Have the Right . . .  in as many school, college and public libraries as possible.
 
You might be wondering why I’m self-publishing.   Quite simply, all of my previous books were written on a contract basis and that had many negatives, including payment by flat fee (no share in profits) and lack of control (no say in how to design or promote the work).  Dealing with a publisher who pays their authors with royalties involves even more problems, including a significant lag time in production (up to one year).  Self-publishing is a lot faster, I retain full control over all aspects of the production and marketing of my work, and I get a bigger share of the profits. 
 
I have already spent seven months on research and am now ready to put pen to paper, but I need your help! 
 
I want to devote myself full-time to the writing of the book so I can complete the manuscript in three months.  Otherwise, I’ll have to work on it bit by bit on weekends and evenings for a year or more.  Writing full-time means giving up my other job as a tutor and foregoing other writing assignments.  Unfortunately, I’m not independently wealthy.  Additionally, after completing the manuscript, another two months will be needed for those tasks that are required to create and market a book, like hire a professional editor and typesetter, design a cover, convert everything into an e-book, ISBN and Library of Congress registration, establish a website, and so on, all of which is not cheap.
 
The planned release date for the book is April 1, 2013 (just in time for Law Day!).  If I do not reach my $10,000 goal by Sunday, November 4, 2012, I will continue with the project as best I can and use the money collected to publish the best book possible over a longer period.  But the more funds I collect for this project, the sooner I can finish it and the higher quality product I can provide (sturdier paper, binding, etc.).
 
Finally, I would appreciate your help in spreading the word!  Please use the "Share" tools at the top of this page to tell your family, friends, colleagues, and online communities about this project.  Even if you can't contribute right now, just telling a few people about it will help immensely.
 
Thank you for taking the time to read about my book project!
 
P.S. If you would like to arrange a custom perk package that you don't see listed, please e-mail me at thorburn52@hotmail.com and we'll work something out.

story:
“You will see that you are like me,” the tree said. “The words you say, the songs you sing, the thoughts you think, every action you take- is a seed. You plant these seeds every day.”

- Marigold and the Faraway Tree
 

Dear Supporters, 

If you know me, you know that I love to deliver stories into the world- and not just any stories, but stories with heart-

My first children's book, Marigold and the Faraway Tree, is a coming of age story of a nine-year-old girl, whose relationship with an old tree guides her through an important season in her life.

I have always been fascinated by the stage in which children awaken to their "inner world", and with that come the responsibility to develop emotional intelligence, sensitivity to others, and a connection to Nature and Spirit.

This story was inspired by the true life presence of a Faraway Tree that stands at Imhoff Farm on the backside of the Blue Water Café, next door to the Higgeldy Piggeldy Farmyard in Kommetjie, close to the southern most tip of Africa known as Cape Point.

I like to think that the best stories originate in our own back yards and help us to see ordinary things, like a town, a character, or the turning of the seasons, through the lens of imagination, as a point of wonder and curiosity. And I think it's important to keep that perspective, as we grow older. 

Marigold and the Faraway Tree is the first book I wrote, nearly two years ago now, and it was so effortless, I found myself writing more... and more...

My intention is to publish and read these stories the old fashioned way to my nieces and nephews, to my friends and their children when I visit, and to produce a series of such stories under the publishing title, Sugar Plum Press.

We're all in place to do something small but meaningful.

Writing is a step toward what makes me come alive. So I am taking this step... and then another. And I know there are plenty of others stepping along, beyond and beside me.

Together we go!

ALISON :  )

 

Budget

The total cost of illustration, layout/design, copyediting, printing, shipping and a simple WordPress site is: $6711.00 + IndieGoGo Fee (10%) = $7260.00


Here are the pledges I will need to make it happen: 

10 people donate $200.00

25 people donate $100.00

50 people donate $50.00

10 people donate $25.00

 

If I raise more, it will go to distribution in South Africa.

Meanwhile, the book will be made available on Amazon.com for those who want to purchase in the US.

Since many of my friends and family are in fact, adults who never grow up, I am counting on their support for this publication. You know who you are...

 
 

AUTHOR: Alison Fast

Illustrator: Wendy Paterson

AGE LEVEL: 4-8, 9-12

PAGES: 32

 

Chapter 1: Discovery

Chapter 2: An Unexpected Friend 

Chapter 3: Seasons Turn

Chapter: 4: Saying Farewell

 

Marigold & the Faraway Tree

(excerpt)

There, on the backside of the tree, Marigold found a ladder, and on the front side of the tree, a slide. She ran up the limbs of the tree and slid down to its roots. She ran round and round the waist of the tree, and swung far from its trunk in the air.

At the center, she found a hollow opening, just her size, and climbed deep in to the heart of the tree. From there, she could only hear her own thoughts, twirling and swirling like dry, fall leaves. 

When her thoughts settled, the tree spoke. He told her the story of how he became the Faraway Tree.

“Once upon a time, I was a seedling. I was born to a big family of trees. We lived in a perfect row at a hilltop overlooking a great valley. One day, a strong gust of wind came, and carried me away from everything I knew. I tumbled for days through the air and landed in this place where I am now far- faraway from any trees at all.”

"Although," the tree paused, "now that you've come to play with me, I don't feel far at all."

 

Author

Alison Fast is a freelance producer and filmmaker who loves storytelling across all mediums. This is her first children’s book. Her inspiration comes from traveling, spending time in nature, and supporting people from diverse communities across Africa and the Middle East to share their stories through documentary educational films. She likes dark chocolate, philosophical conversations and brainstorming illustrations with her illustrator at the Annex in Kalk Bay, South Africa. She lives in Los Angeles and New York and travels and teaches with Barefoot Workshops between other projects.

Illustrator

Wendy Paterson is a former teacher and archeologist, based in the beautiful village of Scarborough, South Africa. She works as a freelance illustrator from home with her two children, and draws inspiration from her the beauty of her surroundings and the funny things children do and say. She loves bright colors and happy pictures, fresh sea air and a really good cup of coffee. Surfing Sally is her first children’s picture book. She also illustrates various children’s readers, textbooks and educational games. Examples of her work can be seen here: http://www.surfingsally.com/Illustrations.html

 

Off the page and into the world....

Sugar Plum Press is a place full of home-baked, scrumptiously told tales, with vividly drawn, taller-than-tapioca illustrations, delivered in a fun-filled, free-feathered way for little ones who would otherwise run silly as funky-monkeys, and wild as turkey-lurkeys.

Sugar Plum Press was born from the idea that good stories are homegrown, local acts of Imagination, YES-NESS, and Kindness.

Unpack the sweetness and wonders of the world with Sugar Plum Press.

Web Site (coming soon!)

story:
One of the most time consuming questions for me to answer as an Adult Third Culture Kid is “Where are you from?” Having grown up in six countries and having lived in four more as an adult, in addition to the 5 U.S. States I’ve been a resident of, I typically respond to this question with a question like, “At which point in my life? Do you mean where I was born or where I grew up? Or where I live now?”

During all of these transitions from country to country, my family would spend some time at what the U.S. Department of State calls our “Home Leave Address;” in other words, the address where we would be living in between homes abroad and where any mail or official documents were sent while between country assignments. This address was my Grandparent’s home in Whitehall, Michigan. Summer after summer between overseas moves, I would spend countless hours in the nature of West Michigan. I especially loved the trees across the street from my Grandparent’s house and since being back in Michigan as an adult, I have realized how in and through all the change in my life, these trees remain steadfast and a visual representation of the “roots” I’ve developed in this place.

Recently, I have been doing a lot of (re)considering about my concept of “home” as an Adult Third Culture Kid. At the core of it, I am wondering where my tap roots are. Certainly Michigan holds a deep one metaphorically and physically.

One way I have processed this intentional (and at times painful) reflection process is by writing. In doing so, I have crafted a children’s book inspired by true events and experiences in my own life that have reflected the importance of place-making and root-making in a globally mobile upbringing.

The book’s theme centers around a globally mobile family’s experience in being moved back and forth from one country to another with their “home base” being Michigan. Their home in Michigan has a backyard tree that they recognize as a marker of “home” for their children. The tree house built in this particular tree has all the places and dates carved on the slats to showcase where their past homes abroad have been. After coming back to their States-side home from one overseas assignment, the family discovers that this tree has been cut down and their tree house has been abandoned. Yet, they find a way to honor their grief of this emotionally abrupt change and discover a unique way to process it with what remains of their tree.

I’m pleased to share that Summertime Publishing will publish this book this year! Also, I’m so incredibly honored and delighted that my friend and fellow ATCK, Mikaela Newbanks, will be doing all the illustrations for it.

If you would like to support the publishing of this book, please contribute to this campaign! THANK YOU!

story:
Summary

My name is Andy Littleton and I'm a small church pastor and small business owner in Tucson, Arizona. I'm also the proud son of Leroy Littleton, a man who never would have led a public organization or started a business. He never would have been invited to speak at a conference. He was quiet and unassuming. You had to try really hard to get information out of him. But he was an amazing dad. He died of cancer last year, and my family and I miss him dearly.

I want to share out of the depths of what he instilled in me. I began to write about him, and sense that he offers a perspective on life and faith in God that may be far more helpful and accessible than that being dished out by people like me...people who come across like they have something to say and know how to say it. You can help me do this. This summer I'll embark on a journey of remembering, pen and paper in hand. Within a year The Little Man will be written, and you can can learn and share the insights left upon the world by a man that nobody realized they should listen to.

What I Need & What You Get

I've discovered that I write best as my memory is jogged. Some things were themes in my dad's life; trains (he lived in a box car as a kid), walking, the town of Bisbee, Oregon, his hobbies, road trips, his old Fords, my mom, and his son. So this summer I plan to write out of those experiences during a sabbatical my church has graciously offered. Here's what I'll do...

-Take a train from Tucson to Oregon (I have a place to stay for free in Portland).

-Walk to and from Lebanon, Oregon (Where I grew up, and where my dad lived his young adult years and met my mom). 

-Drive home an old F-250 just like his.

All the while I'll be writing out of my experiences and memories. Then I'll get the manuscript edited and make print copies available for you and anyone else who connects with the journey.

The Breakdown:

  • I'm shooting for $5000 to help fund the trip (on a shoe-string budget!!), get design work done for the book, cover editing / publishing costs, and promote the project.
  • To sweeten the deal for those who support this project, I am offering some very Leroy perks! Beyond supplying you with a finished copy of the book I will also be offering the following; Photos (by my dad or I) framed with wood from his shop, concrete Ford F-250 home decorations, made in USA flannels that I find for you in thrift stores, a reading party, and even a trip with me in the F-250 to Bisbee.
  • If I don't reach the entire goal, I'm still committed to this project. It's a labor of love. I'll apply all funds I raise toward these goals and adjust as necessary.

The Impact

Your contributions will help take this project from good to great:

  • With your support, this book will be edited and presented well.
  • With your support, this book will be born out of focused and meaningful time.

Risks & Challenges

I am a very busy guy, being a husband and father who also runs a small (fairly new) business and co-pastors a small church. This year I have Sabbatical time to use, but need to use it well in order to tune-in and really walk through these memories and experiences. My hope in writing this book during a focused trip, is to keep me deeply engaged in the process and undistracted from the regular needs within my community. I reflect well while writing, so the process itself will be an exercise of care for my soul. I believe that I can offer something of meaning out of stepping away to create this book about my dad.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help me out by:

  • Share this campaign on social media and via email to people you think would be interested.
  • Pray for me and my family during my time away.
  • For my friends in Tucson, care for one another in my absence:-)

story:
Would you like to pass some of your favorite books on to the next generation?


All across the country, bookstores and arts organizations have not only been struggling to survive the COVID-19 pandemic, but also to find ways to support our communities during this difficult time, and the Beat Museum is hardly an exception.

So when we heard about how R.J. Julia Booksellers in Madison, Connecticut, raised $150,000 to put books in the hands of children who might not otherwise have access to them, that gave us an idea: to create a program for fans of the Beat Generation to donate books by Beat writers and poets to students around the country!

Schools are currently closed, and while some have managed to shift classes online, students are nonetheless stuck at home. So what better a time to discover the Beat Generation? Nearly every day, people tell us about how discovering the Beats changed their lives, and gave them the courage and permission to be who they want to be. We think the world could use more of that going forward. We know dozens of educators who would be thrilled to hand out these books to their students—for free!—either as part of a summer reading program, or when school starts up again.
 

1). Start Small and Expand with Each Success

We’ve already spoken with two of our friends, one a high school teacher, and one a college professor. Between them we’re looking to provide 100 "Starter Packs” for their students, each with a copy of Howl, a copy of On the Road, and A Coney Island of the Mind. The retail value of all three is $36. We’ll be able to provide 300 books to 100 students for $2,500—our Level One Goal.

This fundraiser is a project of Friends of the Beat Museum, a 501(c)3 registered public charity, and any donation you make is tax deductible (IRS ID #74-3198671).
 

2). Assess Additional Need with Educators

If you’re an educator and would like to participate in this program, please email us and tell us how many Starter Packs you would like for your students. Enough for your classroom? Your department? We’ll fulfill as many requests as we can with the funds we’re able to raise.
 

3). Seek Out Sponsors and Matching Grants

If we’re able to achieve our Level One Goal of $2,500 for 100 students, we’ll move on to a higher goal. We’ll seek out sponsorship, and try to partner with other organizations that can help extend the reach of this program even further. With each success, we get more books into the hands of even more students—and introduce the Beat Generation to hundreds more young people!

Assess Additional Need with EducatorsIf you’re an educator and would like to participate in this program, please email us and tell us how many Starter Packs you would like for your students. Enough for your classroom? Your department? We’ll fulfill as many requests as we can with the funds we’re able to raise. 3). Seek Out Sponsors and Matching GrantsIf we’re able to achieve our Level One Goal of $2,500 for 100 students, we’ll move on to a higher goal. We’ll seek out sponsorship, and try to partner with other organizations that can help extend the reach of this program even further. With each success, we get more books into the hands of even more students—and introduce the Beat Generation to hundreds more young people!

story:
Story of My Book

Overlapping Worlds is an exploration of how nature can play a role in strengthening, reinforcing, and maintaining strong mental health in elite athletes. Not only does this book look through the unique lens of nature as a psychological wonder it also examines the stigmas that surround mental health in athletic communities and seeks to advocate for more open and honest conversation.

My name is Olivia Grace Barnes and I am the author of Overlapping Worlds. I wrote this book because as a competitive athlete who has struggled with mental health issues, I felt called to speak up, not only for current athletes like myself but also for any future athletes who might struggle. Also, being a born nature lover, I was inspired to share the wondrous powers that nature can have on the mind; connecting the worlds of mental health, sports, and nature into a colorful overlap.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to embrace the subject of mental illness within your community and learn how to appreciate and experience being in nature more fully. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for nature loving and mental health advocacy. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you become not only a better person, both mentally and physically, but also a pillar of support for anyone in need.

In this book, you'll learn about the stigmas that surround mental health and how nature can affect your mind. You'll hear stories such as...

  • The thought process of Olympic track star Michael Marsh during one of his most memorable races.
  • Mental health advocate Victoria Garrick’s journey through her athletic mental struggles that eventually gave way to her widely viewed TED Talk.
  • Nature expert Ronna Schneberger’s insight into the power of being “nature-wise.”

You will love this book if you enjoy sports, respect nature, and desire a change in how mental health is viewed and approached.

Overlapping Worlds is a nonfiction book that speaks to elite and competitive athletes who want to look at mental health and nature in a new way.

 

The Book - Overlapping Worlds

The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction and Chapters 1 - 4. In the introduction, you will get a glimpse into one of the most memorable stories within this book, my first encounter with wild dolphins. Then, in Chapters 1 - 4, three athletes from different levels and backgrounds illustrate the mental side of competition as we look into what goes on in the minds of elite athletes as they train, compete, and prepare for greatness.

Part 2 contains Chapters 5 - 9, the part of the book where we start our dive into mental health advocacy. In exploring the stigmas that surround mental illness in athletic communities, these chapters seek to uproot those ideas and inspire open and supportive conversations around mental health struggles. These chapters are also filled with quotes and stories from Brené Brown, Michael Phelps, and other inspiring athletes and mental health advocates.

Part 3 contains Chapters 10 - 12 and looks in depth at the topic of environmental psychology. Along with the stories and experiences of two incredible researchers, this section explores how nature affects the mind and why it has the power to make such a positive impact on our mental health. It is in these chapters that I share the story of my encounter with wild dolphins.

Part 4 contains Chapters 13 - 15 and the Conclusion. It is in this final section that we examine the overlap between mental health, sports, and nature. Connecting dots from previous parts and chapters, we return again to the minds of athletes, but this time focus on how athletes react to spending quality time in nature. As the book comes to a close, we complete the circle of exploration into how nature can play a role in strengthening the mental health of elite athletes.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Olivia Grace Barnes is a rising senior in high school with a long-standing love for and appreciation of nature, a strong voice, an inspiring desire to lead, and an impressive resume of achievements from being a nationally competitive swimmer.

Olivia’s passions have long included both competitive sport and spending time in nature, but it wasn’t until she experienced a mental health struggle herself that she became interested in that field of study as well. As she began to realize that there was room for positive impact in the overlap of sports, nature, and mental health, she decided to speak up to try to make a change.

After leaving traditional high school for something called self-directed learning, Olivia is what many might call a high-school dropout. Although she might not take traditional classes in a traditional school setting, she still continues to spend her time learning about things such as marine conservation, wildlife photography, and what it takes to become an elite athlete.

For more information, you can connect with Olivia at oliviabarnesinc@gmail.com and on LinkedIn and Instagram

 

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:
  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

 

Please use #OverlappingWorlds and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Olivia Grace Barnes

story:
KILTR Debate #4 - Democracy in Europe

 KILTR.com are Scotland's experts in live-streamed debates on important issues such as the Scottish Referendum. The fastest growing, user-generated cultural platform aims to achieve transparency on the subject of Democracy in Europe, contextualising Catalonia and Scotland's forthcoming, and of great national interest, conversations on their parallel secession votes.
 We'll be inviting some of Catalonia's most high-profile figures including Mr Alfred Bosch, official spokesman for ERC, and Marcus Pucnik, international press officer for Societat Civil Catalana.
 Given that other institutions have been accused of bias within the UK media, KILTR aim to further remedy this and carry out #4 in their series of debates, one again, in an impartial manner, and provide a worldwide audience with information and debate on how democracy can be improved in our society, and what parallels and differentiations can be found at the moment in Spain and Scotland.
 You will be contributing to the FIRST ever, live-streamed discussion, at least in English, on the subject of democracy in Scotland and Catalonia.

What We Need & What You Get

 We have raised £1500 thus far privately, which will cover flights and some of our accommodation. We require a further £2K to hire La Pedrera in Barcelona, and also £1.5K for a camera and tech team. The funding that you can provide will get you anything from positing questions to the panel, or exclusive access to the recorded version of our debate for your blogs, platforms or news sites.

    The Impact

    We are experts at live-streamed debates. We feel passionate about providing the public with impartial conversations on world issues that are affecting citizens globally. This will be the 4th debate to take place and we feel, given the event's uniqueness, that it will be setting a precedent - unparalleled with what any Scottish Media company has attempted before. Past debates have taken place as far afield as New York and we'd like to make you a part of our next, deeply ambitious attempt in Barcelona.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please share, share, share on KILTR.com/referendum and all your other favourite channels using hashtag #KILTRREF and @KILTR

story:
Reimagine book publishing

The internet has turned stories into global conversations. 

It has rewritten almost every part of the media and publishing industry, except for one: books.

Books haven't changed much since Gutenberg. It typically takes an author a year or more to write a book, and then by the time it goes through a publisher, and a distributor, and a bookstore, and then to you, the world has already changed. The process also leaves those of us who love books far removed from the authors and books we love.

So, we're making a new kind of book for the digital age. 

The book is called Follow the Geeks, and it's about the future of work. We're writing about 10 digital entrepreneurs who have figured out some of the best secrets to success.

We will be serial publishing Follow the Geeks—releasing the chapters one at a time—instead of making you wait a year or two until we finish the entire book. Each chapter will be available for free online for a limited time. 

By serial publishing and crowdfunding, we can also involve you in the process and give you the opportunity to help shape the final product. 

Ultimately, we want to change the way books are made, delivered, and funded by taking advantage of the power of the internet. We know that’s ambitious, but that’s our goal.


What's this book about?

We found some of the smartest, most inventive digital entrepreneurs, and we're wrapping their stories together in this book. Because they are so innovative in their careers, we want to innovate in the way we create a book about them.

In the future, more people will act like entrepreneurs in order to build meaningful, productive careers. The people we’re writing about have experimented, struggled, and hustled to figure it out. They’ve broken the rules of a traditional career path by juggling multiple gigs, starting their own companies, or creating new business models in their fields of expertise.

Anyone who wants to think more innovatively about their work can benefit from this book. You may be an entrepreneur, work as a consultant for multiple businesses, or innovate inside your own company. Whether you're just out of college or in the middle of your career, this book will have insights for you. 

We also want to include your wisdom in Follow the Geeks. Each time we publish a chapter, you will have the chance to submit insights about the subject of the chapter, and the best insights will be included in the final version of the book.


Who we are

We’re two feisty journalists who love in-depth reporting and writing stories that make a difference. We also have a penchant for rule breaking, which is why we decided to publish this book in a creative new way.

Lyndsey brings the passion it takes to explore challenging subjects and explain complex issues. She works for CBS Interactive as a staff writer for TechRepublic, covering sustainability, social entrepreneurship, 3D printing, and tech leadership.

Jason has an infinite amount of enthusiasm for the future of journalism and digital storytelling. He works for CBS Interactive as the editor in chief of TechRepublic and long form editor of ZDNet, and writes about the people and technologies that are changing the ways we live and work.


What we need

When signing a book contract with a traditional publisher, an author usually gets an "advance" to cover costs while working on the book. Since we're self-publishing, we decided to crowdfund $10,000, the average amount of a book advance. 

The money you give will go toward: 

  • Book design and layout
  • Audiobook production
  • Book printing costs
  • Travel and research costs
  • The time we're dedicating to doing this right


What you get

We're crowdfunding so that we can build a community of readers who care about the future of work. We are making ourselves accessible and responsible to the biggest fans of our project—you, our backers—by offering awesome perks and exclusive access to the chapters. 

Here are some of the perks:

  • Give $20, and you'll receive the e-book and Follow the Geeks swag
  • Give $35, and you'll receive the audiobook, e-book, and swag
  • Give $50, and you'll receive the hardback, e-book, audiobook, and swag
  • $100 will get you all of the above, plus an opportunity to have your 100-character message published in the final version of the book
  • $250 will get you all of the above plus a 250-character message
  • $500 will get you all of the above plus a 1-hour Q&A call with the authors


Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute to this campaign, we'd still love and appreciate your support! 

You can: 

  • Tell everyone you know about Follow the Geeks
  • Email your friends and family about this campaign
  • Promote Follow the Geeks on social media (bit.ly/ftgeeks)
  • Read the chapters when they're released, and tell us what you think

story:
KUNG HINDI NGAYON, KAILAN? KUNG HINDI SIYA, SINO?

A movement is now in progress. The movement seeks to field Davao City Mayor Rodrigo Duterte as a presidential candidate in 2016. There is, of course, some doubts about the movement. No mayor has ever made the long jump from City Hall to Malacañang. In fact, no one has yet made a successful leap from Mindanao to the presidential palace by the Pasig River, not to this day.

We need FUNDING to keep this going.

What We Need & What You Get

Facebook reaches 30 million users in the Philippines. With the current move of the cellular network companies (Globe, Sun, Smart) to give mobile users free access to Facebook, this is easily the best medium to reach the masses.

The campaign to promote the Facebook page "Duterte for President" and get the message out costs around PHP 11,000 per day. The page currently have 32000 followers. There are currently 52 million registered voters in the Philippines. Our goal is to reach at least 10 million followers. Hopefully, the good Mayor hears these 10 million  voices and decide to run for the presidency which many of us believe that is the only way forward for the Philippines.

The Presidential election for is on May 4, 2016. Mayor Duterte can file for candidacy at least 90 days before this date. If the facebook page is promoted for at least a year (365 days), we need at least PHP 4 million.

The Impact

Where this advocacy is coming from does not astonish. It is not difficult to see that it is coming from a groundswell of despair over the systematic thievery by government officials of pork barrel funds. It may also be coming from chronic fatigue from the endless, divisive bickering among politicians.

The issues currently hounding the Binays of Makati only add fuel to the fire. The use of dummy companies is standard operating procedure among many local executives who—no mystery here—bask in the lifestyles of the rich and famous. In many town and cities, local government does not function effectively. In some others, there does not seem to be any government at all. The same is true in many barangays—where peoples’ money trickles down to the Sangguniang Kabataan, which has made thievery part of the youth’s political training.

What people see in Davao City is the exact opposite. Out there, even ordinary citizens reprimand those violating the smoking ban. And the mayor’s daughter gets apprehended for violating the city’s speed limit regulations.

We truly believe that Mayor Duterte is the answer to this growing desperation. IF WE SUCCEED, THE FRUITS ARE NOT ONLY FOR US BUT FOR THE NEXT GENERATIONS TO COME.

Risks & Challenges

There will be, doubters, haters and skeptics.

Here is our manifesto:

We promise to be transparent with the funds and use it only to promote the advocacy it was created for. We will post the details of the funds and how it is used.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of us just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean we can't help. Please share the facebook page "Duterte for President" to all your friends and loved ones. Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Together we can make this happen!

KAILAN? KUNG HINDI SIYA, SINO?
A movement is now in progress. The movement seeks to field Davao City
Mayor Rodrigo Duterte as a presidential candidate in 2016. There is, of course,
some doubts about the movement. No mayor has ever made the long jump from City
Hall to Malacañang. In fact, no one has yet made a successful leap from
Mindanao to the presidential palace by the Pasig River, not to this day.
We need FUNDING to keep this going.
What We Need & What You Get
Facebook reaches 30 million users in the Philippines. With the current
move of the cellular network companies (Globe, Sun, Smart) to give mobile users
free access to Facebook, this is easily the best medium to reach the masses.
The campaign to promote the Facebook page "Duterte for
President" and get the message out costs around PHP 11,000 per day. The
page currently have 32000 followers. There are currently 52 million registered
voters in the Philippines. Our goal is to reach at least 10 million followers.
Hopefully, the good Mayor hears these 10 million  voices and decide to run
for the presidency which many of us believe that is the only way forward for
the Philippines.
The Presidential election for is on May 4, 2016. Mayor Duterte can file
for candidacy at least 90 days before this date. If the facebook page is
promoted for at least a year (365 days), we need at least PHP 4 million.
The Impact
Where this advocacy is coming from does not astonish. It is not
difficult to see that it is coming from a groundswell of despair over the
systematic thievery by government officials of pork barrel funds. It may also
be coming from chronic fatigue from the endless, divisive bickering among

story:
So who is UrbaneAdventurer?

  • Zoe Todd, 31, PhD Candidate, rabble-rouser
  • Edmonton blogger
  • advocate
  • songwriter
  • aspiring filmmaker
  • researcher
  • drawer-of-funny drawings
  • Fart Coach

So why does this UrbaneAdventurer need your help, anyway? 

Well, last week my laptop broke. In spectacular fashion. Total, utter, complete destruction. Unsalvageable. The very kind, very sad man at the computer store informed me today--over three separate phone calls (he tried so so so hard to save my computer, bless!)--with great trepidation in his voice, that it would cost £1400 to repair it (that's about $2500 CAD), which he pointed out 'makes the repairs uneconomical'. Sigh, indeed. So here's where you come in:

  • I rely on the laptop to blog about Edmonton, Indigenous issues, academia at my blog http://zoeandthecity.wordpress.com/.  With my laptop, I create content which makes my blog a platform to assert an Indigenous perspective on Edmonton as a city, and I use this platform to nudge people towards shifting the paradigms through which we imagine our community. 
  • I can't afford to replace the laptop I had, but I can afford to pay for half of a new MacBook Pro (thankfully I still qualify for an educational discount), which will enable me to continue to write, create video shorts, record and edit music, and upload art on political and local topics that I am deeply passionate about. If you donate, you will help me replace my work machine with hardware that will allow me to keep offering what I offer to the community through my writing, art and music. By pitching in with the other half, you get to keep enjoying all the things I create and share with the community!
The Impact
  • I also lost about two weeks of work when my laptop died last week. Yeah, that's right, did I mention I'm four months away from completing a PhD? Finishing my PhD will allow me to return to focusing my attention on Edmonton, Indigenous issues, art, music and films that advocate for loving and accountable relationships in our communities. So by helping me right now, you help to ensure I can devote more of my time to my first and only true love: EDMONTON!
  • My work has been published in academic and non-academic fora--you can visit my online CV (http://zoesctodd.wordpress.com/) for a detailed list of my writing. I've also created short films on Indigenous identity and movement/'being away'. You kindly nominated me for one of the Inaugural 'YEGGIES' in the "Best of Edmonton Category" in 2013. I've contributed to numerous local non-profits through tireless work in communications, event-planning, fundraising, and public education. I've given public talks on Edmonton's Indigenous history, I've been interviewed in print and film and radio. This blog--which gives voice to my storytelling as a Metis woman--is a labour of love for me, something that I do in addition to my rigorous and demanding PhD work. I can more than guarantee that if you help to replace my laptop I will continue to lovingly contribute to local conversations about what it means to be an Edmontonian, and I will strive to expand the imaginative horizons upon which we build our stories.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • hugs and words of encouragement as I strive to meet my dissertation deadlines are always welcome! I know many of you are struggling to make ends meet, and I don't expect anyone to give money if they cannot afford to. Your presence in the local community is valued in ways that I fail to capture in words alone. We are so lucky to have the vibrant social media/blogging/active citizenship community that we do in Edmonton. It is something I have yet to encounter in any other city.

story:
How It Started

While attending church one Sunday, the pastor said that at times we look so perfect on the outside but our insides are all shattered.  He described how we carry some things so deeply that others may not be aware we are going through trials.  

At that moment, I regained perspective in my life.  I realized that although my life had been filled with tumultuous trials, setbacks and milestones, God had never left me. I was finally able to see that God had been there all along - regardless of how much I just wanted to see change in my circumstances.  God continued to show himself – even when I didn't want to see Him.  I was going through so much all at one time, I had to do something.  I did; I surrendered it all to Him.  Inspite of It All, He never gave up on me!


"Write down the revelation and make it plain on tablets so that a herald may run with it.  For the revelation awaits an appointed time; it speaks of the end and will not prove false. Though it linger, wait for it; it will certainly come and will not delay.

"See, the enemy is puffed up; his desires are not upright—but the righteous person will live by his faithfulness—"

Habakkuk 2:2-4, NIV

In Spite of It All Magazine represents the resolution to give up prideful and selfish endeavors - the deadly poison we inflict upon ourselves.  It is about how we become convinced that pride is lifting us up.  But through God, we can stop confusing our prideful behaviors with strength.  In Spite of It All Magazine releases fears, insecurities, and apprehensions by demonstrating God’s transforming grace.  My prayer and vision for In Spite of It All Magazine is to:

  • Motivate women to have an intimate relationship with and deep love for God;
  • Inspire women to seek insight from God’s word;
  • Inform women about the common threads (in Christ) binding all our experiences;
  • Embrace the passionate inspirations, sobering musings, and creative expressions inspired by God.

My Story…

I allowed misperceptions and fear to be my culprit in life.

As fear ran and stuck on me like wax dripping down a candlestick and misperceptions stunted my spiritual growth, I started feeling lost and frustrated.  I began to isolate myself and became a secret keeper - trying to live with what I could no longer bear.  Women are known to be good at keeping secrets, without realizing that the enemy uses it to disgrace and demoralize our minds and block us from trusting and hearing God's voice.  By becoming the secret keeper and allowing misperceptions to become the culprit in my life, I wounded myself losing trust and becoming blind to reality.  The solution: I surrendered to God!

Unsure when it really began, I now identify the dissolution of my marriage as one of the first changes that led to a downward spiral in my life.  As I transitioned from being married to becoming a single mother my desires changed.  I longed to be ever present in my children’s lives.  I wanted to shield and protect them even more.  Having acknowledged that meant I was in need of rescue.  In order for me to save them, I had to be saved myself.  I needed to realign myself with God and allow only those in my life who chose to know, live and love Him.  Understanding this would allow me to demonstrate Godly character, love, work ethic and discipline for my children.  I then became an example for them.

However, the present moment of my spiritual journey was manipulated.  It wasn't until I began a dance with breast cancer that I realized I was not leading. Cancer decided to snatch the sound of sweet melodies from my life and rip the strings that tied together my unsung songs. I became so broken and shook up to the point that I could not call out to God.  It shut my heart down and I suffered over the apparent imperfections of life.  But that was only the first dance. Eventually, a second dance with cancer ensued and this time around I submitted to a new leader.  God was in control and helped me understand that He had been leading the dance all along.

My life completely changed. I continued to try to maintain a way of living that would sustain and reward my children for a life that they so deserved.  Gracious family members and friends stood in when I could not stand at all.  At times I found myself doubting my capabilities of not only taking care of my children but myself also.  I still carried on an air that I was so okay, confident and not becoming a display.  At that time in my life I really thought I had lost more than I gained. 

My situation forced me to give up things - not the things I wanted to have but the things I needed.  I decided that my life had become more worthy for my children's sake and they became my strength. Scripture says that God does not give us any more than we can bear (1 Corinthians 10:13), but at that time I felt I had hit rock bottom.  But there was hope.  I held on to my vision and desire to change what was happening to me and my family. Now I know that nothing that I have been through will be wasted.

In spite of it all, with everything that was spinning in my life, I was able to go through the fire cringing, weeping, broken, empty, enduring and even losing everything.  But this was only the beginning of my spiritual journey.  I became encouraged as I began to meet women that felt comfortable just sharing openly with me about their lives.  These women taught me more about the love of God and His word. In spite of it all, God granted me grace while I was in the fire! God sent me what I needed, through   
                                                                       creative women, to connect directly to Him. 

You will read many of these women’s stories in the magazine. Their untold stories spoke to me as I know they will to you.  They will take you to a place in your life that maybe you could never really talk about.  As you embrace these creative musings they will empower, encourage and inspire your soul.  In Spite of It All Magazine  captures the essence of women all over and gives them hope!

Giving Back to the Community

Yes, there are other inspirational magazines already out there, but In Spite of It All Magazine IS different. It springs from a well of collective spiritual experiences shared by women everywhere resulting in a magazine that not only inspires, but provides the healing balm necessary to transcend a broken spirit.  In addition to uplifting and inspiring others through articles, poetry, art, and short fiction, we believe in sharing in a real world sense as well.  That’s why it is our intent to share a portion of the profits to help others haunted by the demons of past hurts, habits, and hang-ups.

Initially, we are collaborating with two regional non-profit organizations making a difference in the community:

  1. One is a Columbia, SC faith based organization helping single mothers in transition rebuild their lives. These women come from all walks of life. The program fosters a sense of hope by showing women how to break the destructive cycle of chronic poverty.  It works by responding to the emotional, physical, and spiritual needs of the women and children in resident.
  2. The other is a Durham, NC faith based non-profit that has developed a manhood training program utilizing mentoring, counseling and self-development skills to help young men successfully transition into adulthood. It instills self-esteem and confidence while reinforcing a positive concept of manhood. With an emphasis on faith, the program teaches responsibility, respect for women, education, positive work ethics, and respect for cultural diversity.

We Need Your Help

  Launching a brand new magazine is a massive undertaking and we need your help and support along the way. We’re estimating that we’ll need at least $25,000 to get this unique project off the ground. Keep in mind this is a frugal estimate and we welcome all the support we can get. Remember, not only will you be helping us launch the magazine, but you’ll be making a difference in the community too! 


Here’s how your funds will be used to support the launch of In Spite of It All Magazine:

Domain name and hosting

We've actually already registered the domain name – inspiteofItallmag.com. In addition, we‘ll need hosting capable of handling multimedia as the magazine will also have an electronic version online.

Software

We'll need software for laying out, designing, and publishing the print magazine. We’ll also need to purchase and implement software that will allow us to establish an electronic version of the magazine. In addition, we'll need to implement membership capabilities on the website. We’ll also need email software to keep in touch with our subscribers.

Website design

Yes! We purchased a domain name, but that’s only the first step. We will to hire need an experienced web designer to breathe life into our vision. We've managed to accomplish many things, but web design is definitely NOT our strong suit.

Writers / Contributors

Good writers are worth their weight in gold. Therefore, we will need to pay writers to ensure you are receiving a quality product each month. We need writers who can draw you in and keep you inspired.

With that being said, we invite you to share your own personal spiritual experiences to help uplift and inspire others who are 'going through'. If you are interested in contributing to In Spite of It All Magazine, please email us your ideas for article, poetry, short fiction, or inspirational art. You may find yourself featured in an upcoming issue.

Editorial staff

Along with writers, every magazine needs an editorial staff. After all, who wants to read a poorly laid out magazine full of spelling and grammar errors? Though we’ll be using high quality writers, we still need experienced editors to make sure In Spite of It All Magazine is everything we envisioned for you.

Social media manager

We've established a basic social media presence at Facebook, Twitter, and Google. We’re in the process of getting our LinkedIn account set up as well. However, managing social media is a demanding job. We are finding we will soon need a dedicated person to help us grow and to get the word out.

Graphic designer 

The need for quality graphics is immense. We are constantly networking in the community and need quality graphics for professional correspondence and more. In addition, we will also need to hire a dedicated graphic designer for layout once we have everything in place.

Printing

Whew! Printing is expensive! Once we have actually laid out the first issue, we’ll need to source a printer to produce the physical magazine.

Mailing Costs

And of course, we will need to pay postage costs for mailing the magazine to subscribers. We'll also need to mail all those wonderful perks to you once the campaign has ended. Mailing definitely is NOT cheap these days.

Miscellaneous

This is by no means and exhaustive list of everything we’ll need to properly launch In Spite of It All. However, it will sure go a long way in getting us started. There will definitely be other miscellaneous costs associated with producing the magazine.

We Appreciate Your Support

We greatly appreciate your support and help with our vision in the launch of In Spite of It All Magazine. As a small token of thanks, we are offering several perks for your selfless donations. Here’s a brief list of some of the perks you can earn with your support:

  • Highly discounted advertising rates in our first print issue of In Spite of It All
  • Special Recognition in the first print edition of the magazine
  • 1-3 month trial subscriptions of the e-magazine version of In Spite of It All
  • In Spite of It All Inspirational bookmarks
  • In Spite of It All Inspirational journals
  • In Spite of It All Inspirational coffee mugs
  • In Spite of It All Inspirational t-shirts
  • In Spite of It All LIMITED EDITION ‘Thank you’ post cards

and MUCH MORE!

Be sure to browse the ‘Perk’ section to get a full overview of how much we appreciate your help and support!

Other Ways You Can Help

While we certainly need and appreciate your monetary support, we need your help in other ways as well. In order for this campaign to be as successful as possible, we need to get the word out.

Most of us have social media accounts – Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, Foursquare, etc. You get the point. PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN.  Connect with us on social media!

www.facebook.com/inspiteofitall

http://google.com/+gildamorana7

https://twitter.com/inspiteofitall7

https://www.linkedin.com/pub/gilda-morana/93/4b4/412


Again, thanks for your support!

If you are interested in contributing to In Spite of It All Magazine, please email us your ideas for article, poetry, short fiction, or inspirational art. You may find yourself featured in an upcoming issue.
Editorial staff
Along with writers, every magazine needs an editorial staff. After all, who wants to read a poorly laid out magazine full of spelling and grammar errors? Though we’ll be using high quality writers, we still need experienced editors to make sure In Spite of It All Magazine is everything we envisioned for you.
Social media manager
We've established a basic social media presence at Facebook, Twitter, and Google. We’re in the process of getting our LinkedIn account set up as well. However, managing social media is a demanding job. We are finding we will soon need a dedicated person to help us grow and to get the word out.
Graphic designer 
The need for quality graphics is immense. We are constantly networking in the community and need quality graphics for professional correspondence and more. In addition, we will also need to hire a dedicated graphic designer for layout once we have everything in place.
Printing
Whew! Printing is expensive! Once we have actually laid out the first issue, we’ll need to source a printer to produce the physical magazine.
Mailing Costs
And of course, we will need to pay postage costs for mailing the magazine to subscribers. We'll also need to mail all those wonderful perks to you once the campaign has ended. Mailing definitely is NOT cheap these days.
Miscellaneous
This is by no means and exhaustive list of everything we’ll need to properly launch In Spite of It All. However, it will sure go a long way in getting us started. There will definitely be other miscellaneous costs associated with producing the magazine.

We Appreciate Your
Support
We greatly appreciate your support and help with our vision in the launch
of In Spite of It All Magazine. As a small token of thanks, we are offering several perks for
your selfless donations. Here’s a brief list of some of the perks you can earn
with your support:


Highly discounted advertising rates in our first print issue
of In Spite of It All
Special Recognition in the first print edition of the
magazine
1-3 month trial subscriptions of the e-magazine version of
In Spite of It All
In Spite of It All Inspirational bookmarks
In Spite of It All Inspirational journals
In Spite of It All Inspirational coffee mugs
In Spite of It All Inspirational t-shirts
In Spite of It All LIMITED EDITION ‘Thank you’ post cards


and MUCH MORE!
Be sure to browse the ‘Perk’ section to get a full overview
of how much we appreciate your help and support!

Other Ways You Can
Help
While we certainly need and appreciate your monetary
support, we need your help in other ways as well. In order for this campaign to
be as successful as possible, we need to get the word out. 
Most of us have social media accounts – Facebook, Twitter,
Google+, LinkedIn, Foursquare, etc. You get the point. PLEASE SHARE THIS
CAMPAIGN.  Connect with us on social media!
www.facebook.com/inspiteofitall
http://google.com/+gildamorana7
https://twitter.com/inspiteofitall7
https://www.linkedin.com/pub/gilda-morana/93/4b4/412

Again, thanks for your support!

story:
Kristen and I have been invited to attend Faerie Con East on November 2016 at the Hunt Valley Inn, MD. We are going to be selling copies of our books, and artwork, as well as share the love of all things magical.

But we need a little bit of help getting there. As some of you know travel expenses come into play when you go to some of these events. Between gas, hotel, food and parking, it adds up very quickly. Any help you can provide will be greatly appreciated. Thank you so much for your contribution!

 

Liz DeJesus was born on the tiny island of Puerto Rico.  She is a novelist, freelance writer, writing coach and a poet. She has been writing for as long as she was capable of holding a pen. She is the author of the novel Nina (Blu Phi'er Publishing, October 2007), The Jackets (Arte Publico Press, March 2011) First Frost (Re-realeased through Indie Gypsy Summer 2015), Glass Frost (Re-released through Indie Gypsy Summer 2015), Shattered Frost (Indie Gypsy, Summer 2015) and Morgan (Indie Gypsy, July 2014). Her work has also appeared in Night Gypsy: Journey Into Darkness (Indie Gypsy, October 2012), Twice Upon a Time (Bearded Scribe Press, Winter 2015) and Someone Wicked (Smart Rhino Publications, Winter 2013). Her articles have been featured in Southern Writers Magazine.

​Liz is currently working on a new novel and a comic book series titled Zombie Ever After (Emerald Star Comics, Fall 2014).

Kristen is a graduate of the Delaware College of Art & Design (DCAD) class of 2005 with an Associates Degree in Illustration. She is an up & coming artist in the tri-state area. She is well known for her fairy and mermaid portraits.

While typically working on private commission work, she has begun to branch out into book and comic related work. Most notably, her illustration of Bianca Frost for the novel First Frost.

For more information on Kristen Corbett please visit http://ivycatdraws.tumblr.com/

story:
QUEEN & Other Stories...

...has been several years in the making. It's a novel-length collection of my horror and dark science fiction work and includes selections from my two previous small-press short story collections (2008's Despairs & Delights and 2009's Magick & Misery), pieces that made their debut in various anthologies, a handful of no longer available Amazon shorts and, of course, some brand new work unique to this collection. The thirteen short stories and one novella include:

  • Tradition: A widow and a group of her late husband's friends take a stab at a cathartic hunting trip in the aftermath of the zombie apocalypse.
  • Old Stooping Lugh: Irish and Italian gangsters run afoul of an ancient Celtic deity in 1920's Boston.
  • Nice to Matter: The secret origin of a superhero cop's prostitute sidekick.
  • The Bad Place: A little girl discovers the secret behind her brother's disappearance–and an outlandish time-travel plan to save her from their abusive father that might do more harm than good.
  • Queen: A middle-aged woman in a frigid marriage discovers her experimental age-defying treatment may be something more than skin deep.

Though I've been published traditionally since 2006, I've had the occasional flirtation with self-publishing and want to finally take the plunge with a full-length, single-author work. I don't see this as any different from a mainstream publisher taking pre-orders prior to the publication of a book. 

You can read a sampler of the book's first five stories here.

A Bit About Me...

I’m Lincoln Crisler. I write about unreal things (superheroes, zombies, killers with supernatural powers…you get the idea) in as realistic a manner as I can.  I’ve been doing it since 2006, though I’ve been writing all my life. My most recent short story publications are in anthologies from IDW Publishing, Angelic Knight Press, Black Bed Sheet Books, Kalamity Press and James Ward Kirk Publishing. I’ve recently completed my first novel and am currently shopping it around to agents and publishers. I am a member of the Horror Writers' Association. 

I’m also an editor; I’ve probably received the most attention to date for helming a very well-received anthology of dark-superhero fiction. I’ll be reading for another anthology, scheduled for 2014 publication by Angelic Knight Press, at the end of 2013. I’m also the managing editor of a quarterly, digital magazine–The Midnight Diner. 

Besides the writing, I have a full, active life. I’m married with three kids. I’m a staff sergeant in the United States Army, currently stationed in Waegwan, South Korea. I own a small business with my wife, where I handle web/graphic design, social media and document editing and formatting. 

Your Money Pays For:

  • Cover art--and you WILL see the finished work before the book's launch.
  • Promotional efforts--I am hiring a professional publicist to work with me on the launch.
  • Copies of the book--to fulfill campaign perks, for reviewers and to have on hand at local signings and professional conventions attended by people from all over the world.
  • If I make more than my goal (i.e. I sell more pre-orders), I'll roll the money over into convention expenses, some really cool perks at my next local signing, and/or my next self-publishing effort.

Ten percent of any money raised over the $800 goal wIll be donated to the Horror Writers' Association's Hardship Fund, which assists with loans for certain members who need them, and funds dues renewals for others. 

What's the Risk?

I'm asking for money, and since it's my goal to reach new readers, there's a good chance you don't know who I am. What could go wrong with that, right? In this particular instance, as long as you're interested in a collection of horror and science fiction shorts, there's very little cause for concern:

  • The book is already written. I won't be halted by writer's block, and if ninjas steal my hard drive, I have everything backed up to a cloud, too. And it's already been edited--even the self-published and brand new shorts have had eyes on them!
  • Using Indiegogo, I've raised the operating budget needed to take a unique, but struggling, magazine to the next level. Since then, I've acheived my goal of making all the back issues available for Kindle, and we're currently reading for the first issue of our new format.
  • I'm not only proven as a writer, but as a businessman. I'm currently working toward completing my BS in Business, and help my wife run a home-based business that adds several grand annually to our household budget. I won't blow the money you spend on my book on things that can't work.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the campaign with people you really think will be interested in pickin' up what I'm puttin' down!
  • Follow me on Twitter and Facebook for updates on upcoming projects, cool things my author friends are doing, the occasional book reviews and sometimes, to be completely honest, just me going off about something stupid, funny, or truly frightening. 
  • If you like what you see, please tell a friend about me, or suggest one of my books!
