story:
♥  Pick a perk and make our FLIGHTLESS BULLY TALE take flight ♥

THE STORY

Meet Pomeroy. His friends and family call him 'pom pom' for short. Pomeroy hates his nickname and would prefer to be called by his real name: Pomeroy Paulus Jr III. Like any boy his age he's busy trying to impress 'the birds', namely one bird: Pia. Pomeroy dreams of a pair of orange swim trunks; the ones that Pete, Pucker and Piper own. The same ones Pia said she loved. There's just one little hiccup. The antAmart doesn't carry his size. 

Stay tuned to learn how mom helps Pomeroy get his orange swim trunks, see that Macaroni penguins are not made of mac'n'cheese, and watch Pia save the day when she puts bullies in their place. 

FOUR GREAT REASONS TO SUPPORT OUR PUBLISHING DREAM

(because four are better than three)

♥  You'll help us stand up against bullies and lend your voice to someone so big that his voice has become small: Fat jokes are not funny and they hurt!

♥  You'll allow us to produce (illustrate, edit, scan, post produce, book design & print in Canada) every part of Pom Pom - A Flightless Bully Tale 

♥ You'll own a copy of the book you helped us publish (and maybe even your own custom antarctic character)

♥  You'll help fund Rebecca's 2nd year of Art School. By paying Rebecca (21) real market value for her art work we were able to fund her first year of Art School with Our Canadian Love Story (Linnie's 1st book) without her having to bag groceries. How cool is that?

HOW IT WORKS

It's ALL or NOTHING. If we don't make our goal to the last penny, you get your MONEY BACK and BULLIES WILL BE BULLIES. * I'm plugging my ears while I write this as I refuse to entertain the thought. This mission takes an unwavering optimist. 

♥ SO LET'S GET IT DONE ♥

For every $25 donation you contribute, we will send you a signed 1st edition copy of Pom Pom - A Flightless Bully Tale. Unless we know you, then we will deliver it in person. 

Check out all our special perks on the right. Why not make this the year you gift someone you love an antarctic character in a children's book while you help us stop a bully or two? 

WHY WEIGHT BULLIES HURT

“Weight stigma can affect every aspect of a child’s life. Children who are bullied for their weight may want to skip school, avoid physical activity and avoid social interactions with their peers. The scariest part is that weight stigma may have long-lasting detrimental effects on both physical and mental health throughout the lifespan.”

-Dr. Angela S. Alberga 

I (Linnie) worked for the Canadian Obesity Network and was lucky to be involved in numerous amazing initiatives like the 1st Canadian Summit on Weight Bias and Discrimination and in creating the Perfect at any Size royalty free image bank to combat weight bias in the media. 

This book is a love note to the many amazing people I've met along the way who have been the target of bullying and have experienced the endless pain it causes. If this initiative can start a dialogue we have taken a joint step in the right direction. 

$ 20,000 IS A CHUNK OF CHANGE. DID WE GET GREEDY? 

Short answer: No. I Promise.

Long answer: Exactly one year ago our first indiegogo campaign Our Canadian Love Story successfully raised $11,043 toward our $10,000 goal. We're still floored and smiling. 

Here's the truth. We had no clue what we were doing. We were green behind the ears. I had never written a book, Rebecca had never illustrated one and I thought I had budgeted plenty. Turns out...I hadn't! 

Once Indiegogo and Paypal had taken their cut, the illustrator (Rebecca), the scanner (Grant), the editor (Ricki), the book designer (Christina), the printer (FRIESENS) and storage (nice guy at storage mart) were paid, I had invested another $10,000 of savings into the project. 

This time around I have no savings to throw in...sad face. 

This time YOU'RE ALL WE'VE GOT to make this happen and WE PLAN TO. 

OUR TRACK RECORD 

With 1500 copies of Our Canadian Love Story distributed we're about to break even. Nic (my husband) and I worked tirelessly on distributing, site building, shipping, sales pitching, school reading and every other task ending in 'ing' to make this dream fly. 

With an industry full of 'you can try but it's close to impossible' babbles against us, we pulled off our publishing dream without compromising a single value. 

Thanks to you we were able to pay everyone involved Canadian market wages for their services and just six months after our initial campaign ended we held our beautiful MADE IN CANADA book in our hands. 

This month Our Canadian Love Story moves into the Air Canada e-boutique as the first children's book ever. 

Sure we had some time delays, plenty of hiccups and a hurdle or ten to jump...but we learned, grew and optimized along the way. (ps we had some perks bounce back...please contact us if you haven't received yours and we'll send it out again)

More importantly we CREATED and LIVED our DREAMS THANKS to the 192 Indiegogo BELIEVERS * we even sold our last custom character after the campaign had ended...yay!

NOW LET'S DO IT AGAIN FOR A CAUSE SO DEAR TO OUR HEARTS

We've got our orange pom poms pinned to our lapels and stand beside Pia when she says 'Real friends don't ever laugh at friends. Because in the world [we] want to live in MOCKING IS FOR WEAKLINGS and [we] like our friends strong, gentle and brave.' 

PLEASE help us take Pomeroy's hand as our flightless bully tale takes flight. 

♥ WE CANNOT DO IT WITHOUT YOU AND IT'S TIME THAT SOMEBODY DOES ♥

ps the biggest thank you in the world goes to my friends Ben and Mariel for volunteering their time and energy to make the video. It means the world  ♥♥♥

story:
Halle Iverson can't remember the first six years of her life. But she's more concerned with finishing the month suspension free and making the first A on her report card. Just when she might succeed, a stranger interrupts her life in Scottsdale with a confession.

Her memories weren't lost. They were stolen.

 So the journey to find them begins. Amongst a world of gold horned elephants, wolfkeepers, and floating Chinese palaces, Halle searches for the truth. How can she be the warrior prodigy that others claim when she's too short and too dumb to be of any use? Could her parents really be kidnappers?

Whatever the truth is, Halle better find it quickly. Bounty hunters known as Collectors scavenge the universe, harvesting people, devouring towns. And if Halle can't reclaim her past and forgive those who betrayed her, Scottsdale will be but a memory.

                                                    START READING NOW! 

                                                           CHAPTER ONE


                                           WELCOME TO MY CAMPAIGN

Hello, my name is Z.Y. Mullington and Star Weaver is my first novel. I've been writing it for over 10 years and am ready to send it out to the world. All I need is a little help.

   At the very least, I need $4,475.

  • $1,800 for a professionally edited novel (80k). 
  • $850 for a professional typeset novel. 
  • Estimated $1,825 more for reward fulfillment and Indiegogo fees.

   BUT….

   That’s the minimum. If I want a hardcover option (YES!) illustrations (YES!), translation into other languages (YES!) or advertising banners, or posters, or reviews from Kirkus or the Clarion, then I’ll need more. A lot more. But before I even dream of that, I need to get this baby out into the world.

               SPECIAL FREE REWARD!

Post a link on your Facebook or Twitter page, get 25 or more likes and you'll receive the Ebook for FREE!

Book Quote Wallpapers- All that's missing are the quotes, which will be added after the editing process, but here is a sneak peek at the wallpaper backgrounds.

Signed Paperback Book

Halle Iverson can't remember the first six years of her life. But she's more concerned with finishing the month suspension free and making the first A on her report card. Just when she might succeed, a stranger interrupts her life in Scottsdale with a confession.Her memories weren't lost. They were stolen. So the journey to find them begins. Amongst a world of gold horned elephants, wolfkeepers, and floating Chinese palaces, Halle searches for the truth. How can she be the warrior prodigy that others claim when she's too short and too dumb to be of any use? Could her parents really be kidnappers?Whatever the truth is, Halle better find it quickly. Bounty hunters known as Collectors scavenge the universe, harvesting people, devouring towns. And if Halle can't reclaim her past and forgive those who betrayed her, Scottsdale will be but a memory.                                                    START READING NOW!                                                            CHAPTER ONE                                           WELCOME TO MY CAMPAIGNHello, my name is Z.Y. $1,800 for a professionally edited novel (80k). 

$850 for a professional typeset novel. 
Estimated $1,825 more for reward fulfillment and Indiegogo fees.

"Congratulations! We are thrilled to tell you, based on your impressive application, you have been chosen as a recipient of a scholarship to attend BinderCon in New York City, November 7 - 8, 2015"


AHHHHH! I got a scholarship to BinderCon! I'M SO EXCITED!

So... What is BinderCon?

BinderCon is a conference aimed at increasing the diversity of voices in the media by empowering women and gender non-conforming writers with tools, connections, and strategies to advance their careers. You can learn more about it here. 

My scholarship gives me access to two full days of panels, workshops, and networking events where I'll have the chance to pitch to (or at least make awkward chit chat with) editors and agents. I even get to attend their VIP party which gives me more opportunities to mingle with my fellow writers and social betters.

I'll get to learn from amazing writers and editors like Suzy Khimm, Jennifer Gonnerman, Stacia Brown, Lauren Kelley, Ashley C. Ford, Jaclyn Friedman, and many more.

In short, this is an incredible opportunity for me to learn new skills, connect with like-minded people, and get my work out there!

But NYC is a bit expensive. Okay, a LOT expensive and the Canadian dollar is not doing me any favours. That’s where you come in! I need your help to make my dream a reality. 

Who are you?

Hi! I'm Lindsay Tessier. Writer at large, wild-hearted rebel and witty conversationalist. Here's a picture of me celebrating Ernest Hemingway's birthday with a glass of scotch.                                

 

I love politics, fashion, punk and indie music, feminism, travel, neon pink accessories, and reading everything from Russian literature to comic books.

Last year I graduated from j-school and now I write freelance. I write about politics, social justice issues, feminism and tech. I also write about my experiences with PTSD, poverty, disability and mental health in the hopes it will help others dealing with similar issues. 

My passion is investigative journalism. I'd really love to do more in depth, longform pieces. I think BinderCon will give me the skills and boost of confidence I need to keep pushing forward with my work.

Cost Breakdown

Here's how the $1300 breaks down:

  • $922.17 for accommodation close to the venue
  • $379.80 for round-trip travel to the conference (best price when I checked multiple sites on Aug. 22)
If the entire goal is not reached, the money raised will still be used to help send me to BinderCon. I will sell my clothes, books (whimper) and extra organs to make this happen because it is too great an opportunity to pass up.

If the campaign manages to exceed its goal, the extra money will go towards food and (depending on how much extra money is raised) an extra day in NYC. 

Awesome Perks

To show my gratitude, I'm offering some cool perks to those who donate!

These include: 
  • Mystery postcard
  • Handwritten letter w/ a special surprise
  • Personal book recommendations
  • Delicious cookies
  • Yours truly singing a song of your choosing
  • And much more!

The Impact

American fashion designer Norma Kamali said, "The most important thing to do is to take risks. The risks are where breakthroughs happen, and big shifts take you to new places and create opportunities." 

I fully believe this. The most wonderful things in my life have come from being brave and taking risks. Going to NYC. Pitching my articles to strangers. Asking you for help. These are all risks. Risks I am willing to take to see what new opportunities they will bring. 

I believe this trip will help me be a braver, stronger writer. I mean, this is the city of Vogue, The New Yorker and The New York fucking Times. Some of that magic is bound to rub off on me. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just don't have any money to give. I completely understand. But that doesn't mean you can't help!

Make some noise! Help me spread the word. Pass this around on Facebook or Twitter. Scrawl it on the wall of a bathroom stall! Graffiti it across buildings! Okay, maybe just that first one. But seriously, go tell your friends!

About Our Campaign

Dean Wean Speakin' is a motivational speaking group under the direction of Dennon Mitchell, more commonly known as Dean Wean. Since the start, Dean Wean has reached over half a million people through weekly life coaching videos across social media platforms. Dean's vision is to spread positivity by telling his life story through an autobiographical book, 9 Years Old. The book documents Dean's struggle facing adversity that comes with growing up in a negative environment. In support of the book he will also produce a documentary visualizing chapters of the book. 

Your Contributions

Your contributions will be put towards:

  • Publishing & Distribution of the autobiographical book, 9 Years Old
  • Video Documentation in support of 9 Years Old. The video's aim is to help visualize chapters from the book to help readers further connect with Dean's story.
  • Any extra funding will be put towards future endeavors for the Dean Wean Speakin' movement including youth engagement, speaking seminars, etc.

You Can Help

Any monetary contribution to our campaign is helpful, but you can also help us out by sharing this campaign on your social media platforms with the corresponding links on this page. Anything you can do is greatly apprecieted!

 

Thank you for your support! 

- Dean Wean Speakin'

story:
The Story of My Book

Sarah’s Still Life is a coming-of-age journey about Sarah Hall, a tea shop clerk and aging student, who is reaching for a dream, looking for love, and dealing with the difficulties that fate puts in her path. Haunted by the influence of her father and weighed down by the demands of her mentally ill mother, Sarah is struggling to launch her life and make the future her own. 

My name is Matthew Kopf, and I am the author of Sarah’s Still Life. I wrote this book because I wanted to tell a story of a regular person struggling through life the way most of us do. Today, it seems, we’re surrounded by superhero stories and unrelatable characters with superhuman-like abilities or talents. This story is the antithesis of those.

I hope that readers discover, not only an enjoyable story, but feel as if they’ve experienced life through Sarah’s eyes. I hope it serves as a reminder of the hardships we all face while staring down this thing called life. When love, hard work, and circumstances collide, the outcome is always far from certain, or as Sarah’s late father would say, Life is hard, wear a helmet. 

The journey spans two continents but begins in the American rustbelt. Sarah’s city was once an industrial powerhouse but has, over the last several decades, been reduced to a city in search of its soul and purpose. Many of its inhabitants have proceeded likewise and have found themselves in the constant hunt to get by. Sarah is no different. Sarah is a lonely, long-time student and tea shop clerk who dreams of being a food scientist and falling in love. She is passionate about studying the science behind tastes and flavors and longs to create new combinations for people to enjoy but is held back by lack of opportunities and the constant headwind of dealing with her mother’s illness.

When an old crush, the worldly and cultured Michael Kensington, enters her life she thinks her fortunes have changed. Though exciting, all is not what it seems and tragedy and crisis lurk close at hand.

Sarah’s world is populated with a variety of colorful characters, such as: 

  • Loretta: Sarah’s boss and best friend who provides love and support as she tries to keep Sarah moving in the right direction.
  • Beatrice: a wealthy busybody with a penchant for high style.
  • Bernard: a patient old regular who is spending his twilight years yelling at newspapers and people watching. A constant presence at the tea shop, he is often a source of good humor and good advice.


When Sarah’s adventure leads her to Marseille, France, she encounters Sam, an Armenian restauranteur who regales Sarah with tales of history and tragedy, while offering her a new world of tastes in the Armenian tradition. Sarah’s trip to Marseille broadens her horizons but leaves her facing a life-altering decision.

You will love this book if you like journeys of self-discovery, tales of love and loss, and worlds populated with interesting and colorful characters.

Sarah’s Still Life speaks to fiction fans everywhere who want to experience a tale of struggle and the small triumphs of everyday life through the lens of a long-suffering daughter and student who encounters love and loss on her way to self-discovery.

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Matthew Kopf is an author, lawyer, photographer, and artist with a background in teaching, management, and legal affairs. 

Matthew is passionate about creating fiction that delights the reader and expands their perspective. While Matthew has also authored several short stories and has an ever-running list of ideas and stories-yet-to-be-told, Sarah’s Still Life is Matthew’s first full-length novel.

Matthew lives with his charming and intelligent wife and their daughter in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. When not chasing around their active two-year-old, Matthew can typically be found behind a piano or a drum set on a search for musical enlightenment.

For more information, visit Matthew at www.matthewkopf.com  or you can connect with him at contact@matthewkopf.com and @matthewkopf on Twitter.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SarahsStillLife and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Matthew Kopf
